This position requires flying in the Department's airplane and operating the camera used for collecting aerial photograph.

This position processes and verifies the LiDAR system data entry, will work with complex LiDAR and Photography data for the Location and Survey Section as part of the Statewide Topographic mapping and other department needs such as court exhibits and drainage mapping. Is also responsible for computing and analyzing data as collected by the department or consultant's LiDAR units. Reviews the data for accuracy and prepares it for further use in the statewide mapping program as well as for drainage mapping and court exhibits. This position is also required to operate the LiDAR system as well as the digital aerial camera system for the department and includes making and reviewing flight planning for the collection of data.
Two years of experience in using geographic information systems (GIS), using digital mapping and/or surveying technology, or in aerial photography
column2: OR

column1: Twelve semester hours in a computer science, GIS, or geospatial field plus one year of experience in using geographic information systems, using digital mapping and/or surveying technology, or in aerial photography
column2: OR

column1: A bachelor’s degree with twelve semester hours in a computer science, GIS, or geospatial field.
The official job specifications for this role, as defined by the State Civil Service, can be foundhere.

Collects data by flying in the Department's airplane and operating the camera used for collecting aerial photography. Also, takes raw LiDAR data and processes it through post processing software to combine raw data with GPS data and Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU) data to produce geo-referenced LiDAR files. The incumbent also identifies data voids and verifies data sets covering the entire project extents, generates LAS files by merging GPS, IMU and LiDAR data via software packages, validates and adjusts relative accuracy for adjacent flight lines, shifts LiDAR point cloud points to match ground control points, classifies point cloud data as determined by appropriate software.
Utilizes department software to process LiDAR and aerial photography data for the department, the statewide topographic mapping program and for court exhibits.
Utilizes department software to prepare for the collection of LiDAR data for the statewide mapping program as well as other tasks as required by the department for the statewide mapping program.
Utilizes department software to set up flight mission planning for drainage mapping and topographic mapping for the department.
May be required to perform other duties as necessary, including, but not limited to, emergency/disaster support activities.
Career Progression: Vacancies may be filled from this recruitment as a GIS Analyst 1, GIS Analyst 2 or GIS Analyst 3 depending on the level of experience of the selected applicant(s).

This position processes and verifies the LiDAR system data entry, will work with complex LiDAR and Photography data for the Location and Survey Section as part of the Statewide Topographic mapping and other department needs such as court exhibits and drainage mapping. Also, takes raw LiDAR data and processes it through post processing software to combine raw data with GPS data and Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU) data to produce geo-referenced LiDAR files. The incumbent also identifies data voids and verifies data sets covering the entire project extents, generates LAS files by merging GPS, IMU and LiDAR data via software packages, validates and adjusts relative accuracy for adjacent flight lines, shifts LiDAR point cloud points to match ground control points, classifies point cloud data as determined by appropriate software.

    • Utilizes department software to prepare for the collection of LiDAR data for the statewide mapping program as well as other tasks as required by the department for the statewide mapping program.
    • Utilizes department software to set up flight mission planning for drainage mapping and topographic mapping for the department.
    • May be required to perform other duties as necessary, including, but not limited to, emergency/disaster support activities.

CGI Federal is looking for experienced Support Associates to support the Buffalo Passport Agency. The ideal candidates should possess excellent communication skills, have experience in working with customers in a front facing capacity, and have the ability to work as a team in a fast-paced environment.
Operate various equipment for high-speed scanning, mail out, and metering of mail.
Prepare and mail envelopes with correct passport and corresponding supporting documents.
Box and archive files for storage purposes.
Interface with passport applicants at Agency/Center Information and Will-Call counters:
At the Information Station, ensure appointment is scheduled
Review passport application, photograph, identification and supporting documentation for completeness prior to adjudication
Ensure the application and documents comply with Passport requirements, photograph meets Passport standards, and customer is provided fee information.
Prior to distributing to applicants, print and review passport books for accuracy and quality.
Generate a credit card payment from the applicant and distribute completed batches to the Cashier's Office. Verify all completed transactions and run designated reports.
Assist with Acceptance Agent training: prepare training materials, conduct ""meet-and- greets,"" set-up training sessions, conduct office tours, etc.
Assist CSM in maintaining and cataloging electronic records of passport acceptance facilities.
Contact applicants to request necessary documents.
Resolve undeliverable mail items by contacting the customer and appropriately documenting all actions taken in a SharePoint application.
Per the guidance of DOS Passport Specialists, generate correspondence to resolve application discrepancies, including: Return to Sender (RTS), Rewrites and Re-issues, and re-batch into the system.
Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Three years of general office experience: follow a number of specific procedures in completing several clerical steps performed in a prescribed or slightly varied sequence, such as coding and filing documents in an extensive alphabetical file
column2: simple posting to individual accounts
column3: opening mail

column5: and calculating and posting charges to departmental accounts

Looking for qualified AR Cash Posters to join our team!
We are searching for an AR Cash Poster to join our community that is a team builder, and excited about the opportunity to assist in building a culture.
If you are an AR Cash Poster that has business acumen, is team-oriented, driven, and excited about the opportunity to build a culture, then we have the perfect opportunity for you!
Pay rate: Competitive pay, along with holiday pay and paid time off (PTO) program.

Innovative Purchasing Program: We offer a purchasing program that allows you to buy thousands of products (technology, furniture, clothing, etc.) and pay over time. Zero interest, no credit check, no hidden fees.

Access to online learning 24/7: Our Learning Management System offers over 1,500 courses for senior care, health and human services industry. Use it for free to help grow your own personal and professional development. Data base includes, MS Office and Leadership/Supervisory content. Available via computer or mobile, and many courses are offered in alternative languages.
Phone and auto discounts: Up to 20% on employee personal wireless accounts and auto rentals through designated vendors.
Employee Assistance Fund: You are always there for others. Let us be there for you. In unexpected catastrophic situations you can confidentially apply for help.
Post all payments from Medicare, Medicaid, HMO/Insurance, etc. related to A/R transactions within department guidelines.
Review of billing deposit logs and posting journals to ensure systems are in balance.
Compare billing logs to checks to be received to ensure timely posting.
Research and review cash posting discrepancies and make corrections as necessary.
Assist facility office managers and CBO with complex accounts receivables questions re: cash posting reconciliations.
Review and process refunds in accordance with department policies.
Research credit balance accounts for resolution/refund as required.
Record daily collection of cash receipts and deposit to appropriate account.
Complete month end close in a timely manner.
Adhere to established reporting procedures and ensure that the numbers balance.
Provide innovative, responsible healthcare with the creation and implementation of new ideas and concepts that continually improve systems and processes to achieve superior results.
Must possess a minimum of a High School degree or equivalent.
Must possess two (2) years' experience related to cash posting, preferably in a health care environment.
Experience in bookkeeping, banking, or accounting practices highly desired.
Experience in health care accounting preferred but not required.
Must possess the ability to review and interpret remittance advices.
You must be qualified, compassionate, and dedicated to a job well done.

We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.
If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Interested?

Perks And Benefits

  • Pay rate: Competitive pay, along with holiday pay and paid time off (PTO) program.
  • Innovative Purchasing Program: We offer a purchasing program that allows you to buy thousands of products (technology, furniture, clothing, etc.) and pay over time. Zero interest, no credit check, no hidden fees.

Major Responsibilities

  • Post all payments from Medicare, Medicaid, HMO/Insurance, etc. related to A/R transactions within department guidelines.
  • Balance all cash transactions.
  • Review of billing deposit logs and posting journals to ensure systems are in balance.
  • Compare billing logs to checks to be received to ensure timely posting.
  • Research and review cash posting discrepancies and make corrections as necessary.
  • Assist facility office managers and CBO with complex accounts receivables questions re: cash posting reconciliations.
  • Review and process refunds in accordance with department policies.
  • Research credit balance accounts for resolution/refund as required.

  • Record daily collection of cash receipts and deposit to appropriate account.
  • Complete month end close in a timely manner.
  • Adhere to established reporting procedures and ensure that the numbers balance.
  • Provide innovative, responsible healthcare with the creation and implementation of new ideas and concepts that continually improve systems and processes to achieve superior results.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Must possess a minimum of a High School degree or equivalent.
  • Must possess two (2) years' experience related to cash posting, preferably in a health care environment.
  • Experience in bookkeeping, banking, or accounting practices highly desired.
  • Experience in health care accounting preferred but not required.
  • Must possess the ability to review and interpret remittance advices.

At UnitedHealthcare, we’re simplifying the health care experience, creating healthier communities and removing barriers to quality care. The Investigator is responsible for identification, investigation and prevention of healthcare fraud, waste and abuse. The Investigator will utilize claims data, applicable guidelines and other sources of information to identify aberrant billing practices and patterns. The Investigator is responsible to conduct investigations which may include field work to perform interviews and obtain records and/or other relevant documentation.

If you reside within the state of New Jersey, New York, and Pennsylvania, you will enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges. Applicants must be within commutable distance to Philadelphia, Kings, and Essex counties.
Assess complaints of alleged misconduct received within the Company
Investigate low to medium complex cases of fraud, waste and abuse
Detect fraudulent activity by members, providers, employees and other parties against the Company
Develop and deploy the most effective and efficient investigative strategy for each investigation
Maintain accurate, current and thorough case information in the Special Investigations Unit’s (SIU’s) case tracking system
Collect and secure documentation or evidence and prepare summaries of the findings
Participate in settlement negotiations and/or produce investigative materials in support of the latter
Collect, collate, analyze and interpret data relating to fraud, waste and abuse referrals
Ensure compliance of applicable federal/state regulations or contractual obligations
Report suspected fraud, waste and abuse to appropriate federal or state government regulators
Comply with goals, policies, procedures and strategic plans as delegated by SIU leadership
Collaborate with state/federal partners, at the discretion of SIU leadership, to include attendance at workgroups or regulatory meetings
Communicate effectively, including written and verbal forms of communication
Develop goals and objectives, track progress and adapt to changing priorities

What Are The Reasons To Consider Working For UnitedHealth Group? Put It All Together – Competitive Base Pay, a Full And Comprehensive Benefit Program, Performance Rewards, And a Management Team Who Demonstrates Their Commitment To Your Success. Some Of Our Offerings Include
Paid Time Off which you start to accrue with your first pay period plus 8 Paid Holidays
Medical Plan options along with participation in a Health Spending Account or a Health Saving account
Dental, Vision, Life& AD&D Insurance along with Short-term disability and Long-Term Disability coverage
401(k) Savings Plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Voluntary Benefits (pet insurance, legal insurance, LTC Insurance, etc.)
More information can be downloaded at: http://uhg.hr/uhgbenefits

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
2+ years of equivalent work experience with healthcare related employment
Basic level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Word
Ability to travel up to 50% within PA, NY, and NJ
Reside in PA, NY, or NJ – commutable distance to Philadelphia, Kings, and Essex counties
Ability to participate in legal proceedings, arbitration and depositions at the direction of management
Access to reliable transportation and valid US driver’s license
Basic level of knowledge in health care policies, procedures and documentation standards
Basic level of skills in developing investigative strategies
Basic level of knowledge in pharmacy claims processing
Specialized knowledge/training in healthcare fraud, waste and abuse (FWA) investigations
Basic level of knowledge in analyzing data to identify FWA trends
Basic level of knowledge in state and federal regulatory FWA requirements
Operational experience with a pharmacy and/or pharmacy benefits manager (PBM)
All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.

Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, we offer benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with us, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives. The salary for this role will range from $48,700 to $87,000 annually based on full-time employment. We comply with all minimum wage laws as applicable.

At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location, and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups, and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.

UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer under applicable law and qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal laws, rules, or regulations.
UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

This recently awarded long term (5-year) contract involves multiple teams providing Development, Security, and Operations (DevSecOps) services to support the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) in the delivery of their Information Technology (IT) systems, with a primary focus on the Verification Information System (VIS). These teams will be responsible for operations and maintenance activities, as well as standardizing complex, large-scale, internet-facing websites and IT systems within an AWS cloud environment. Utilizing forward-thinking, modern, open-source technologies and managed cloud services, the project emphasizes strong customer engagement to ensure effective and efficient service delivery.

We are currently seeking a motivated, career, and customer-oriented IT Help Desk Engineer (Junior) to join our team supporting this contract. The Help Desk Engineer will troubleshoot issues to provide excellent customer service and support to system stakeholders.
This is a long-term remote/telework position but candidates may require occasional on-site visits in the DC metro area. USCIS is headquartered in Camp Springs, Maryland.
Client requires US citizenship, the ability to obtain and hold a public trust position, and favorable suitability based on a USCIS Background Investigation.
Provide excellent customer service in a timely and efficient manner
Respond quickly and accurately to incoming support requests from customers and urgent emails as prioritized by Government
Leverage a full suite of support and automation tools to resolve issues and requests
Anticipate customer needs and gather necessary information before responding
Troubleshoot issues related to applications, such as emergency software fixes and application interface problems. Guide users through troubleshooting steps as needed
Generate clear and concise responses and emails

Attend status meetings and be prepared to discuss updates
Bachelor's degree in business, IT, or any related field
1+ years of relevant work experience supporting complex projects

Experience or capable of using ticketing systems such as ServiceNow and Salesforce, managing various email inboxes, and interacting directly with the customers (end users) of USCIS systems through tiered support.
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communications skills with the ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical users
Highly motivated, quick learner, organized, strong time management skills and attention to detail
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and other office productivity tools, with aptitude to learn new software and systems
Critical thinking, analytical, and problem-solving skills

Utilizing forward-thinking, modern, open-source technologies and managed cloud services, the project emphasizes strong customer engagement to ensure effective and efficient service delivery.

Clearance

Responsibilities

  • Respond quickly and accurately to incoming support requests from customers and urgent emails as prioritized by Government

Perform a number of routine tasks following set procedures in the field of Administration/Support/Service. Some problem-solving ability is required.

Responsibilities: Produce, update, and provide best practice support on a wide range of Microsoft documents, databases, and other departmental systems. Prepare routine letters, email, minutes of meetings, and reports for approval by more senior colleagues or a senior executive. Arrange venues, equipment, catering, accommodations, and travel for participants arriving from various locations to ensure the smooth running of medium-scale events. Assign short-term work schedules to a team of subordinates in order to achieve expectations while following established timelines. Help others get the most out of internal communications systems by offering support and advice. Create a local document management system for an office or department. Prepare moderately complex documents using a variety of applications for technology devices, such as standard office software. Also responsible for gathering and summarizing data for reports. Provide operational support by performing a range of routine activities using existing systems and protocols. Help manage clients by carrying out standard activities and providing support to others. Help manage internal clients by carrying out standard activities and providing support to others. Produce accurate reports for others by collecting data from a variety of standard sources and inputting it into standard formats. Help others get the most out of data management systems by providing support and advice. Produce, update, and provide best practice support on complex Microsoft documents, databases, and other departmental systems, advising colleagues as needed and using expertise to help improve processes. Prepare tailored letters, emails, and more complex reports and agendas and minutes of meetings for approval by a board-level executive. Schedule appointments, make arrangements for meetings and conferences, and organize travel plans, following instructions to ensure more senior colleagues or a senior executive make the best use of their time. Job Description Summary

Perform a number of routine tasks following set procedures in the field of Administration/Support/Service. Some problem-solving ability is required.

Job Description

Responsibilities: Produce, update, and provide best practice support on a wide range of Microsoft documents, databases, and other departmental systems. Prepare routine letters, email, minutes of meetings, and reports for approval by more senior colleagues or a senior executive. Arrange venues, equipment, catering, accommodations, and travel for participants arriving from various locations to ensure the smooth running of medium-scale events. Assign short-term work schedules to a team of subordinates in order to achieve expectations while following established timelines. Help others get the most out of internal communications systems by offering support and advice. Create a local document management system for an office or department. Prepare moderately complex documents using a variety of applications for technology devices, such as standard office software. Also responsible for gathering and summarizing data for reports. Provide operational support by performing a range of routine activities using existing systems and protocols. Help manage clients by carrying out standard activities and providing support to others. Help manage internal clients by carrying out standard activities and providing support to others. Produce accurate reports for others by collecting data from a variety of standard sources and inputting it into standard formats. Help others get the most out of data management systems by providing support and advice. Produce, update, and provide best practice support on complex Microsoft documents, databases, and other departmental systems, advising colleagues as needed and using expertise to help improve processes. Prepare tailored letters, emails, and more complex reports and agendas and minutes of meetings for approval by a board-level executive. Schedule appointments, make arrangements for meetings and conferences, and organize travel plans, following instructions to ensure more senior colleagues or a senior executive make the best use of their time. Supervise a team performing routine work. Design own monthly schedule and, if necessary, assign work to others in order to speed up office workflow and ensure high-priority tasks get done. Develop knowledge and understanding of the organization's policies and procedures and of relevant regulatory codes and codes of conduct to ensure own work adheres to those standards. Obtain authorization from a supervisor or manager for any exceptions from mandatory procedure. Support others by carrying out a range of procurement activities. Involves following established procedures. Prioritize own workflow and ensure work is completed to the required standards of productivity, quality, and timeliness

4275306850,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-cloud-solutions-entry-level-at-lensa-4275306850?position=8&pageNum=10&refId=kxKjwu24DjUapXA1%2Bo2E%2FA%3D%3D&trackingId=bTxtTpuUJEwOaEmudW2%2BTA%3D%3D,Data Engineer Cloud Solutions - Entry Level,Lensa,"Plano, TX","Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for USAA. Clicking ""Apply Now"" or ""Read more"" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

At USAA, our mission is to empower our members to achieve financial security through highly competitive products, exceptional service and trusted advice. We seek to be the #1 choice for the military community and their families.

Embrace a fulfilling career at USAA, where our core values – honesty, integrity, loyalty and service – define how we treat each other and our members. Be part of what truly makes us special and impactful.

USAA is seeking a motivated entry level Data Engineer to join the team. In this entry-level position, you will play a vital role in developing and supporting data-driven solutions for Channel Data Analytics, focusing on areas such as customer interactions, digital communications, and written correspondence. In this role, you will develop and support data pipelines and ETL processes and contribute to the design and implementation of data warehousing solutions. In addition to these core tasks, you will get the opportunity to write and complete SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and loading. In this role, you will collaborate with data analysts and stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver effective solutions.

We offer a flexible work environment that requires an individual to be in the office 4 days per week . This position will be based in Plano, TX. Relocation assistance is not available for this position.
Assists in the full life cycle of data engineering to include analysis, solution design, data pipeline engineering, testing, deployment, scheduling, and production support.
May assist in the implementation of technical solutions for data engineering and analytic systems.
Executes tests scripts and may begin to deploy data pipeline code with assistance from senior team members.

Monitors the execution of data pipelines in the production environment. May begin to troubleshoot and return failures to service. Escalates failures through proper channels to ensure timely resolution.
Participates in design and code review sessions.
Actively participates in Agile ceremonies such as daily standup, iteration planning, backlog grooming, and retrospective sessions.
Develops basic familiarity of data management best practices by participating in trainings, reviewing documentation, and reading code from existing solutions.
Develops knowledge and understanding of business products and processes.
Builds on data management principles and methodologies to include new and emerging related technologies.
Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled in accordance with risk and compliance policies and procedures.
Bachelor’s degree: OR 4 years of related experience (in addition to the minimum years of experience required) may be substituted in lieu of degree
column2: OR Approved certification from CodeUp, Galvanize, VetFIT (Veterans for IT) or eFIT (Employees for IT)

column1: Up to 2 years of data engineering, data analysis or software development experience implementing data solutions.

Basic understanding of one or more of the following: SQL, Relational Databases, Python, UNIX, UNIX Shell Scripting (Bash), Cloud Data Engineering (AWS/GCP), Cloud Data Warehousing (Snowflake, Redshift), Control-M, ETL Tools (Datastage, Informatica, DBT), Big Data Technologies (Hadoop Stack).
Basic understanding of Agile methodology practices.
Familiarity of Cloud technologies and tools.
2+ years Financial Services Data Engineering experience
1+ years’ experience with Data Cloud Technologies such as Snowflake, AWS, and / or Fivetran.
1+ years proficiency in Python for data analysis and data solutions development
US military experience through military service or a military spouse/domestic partner
Compensation range: The salary range for this position is: $74,240.00- $113,827.00

USAA does not provide visa sponsorship for this role. Please do not apply for this role if at any time (now or in the future) you will need immigration support (i.e., H-1B, TN, STEM OPT Training Plans, etc.).

USAA views its internship program as a pipeline to possible future employment. This is based on an individual’s graduation date, performance, role qualifications, and business need. To be considered for possible future employment opportunities interns must meet the full-time work eligibility requirements for any given role. Thus, interns should ensure their sponsorship status and other provided information is accurately reflected on their intern application. Inadequate completion of your application may render you ineligible for further consideration in the hiring process.

Compensation: USAA has an effective process for assessing market data and establishing ranges to ensure we remain competitive. You are paid within the hourly range based on your experience and market data of the position. The actual hourly rate for this role may vary by location.

The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.

Benefits: At USAA our employees enjoy best-in-class benefits to support their physical, financial, and emotional wellness. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, 401(k), pension, life insurance, parental benefits, adoption assistance, paid time off program with paid holidays plus 16 paid volunteer hours, and various wellness programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education assists employees with their professional goals.
Interns may not be eligible for all benefits, for more details on our outstanding benefits, please visit our benefits page on USAAjobs.com.

Applications for this position are accepted on an ongoing basis, this posting will remain open until the position is filled. Thus, interested candidates are encouraged to apply the same day they view this posting.

USAA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
If you are an existing USAA employee, please use the internal career site in OneSource to apply.
Please do not type your first and last name in all caps.

4275337844,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analyst-business-intelligence-facilities-at-inter-miami-cf-4275337844?position=9&pageNum=10&refId=kxKjwu24DjUapXA1%2Bo2E%2FA%3D%3D&trackingId=Njve%2Fa0s8qErviwxNmVJlg%3D%3D,"Analyst, Business Intelligence (Facilities)",Inter Miami CF,"Fort Lauderdale, FL","Description

At Inter Miami CF we're looking for a highly skilled Analyst with strong analytical and quantitative skills to join the Business Intelligence team, supporting our Facilities team. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to translate data into actionable insights and communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders. This role involves collecting and analyzing data from various sources, such as F&B, Parking, Merchandising, Wi-Fi users at the venue, etc. to maximize revenue and understand fan behavior and trends.
Collect, clean, and analyze data from diverse sources including F&B, Parking, Merchandising, Wi-Fi users.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor key metrics and performance indicators.
Utilize statistical techniques and data analysis tools to interpret data and identify trends, patterns, and opportunities
Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable insights for various stakeholders, including non-technical audiences.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support.
Assist in the development of data-driven strategies to enhance product offerings.
Continuously monitor industry trends and best practices in data analytics.
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Sports Management, Finance, Economics, or Advanced Statistics (Master’s degree is a plus).
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in a similar role.
Demonstrated success in designing, implementing, and optimizing revenue strategies to maximize profitability and fan engagement.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst working with different data sources such as parking, ticket sales, F&B, merchandise, etc.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills with keen attention to detail. Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., SQL, Excel, R, Python).
Proven experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights effectively to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively.
Inter Miami CF offers a competitive compensation package, medical, dental, vision, disability insurance, life insurance and 401k retirement plan.
All applicants must pass a pre-employment background check.

Inter Miami CF is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

  • Strong analytical and quantitative skills with keen attention to detail. Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., SQL, Excel, R, Python).

Contract Duration: 3 months (with potential for permanent hire)

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join a dynamic team on a contract-to-hire basis. This is an exciting opportunity to make a tangible impact by transforming data into actionable insights that drive strategic decisions.
Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights.
Build and maintain dashboards and reports to support various business functions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver tailored solutions.
Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs).
Present data findings through compelling visualizations and storytelling.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through rigorous validation and quality checks.
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics).
Proven experience in data analysis or business intelligence roles.
Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker, Excel).
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to simplify complex data.
This is a trial-to-hire opportunity. Candidates should be open to transitioning into a permanent role after the initial 3-month contract, contingent on performance.

Data Analyst (Contract-to-Hire)


Location: Zurich (On-site)

Start Date: ASAP

Contract Duration: 3 months (with potential for permanent hire)

Workload: 100%


About the Role

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join a dynamic team on a contract-to-hire basis. This is an exciting opportunity to make a tangible impact by transforming data into actionable insights that drive strategic decisions.


Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights.
  • Build and maintain dashboards and reports to support various business functions.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver tailored solutions.
  • Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs).
  • Present data findings through compelling visualizations and storytelling.
  • Ensure data accuracy and integrity through rigorous validation and quality checks.


Required Skills &
column2:
Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics).
  • Proven experience in data analysis or business intelligence roles.
  • Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker, Excel).
  • Familiarity with Python or R.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to simplify complex data.
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken).


Additional Information


This is a trial-to-hire opportunity. Candidates should be open to transitioning into a permanent role after the initial 3-month contract, contingent on performance.

Il prendra en charge les développements et la maintenance des produits de reporting pour plusieurs domaines d’activités de Rolex et/ou Tudor. Il sera le principal interlocuteur de nos répondants métiers sur ce(s) domaine(s).
Analyser et interpréter les données pour en extraire des insights stratégiques et opérationnels, contribuant directement aux activités de Rolex et Tudor
Produire des sources de données et des visualisations avec des outils de premier plan tels que Tableau et Power BI, afin de faciliter la prise de décision
Optimiser ces produits pour garantir une expérience utilisateur conforme aux attentes
Participer activement à l'amélioration de la qualité des données et garantir la fiabilité des analyses
Contribuer à l'automatisation et à l'optimisation des processus analytiques, avec une compréhension approfondie des outils de transformation de données
Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes de data engineering pour garantir l'intégrité et la pertinence des données utilisées dans les analyses

Assister activement la communauté des Data Citizens dans l'élaboration de produits de données qualitatifs, réutilisables et innovants via des communications, accompagnements et formations des utilisateurs
Formation supérieure en informatique ou ingénierie EPF ou HES, avec une spécialisation en analyse de données
Expérience significative dans des postes de Data Engineer et/ou Data Analyst, acquise dans des environnements OnPrem et Cloud
Langue maternelle française avec une bonne maîtrise de l'anglais
Maîtrise de technologies telles que Snowflake, Dataiku, BW4Hana Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse ou Talend, pour optimiser le traitement et l'exploitation des données
Bonne maîtrise des outils de visualisation tels que Tableau et Power BI
Forte culture de l'automatisation, associée à un engagement envers la qualité des données et l'observabilité pour maintenir un contrôle rigoureux
Bonne connaissance des concepts de sécurité de l'information
Sens du relationnel et force de proposition
Haut degré d'autonomie dans la recherche de solutions, capacité à évaluer la qualité des livrables
Fortes compétences interpersonnelles et capacité à travailler efficacement en équipe
Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.
Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).

Pour notre division Systèmes d'information, nous sommes à la recherche d'un Data Analyst (H/F), dont la mission principale au sein du groupe Data Analytics sera de modéliser, interpréter et valoriser les données dans un environnement technologique en pleine évolution. Il prendra en charge les développements et la maintenance des produits de reporting pour plusieurs domaines d’activités de Rolex et/ou Tudor. Il sera le principal interlocuteur de nos répondants métiers sur ce(s) domaine(s).

Responsabilités

  • Analyser et interpréter les données pour en extraire des insights stratégiques et opérationnels, contribuant directement aux activités de Rolex et Tudor
  • Produire des sources de données et des visualisations avec des outils de premier plan tels que Tableau et Power BI, afin de faciliter la prise de décision
  • Optimiser ces produits pour garantir une expérience utilisateur conforme aux attentes
  • Participer activement à l'amélioration de la qualité des données et garantir la fiabilité des analyses
  • Contribuer à l'automatisation et à l'optimisation des processus analytiques, avec une compréhension approfondie des outils de transformation de données
  • Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes de data engineering pour garantir l'intégrité et la pertinence des données utilisées dans les analyses
  • Assister activement la communauté des Data Citizens dans l'élaboration de produits de données qualitatifs, réutilisables et innovants via des communications, accompagnements et formations des utilisateurs

Profil

  • Formation supérieure en informatique ou ingénierie EPF ou HES, avec une spécialisation en analyse de données
  • Expérience significative dans des postes de Data Engineer et/ou Data Analyst, acquise dans des environnements OnPrem et Cloud
  • Langue maternelle française avec une bonne maîtrise de l'anglais
  • Maîtrise de technologies telles que Snowflake, Dataiku, BW4Hana Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse ou Talend, pour optimiser le traitement et l'exploitation des données
  • Bonne maîtrise des outils de visualisation tels que Tableau et Power BI
  • Forte culture de l'automatisation, associée à un engagement envers la qualité des données et l'observabilité pour maintenir un contrôle rigoureux
  • Bonne connaissance des concepts de sécurité de l'information
  • Sens du relationnel et force de proposition
  • Haut degré d'autonomie dans la recherche de solutions, capacité à évaluer la qualité des livrables
  • Fortes compétences interpersonnelles et capacité à travailler efficacement en équipe

Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).

4264621777,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-3-month-internship-at-kfc-europe-4264621777?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=YSfb7G%2BLNBqaoeDTQIZT7g%3D%3D&trackingId=%2FTxk5ceg8zya39%2BRQqwUkQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst (3-month internship),KFC Europe,"Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland","Job Description
Support our Commercial Finance Lead in building our regional data & analytics capabilities
Enable common Western Europe product hierarchy and product mix analysis standardization (60%)
Map local product hierarchies to WEBU hierarchy
Enable pricing strategy across Western Europe (20%)
Analyze Items by price ranges & gaps vs competition
Enable Franchisee data sharing (Sales Growth, brand Metrics, Operations metrics 20%)
Test Franchisee user accesses / Test brand & ops metrics
Power BI knowledge is a plus
Ability to connect with cross functional teams

From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin’ good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can’t share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.

We’re part of Yum! Brands, Inc.—collaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central & Eastern Europe and France. With more than 30 official languages in 150 different franchises, connecting with us is easier than ever. If you really want to do the math, we’ve also got 2,200 restaurants in 40 countries. Either way, we keep it original.

For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow’s technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you’ve ever tasted. We exist to feed people’s potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.

We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. At our Pan Europe Academy, we develop leadership and train all levels of restaurant and corporate employees. From Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to Individual Development Plans, we build meaningful careers that have real impact.
The bottom line? We bring it. Curious? We hope so.
Bring your spark, your spice and your original story. At KFC Pan Europe, we’re grounded in winning, celebrating, recognizing, welcoming and belonging. We've got a big table. You have a seat at it.

About Us

From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin’ good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can’t share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.

We’re part of Yum! Brands, Inc.—collaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central &
column6:
Eastern Europe and France. With more than 30 official languages in 150 different franchises, connecting with us is easier than ever. If you really want to do the math, we’ve also got 2,200 restaurants in 40 countries. Either way, we keep it original.

For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow’s technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you’ve ever tasted. We exist to feed people’s potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.

We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. 4260054961,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/power-bi-consultant-at-synechron-4260054961?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=YSfb7G%2BLNBqaoeDTQIZT7g%3D%3D&trackingId=rl%2FBUsXv%2F%2FWaM2W6dy07uw%3D%3D,Power BI Consultant,Synechron,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","At Synechron, we believe in the power of digital to transform businesses for the better. Our global consulting firm combines creativity and innovative technology to deliver industry-leading digital solutions. Synechron’s progressive technologies and optimization strategies span end-to-end Consulting, Design, Cloud, Data, and Engineering, servicing an array of noteworthy financial services and technology firms. Through research and development initiatives in our FinLabs we develop solutions for modernization, from Blockchain and Artificial Intelligence to Data Science models, Digital Underwriting, mobile-first applications and more. Over the last 20+ years, our company has been honored with multiple employer awards, recognizing our commitment to our talented teams. With top clients to boast about, Synechron has a global workforce of 14,500+, and has 58 offices in 21 countries within key global markets.
For more information on the company, please visit our website or LinkedIn community.
We are in constant search for talented and enthusiastic people who are passionate about working with our clients and being the best ambassadors for our company.
To reinforce the Synechron Switzerland team, we are looking for a Power BI Consultant. Our mission is for one of our clients, a Private Bank in Geneva.
Collecting and documenting the needs identified from MIS report consumers
Identifying and communicating to the Data Hub team the data requirements identified for the reports
Performing data visualization developments (Power BI) for the Wealth Management division
Monitoring monthly and daily data loading processes to anticipate production incidents
Ensuring data quality, as well as to promoting high quality service
Understanding complex management processes and applying efficient solutions
Providing support for functional, operational and technical system issues
Training the Wealth Management division on Power BI reporting capabilities.
You have knowledge of banking, particularly in investment, which is a plus.
You demonstrate very strong analytical skills.
You have experience with Microsoft Power BI and Fabric,
You have good knowledge of Spark.
You possess SQL knowledge and practical experience.
You are a problem solver and team player with great adaptability skills.
An enriching, dynamic, and stimulating professional experience.
Professional stability with a long-term contract.
A competitive salary package and referral bonuses.
Monthly support to finance your lunches.
The opportunity to be part of a multicultural, supportive, hardworking team driven by values.
Up to 5 days of training per year.
Free and unlimited access to our global E-learning platform -> Over 16,000 modules available.
Annual license to access our banking/finance profession training platform to enhance your knowledge of various banking/financial professions and stay professionally updated.
Support, proximity, regular feedback, and exceptional event.
A certified working environment - GREAT PLACE TO WORK.
If you believe you are the right candidate, please submit your application! We look forward to receiving your application.

Diversity & Inclusion are fundamental to our culture, and Synechron is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. Our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) initiative ‘Same Difference’ is committed to fostering an inclusive culture – promoting equality, diversity and an environment that is respectful to all. We strongly believe that a diverse workforce helps build stronger, successful businesses as a global company. We encourage applicants from across diverse backgrounds, race, ethnicities, religion, age, marital status, gender, sexual orientations, or disabilities to apply. We empower our global workforce by offering flexible workplace arrangements, mentoring, internal mobility, learning and development programs, and more.

4253185810,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-product-analytics-at-getyourguide-4253185810?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=YSfb7G%2BLNBqaoeDTQIZT7g%3D%3D&trackingId=L3hPzhltCwqAop1qNjOJPA%3D%3D,"Data Analyst, Product Analytics",GetYourGuide,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

As a Data Analyst in the Product Analytics team, you will support the Fulfillment mission—improving the post-booking experience, empowering suppliers, and enabling Care to resolve issues efficiently. You’ll work across the analytics funnel to drive measurement, strategy, and decision-making. Example problems include quantifying the impact of improved pickup selection on defect rate, identifying drivers of booking issues, or evaluating how post-booking communication affects traveller sentiment and retention.
Design and analyze A/B tests to evaluate product changes and guide decision-making.
Develop quantitative analysis to drive product decisions
Help the product teams to learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ product strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product development and evaluation.
2-3 years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity, reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Ability to communicate data insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders, influencing decisions across product, engineering, and operations
Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.
We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team Mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

As a Data Analyst in the Product Analytics team, you will support the Fulfillment mission—improving the post-booking experience, empowering suppliers, and enabling Care to resolve issues efficiently. You’ll work across the analytics funnel to drive measurement, strategy, and decision-making. Example problems include quantifying the impact of improved pickup selection on defect rate, identifying drivers of booking issues, or evaluating how post-booking communication affects traveller sentiment and retention.

You will

  • Design and analyze A/B tests to evaluate product changes and guide decision-making.
  • Develop quantitative analysis to drive product decisions
  • Help the product teams to learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
  • Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ product strategy and success.
  • Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
  • Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product development and evaluation.

Who You Are

  • 2-3 years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
  • Curiosity, reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem solving.
  • Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
  • Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
  • Ability to communicate data insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders, influencing decisions across product, engineering, and operations

Nice to have

  • Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
  • Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
  • Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
  • Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
  • Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.

How We Set You Up For Success

  • Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences.
  • The opportunity to contribute to the
  • A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
  • Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
  • English-speaking office environment
  • Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
  • Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
  • Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
  • GetYourGuide vouchers.

And more…

Drive operational excellence and commercial performance by integrating data-led insights with a strong business and customer lens. This role will bridge operations, finance, and customer experience to support strategic decision-making.

This position has direct impact on the entire KFC Western Europe Business Unit Corporate, Franchisee & Restaurant System and indirect impact, through know how sharing, to the Pan-Europe and global teams.
Analyze core operations and commercial data (e.g., OSAT, sales, transactions, compliance, training, margin drivers) to generate actionable insights.

Lead post-implementation reviews of commercial and operational initiatives.

Ad-hoc customer analysis – understanding what our customers are telling us through surveys, social media and reviews to articulate satisfiers, dissatisfiers and areas of risk through the end-to-end customer & Restaurant Member journeys
Lead unbiased approach to field/operations/technology launch reviews/diagnostics
Generate regular reports, with a view to streamlining reporting by creating automated dashboards.

column1: From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin’ good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can’t share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.

We’re part of Yum! Brands, Inc.—collaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central & Eastern Europe and France. With more than 30 official languages in 150 different franchises, connecting with us is easier than ever. If you really want to do the math, we’ve also got 2,200 restaurants in 40 countries. Either way, we keep it original.

For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow’s technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you’ve ever tasted. We exist to feed people’s potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.

We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. At our Pan Europe Academy, we develop leadership and train all levels of restaurant and corporate employees. From Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to Individual Development Plans, we build meaningful careers that have real impact.
The bottom line? We bring it. Curious? We hope so.
Bring your spark, your spice and your original story. At KFC Pan Europe, we’re grounded in winning, celebrating, recognizing, welcoming and belonging. We've got a big table. You have a seat at it.

From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin’ good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can’t share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.

We’re part of Yum! Brands, Inc.—collaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central &
column13:

For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow’s technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you’ve ever tasted. We exist to feed people’s potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.

We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. Job Title: Technical Requirements Engineer

Location: Zurich, Switzerland

Type: Permanent Position

Mode: Hybrid


Job Description:

This is a pure analysis and documentation role — not implementation.

Customer is undergoing a strategic transformation to decommission or partially replace its existing integration layer, primarily built on Informatica PowerCenter and Oracle.

The initiative involves:

  • Analyzing current data integration logic.
  • Documenting business logic embedded in ETL and SQL views.
  • Defining implementation-ready requirements for future architecture.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Analyze data consumption patterns of assigned applications.
  • Identify and document business logic from PowerCenter and Oracle views.
  • Translate findings into structured technical requirements.
  • Collaborate with architects, PMs, and downstream teams.

Must-Have Skills:

  • Requirements Engineering: Proven experience in writing precise, high-quality technical/business requirements
  • SQL Expertise: Strong command of Oracle SQL
  • ETL Understanding: Ability to interpret ETL logic, especially PowerCenter
  • Communication: Fluent English
column2:
able to engage with technical and business teams
  • Banking Domain: Experience in banking (positions, transactions, instruments)
  • Independence: Self-sufficient, able to work under pressure
  • Hands-on PowerCenter experience
  • Familiarity with banking use cases or data migration projects


    • Required experience and skills:

    • Skilled in Oracle SQL, Informatica PowerCenter and Requirements Engineering to retrieve the data flows and business logics and document them into requirements for downstream applications
    • Proven ability to analyze complex data flows and business logic, and translate them into clear, concise requirements for data mapping
    • Strong understanding of requirements engineering principles, with the ability to elicit, document, and manage requirements

4268962395,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/sac-data-analyst-at-qim-info-4268962395?position=11&pageNum=0&refId=YSfb7G%2BLNBqaoeDTQIZT7g%3D%3D&trackingId=SLU7ZaszdhfkcsR9wIf2kA%3D%3D,Sac Data Analyst,Qim info,Geneva Metropolitan Area,"📣 Qim info ?
Qim info is an IT services company based in Switzerland for more than 15 years.

Our agencies in Geneva, Lausanne, Basel and Zurich in Switzerland as well as Annecy in France, together already counts 473 consultants and we are always looking for new talents to join our growing and ambitious company.
At the end of 2021, Qim info obtained the Happy at Work® label !
And ranks 3rd in the ICTJournal ranking in 2022.

We are looking for a Data Analytics & Data Management Specialist to design and optimize SAP Analytics Cloud and Datasphere solutions, enabling advanced reporting, planning, and data integration across business processes.
Design and customize analytics applications using SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) for both reporting and planning purposes.
Develop scalable and efficient data models and business layers in SAP Datasphere, integrating data from SAP and non-SAP sources.
Configure and maintain spaces, data flows, consumption models, and semantic views within Datasphere.
Ensure data models are optimized for performance, scalability, integrity, and availability.
Build and enhance interactive dashboards, analytical stories, and self-service visualizations in SAC.
Improve and stabilize existing SAC Planning implementations, including FTE planning, budgeting, data actions, and predictive functions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and integrate SAC and Datasphere into end-to-end business processes.
Provide Level 2 and Level 3 technical support and guidance to internal teams and stakeholders.
Bachelor’s degree in a scientific field with a focus on data analysis and architecture, or equivalent professional experience.
Strong expertise in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) and SAP Datasphere.
Solid experience in data management, ETL processes, and data warehousing.
In-depth knowledge of SAC Planning processes, especially FTE planning and budgeting.
Proficiency in JavaScript or similar scripting languages.
Familiarity with non-SAP BI tools is a plus.
Demonstrated autonomy, proactivity, and a hands-on approach with a strong focus on delivery and problem-solving.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and across hierarchical levels.
Languages: Fluent in French and English
column2: German is an asset.

3e entreprise informatique de Suisse romande (ICT Journal), Qim info c’est surtout un ensemble de consultant.e.s capables d’intervenir à tous les niveaux d’un système d’information sur différents métiers (Études & Développement 💻, Fonctionnel 🔧, Infrastructures & Réseaux 🌐, Data 📊, DevOps 🚀...) et différents secteurs d’activités (Banque 🏦, Finance 💰, Assurance 📜, Luxe ✨, Retail 🛍️, Aéronautique ✈️...).
Avec plus de 650 collaborateurs, nous sommes toujours à la recherche de nouveaux talents ! 🌟

Du hast bereits Erfahrung im Umgang mit Datenmodellen gesammelt und möchtest deine analytischen Fähigkeiten und dein technisches Verständnis gewinnbringend einsetzen? Effizienz und strukturierte Arbeitsweise sind für dich selbstverständlich und du möchtest deine Stärken in einem engagierten Team entfalten?
Dann bist du bei uns als

genau richtig! Als europaweit führendes Multikanalvertriebsunternehmen im Bau- und Kfz-Handwerk sowie in der Industrie bieten wir dir die Möglichkeit, Verantwortung zu übernehmen und die Zukunft aktiv mitzugestalten.

Werde Teil eines traditionsreichen Familienunternehmens, das Innovation grossschreibt und Kundenorientierung lebt. Gemeinsam arbeiten wir an wegweisenden Lösungen und schaffen nachhaltigen Mehrwert – für unsere Kunden, für dich und für die Zukunft.
Regelmässiges Reporting und Ad hoc Analysen für Marketing & Vertrieb
Laufende Preis-, Konditions- und Provisionsspeicherungen in SAP inkl. Datenaufbereitung
Erstellen von Kunden- und Umsatzlisten sowie Verkaufshistorien
Auswertungen und Analyse von Sonderprojekten inkl. Aufbereitung der Daten
Abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung oder betriebswirtschaftliches Studium
Offenheit und Kommunikationsfähigkeit zählen zu deinen Stärken
Du arbeitest gerne selbstständig und strukturiert, hast eine rasche Auffassungsgabe und verfügst über eine ausgeprägte analytische Denkweise
Eine gewissenhafte und exakte Arbeitsweise ist für dich selbstverständlich
Du kommunizierst auf Deutsch, Englisch und Französisch

Die Werte und Nachhaltigkeit eines Familienunternehmens. Gleichzeitig stellen wir uns heute für die Zukunft auf: Kundenzufriedenheit und Digitalisierung stehen dabei für uns stark im Vordergrund. Werde Teil dieses einzigartigen Wandlungsprozesses und ebne mit deiner erfolgreichen Arbeit den Weg für deine und unsere Weiterentwicklung.

165 Mitarbeiter und Mitarbeiterinnen schweizweit. Über 36.000 Artikel für das Bau- und Kfz-Handwerk. Professionelle Beratung und individueller Service mit über 50 Jahren Erfahrung. Kurzum: ein führendes Multikanalvertriebsunternehmen. So viel zu den reinen Fakten. Aber hinter der Marke BERNER steckt etwas noch viel Wertvolleres: ein Familienunternehmen mit ebenso viel Herz wie Verstand.
Wir freuen uns auf deine detaillierte Bewerbung (Lebenslauf mit Foto, Zeugnisse und Arbeitszeugnisse) mit Lohnvorstellung, bevorzugt per E-Mail an: jobs.berner-ch@berner-ag.ch

4255232463,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/merchandising-data-analyst-at-kontoor-brands-inc-4255232463?position=18&pageNum=0&refId=YSfb7G%2BLNBqaoeDTQIZT7g%3D%3D&trackingId=3m6Oa5FX%2FDeWQro8U1NEDw%3D%3D,Merchandising Data Analyst,"Kontoor Brands, Inc.",Geneva Metropolitan Area,"Who We Are

Kontoor Brands, Inc. (KTB) is the parent company of Wrangler®, Lee® and Rock & Republic®, with owned manufacturing facilities in Mexico. Kontoor also owns and operates over 140 retail stores across the globe. Our global company employs more than 13,000 people in 65 countries, with world headquarters in Greensboro, North Carolina, and regional headquarters in Geneva and Hong Kong.

Join Kontoor Brands, home to iconic denim brands Wrangler® and Lee®. We design high-quality apparel that empowers self-expression. Be part of our global community of 17,000+ employees, fostering collaboration and innovation. Grow with us in our Geneva office and shape the future!

Reporting into the EMEA Merchandising Director, the Merchandising Data Analyst collects, processes, analyzes and interprets retail, wholesale and product data to support Merchandising decisions. The Analyst works closely with Merchandising and Planning Team to optimize product assortment, pricing strategies and buying decisions. The key responsibilities include generating reports, identifying trends and providing actionable insights.
Your Responsibilities As Our Merchandising Data Analyst
Collect data from multiple sources and combine it into consolidated reports that are easy to analyze.
Design and generate reports related to sell-through, total business performance, bestsellers, regional performance, and market trends.
Highlight any significant changes or deviations in performance and interpret potential impacts on product and retail strategy.
Work closely with product, retail, and merchandising teams to understand data needs, share insights, and provide recommendations for future strategies.
Track key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure merchandising and product strategies are on track.
Provide additional analysis and custom reports as requested by senior leadership or specific teams to help with decision-making.
A Bachelor’s degree and 3–5 years of experience in retail or merchandising analytics.
A strong understanding of product performance, retail dynamics, and merchandising strategy.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office, with solid experience in SQL, Power BI, or similar data tools.
Fluency in English, both written and verbal
column2: additional European languages are a plus.

column1: Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving ability, and a sharp eye for detail.
A collaborative mindset and the ability to communicate insights clearly and effectively.

We value trust, transparency, collaboration, and innovation, and focus on sustainability and teamwork. Our purpose, mission, and values guide us towards continuous growth and leveraging cutting-edge sustainable technologies.
Casual denim dress code at work and beyond
A multicultural, diverse, and inclusive workforce with employees from various nationalities
Employee resource groups focused on diversity, sustainability, wellbeing, and social activities
Opportunities for professional development and career growth
Advantages of being part of a global company
At Kontoor, we offer a comprehensive benefit package to fit your lifestyle. Our benefits are crafted with the same care as our products.

When our employees are healthy, secure, and well, they bring their best selves to work. Kontoor Brands supports you with a competitive benefits program that provides choice and flexibility to meet your and your family’s needs – now and in the future. We offer resources to support your physical, emotional, social, and financial wellbeing, plus benefits like discounts on our apparel. Kontoor Brands also provides four weeks of Paid Parental Leave to eligible employees who are new parents, Flexible Fridays, and Tuition Reimbursement.

We are proud to offer a workplace culture centered on equitable opportunities and a sense of belonging for all team members. Here we have a global workforce of high-performing teams that both unlocks our individual uniqueness and harnesses our collaborative talents.

What’s the scope?

Reporting into the EMEA Merchandising Director, the Merchandising Data Analyst collects, processes, analyzes and interprets retail, wholesale and product data to support Merchandising decisions. The Analyst works closely with Merchandising and Planning Team to optimize product assortment, pricing strategies and buying decisions. The key responsibilities include generating reports, identifying trends and providing actionable insights.

  • Track key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure merchandising and product strategies are on track.
