4235447029,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/cat-data-and-tools-analyst-6-month-contract-at-partnerre-4235447029?position=19&pageNum=0&refId=YSfb7G%2BLNBqaoeDTQIZT7g%3D%3D&trackingId=IwdS0kmLm1GmURQr3oyCfQ%3D%3D,Cat Data and Tools Analyst (6 month contract),PartnerRe,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","PartnerRe is a leading, privately owned, multi-line global reinsurer with a reputation of financial stability and strength, and a commitment to rebuilding businesses and communities after risk events around the world.

Our mission is to continue to be a financially stable and predictable business partner, supporting our clients with solutions tailored to their needs, delivering superior returns to our owner, providing rewarding opportunities for our people and making a positive contribution to society. To achieve this, we live by our values of Integrity, Performance, Collaboration, Straightforward Communication and Respect and Care.

Core to The PartnerRe Experience is our global nature. No matter where you sit in the company, you are part of something bigger. Our teams represent our truly international mindset, forging connections across office locations and all levels of the organization and building a network of mutual success. The result is a day-to-day experience that will allow you to:
Connect with a community of experts
View Home - PartnerRe Experience e-book to find out more about what it’s like to work at PartnerRe.
We are always looking for bright, proactive individuals to join our team!
Please follow our Careers page for all updates on new positions. We look forward to receiving your application.
PartnerRe is an equal opportunities employer.
Please join our company LinkedIn Page for all updates on new positions that are coming live.

The position is within the Cat Tools and Technology team, which is part of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office responsible for research, modeling, pricing, and portfolio analytics of natural catastrophes (Cat).
The Tools and Technology team is leading the developments of all the Cat applications in collaboration with IT to drive innovation and efficiency in managing risk of natural catastrophes.
This temporary role supports the Cat Tools and Technology team in ongoing projects focusing on improving the reporting and analytics capabilities of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office unit.
In more detail your main tasks are to:
Enhance our existing reporting dashboard to improve efficiency and accuracy in assessing data quality and drivers of portfolio changes.
Replace existing Excel reports and integrate them into R Shiny dashboard.
Automate the production of existing reports through R Markdown.
The role will be based in Zurich.
You are passionate to apply your strong quantitative skills to the development of tools supporting the automation of processes and delivering business solutions.
The ideal candidate would have the following qualifications and personal qualities:
Master degree in computer science, data science, natural sciences (Climatology, Hydrology, Seismology, or similar), or a related quantitative field
Strong programming skills in R or Python and knowledge in databases (e.g., SQL or Snowflake)
Knowledge of R Shiny and R Markdown is a plus
Interest in data manipulation and data visualization
Pro-active, solution oriented with a high level of self initiative
Ability to work well in a team and to contribute towards common goals

PartnerRe provides a working environment in which diversity is valued, where all employees feel welcome, respected, and empowered to perform at their best. We invite you to learn more about D&I at PartnerRe.

PartnerRe is a leading, privately owned, multi-line global reinsurer with a reputation of financial stability and strength, and a commitment to rebuilding businesses and communities after risk events around the world.

Our mission is to continue to be a financially stable and predictable business partner, supporting our clients with solutions tailored to their needs, delivering superior returns to our owner, providing rewarding opportunities for our people and making a positive contribution to society. To achieve this, we live by our values of Integrity, Performance, Collaboration, Straightforward Communication and Respect and Care.

Core to The PartnerRe Experience is our global nature. No matter where you sit in the company, you are part of something bigger. Our teams represent our truly international mindset, forging connections across office locations and all levels of the organization and building a network of mutual success. The result is a day-to-day experience that will allow you to:

Shape your own career

Grow in a supportive environment

Connect with a community of experts

Make an impact

View Home - PartnerRe Experience e-book to find out more about what it’s like to work at PartnerRe.

We are always looking for bright, proactive individuals to join our team!

Please follow our Careers page for all updates on new positions. We look forward to receiving your application.

PartnerRe is an equal opportunities employer.

Please join our company LinkedIn Page for all updates on new positions that are coming live.



Job Description

About this job:

The position is within the Cat Tools and Technology team, which is part of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office responsible for research, modeling, pricing, and portfolio analytics of natural catastrophes (Cat).

The Tools and Technology team is leading the developments of all the Cat applications in collaboration with IT to drive innovation and efficiency in managing risk of natural catastrophes.



About the role:

This temporary role supports the Cat Tools and Technology team in ongoing projects focusing on improving the reporting and analytics capabilities of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office unit.

In more detail your main tasks are to:

  • Enhance our existing reporting dashboard to improve efficiency and accuracy in assessing data quality and drivers of portfolio changes.
  • Replace existing Excel reports and integrate them into R Shiny dashboard.
  • Automate the production of existing reports through R Markdown.

The role will be based in Zurich.



Qualifications

About you:

You are passionate to apply your strong quantitative skills to the development of tools supporting the automation of processes and delivering business solutions.

The ideal candidate would have the following qualifications and personal qualities:

  • Master degree in computer science, data science, natural sciences (Climatology, Hydrology, Seismology, or similar), or a related quantitative field
  • Strong programming skills in R or Python and knowledge in databases (e.g., SQL or Snowflake)
  • Knowledge of R Shiny and R Markdown is a plus
  • Interest in data manipulation and data visualization
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Pro-active, solution oriented with a high level of self initiative
  • Ability to work well in a team and to contribute towards common goals
  • Proficient (written and verbal) in English

Additional Information





PartnerRe provides a working environment in which diversity is valued, where all employees feel welcome, respected, and empowered to perform at their best. We invite you to learn more about D&
column2:
I at PartnerRe.

Thank you,

PartnerRe Hiring Team

The Opportunity

  • Develop statistical rules and algorithms for prioritizing actions and detecting interdependencies
  • Establish mechanisms to track the outcomes of customer satisfaction initiatives

  • Lay the foundation for future predictive models
  • Create a reporting and visualization system for stakeholders

Your Background

  • Experience with data analysis and statistical modeling

4264119350,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4264119350?position=24&pageNum=0&refId=YSfb7G%2BLNBqaoeDTQIZT7g%3D%3D&trackingId=67PnwA5lUkj4EkBIFn1EQQ%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Geneva, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4270762766,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/finance-insights-data-analysis-expert-at-roche-4270762766?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=YSfb7G%2BLNBqaoeDTQIZT7g%3D%3D&trackingId=IsLHvFgYv9e4zxYJT6ALPA%3D%3D,Finance Insights & Data Analysis Expert,Roche,"Basel, Basel, Switzerland","At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

At Roche, our Finance Centers of Excellence have led the way in breaking down silos, removing hierarchies, and working in new ways. We’ve learned from our successes and from the things that haven’t gone so well. We’re better equipped to look at interfaces and synergies, and to understand the risks of creating new silos. The eCoE is focusing on three areas delivering a high-level of financial expertise, innovative insights, and an entrepreneurial mindset that enables agility and flexibility for stakeholders. The eCoE is a talent engine for Finance through capability and network building.

Within the eCOE, the R&D Outcome Based Community (OBC) focuses on delivering a high-level of fifinancial expertise, innovative insights, and an entrepreneurial mindset to influence and support R&D investments at Roche.

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented R&D Benchmarking Analyst to support our R&D organization. This role focuses on collecting, analyzing, and interpreting internal and external data to benchmark R&D performance, costs, timelines, and success rates in molecule development. You will play a critical role in shaping R&D strategy through competitive intelligence, pipeline assessment, and knowledge management.
Conduct R&D benchmarking studies focused on preclinical and clinical development phases across therapeutic areas and molecule types
Main point of contact for external benchmark analysis providing, collecting, validating and analyzing benchmark data points to/from our selected external provider
Analyze molecule development costs, timelines, success rates, using internal project data and external sources
Support cross-functional teams by providing actionable insights to improve pipeline productivity and decision-making
Develop and maintain internal databases and dashboards on R&D metrics, competitive programs, and industry trends
Collaborate with portfolio management, therapeutic area leads, and external providers to contextualize benchmarking insights
Track industry best practices and innovations in drug discovery, translational research, and clinical development
Synthesize large datasets and scientific knowledge into concise reports and presentations for senior leadership
Bachelor or Master’s degree in Finance, Pharmacy, Medicine, or related field
2–5 years of experience in pharmaceutical R&D, competitive intelligence, or management consulting (with pharma focus)
Strong understanding of molecule development stages (discovery to early/late-phase clinical development)
Familiarity with R&D KPIs: time-to-launch, timelines, cost of failure, cycle times, etc
Excellent data analysis and visualization skills (Excel, PP, SAC,...)
Strong communication skills with ability to translate complex data into strategic insights

You have the ability to turn data into insights, comfortable with zooming in and out on details and granularity depending on the situation. You are a collaborative team player with ability to deal with ambiguous situations and deliver in a networked setup. You are courageously authentic with ability to speak up and point out opportunities.
The role is located in Basel.

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.
Let’s build a healthier future, together.
Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

At Roche, our Finance Centers of Excellence have led the way in breaking down silos, removing hierarchies, and working in new ways. We’ve learned from our successes and from the things that haven’t gone so well. We’re better equipped to look at interfaces and synergies, and to understand the risks of creating new silos. The eCoE is focusing on three areas delivering a high-level of financial expertise, innovative insights, and an entrepreneurial mindset that enables agility and flexibility for stakeholders. The eCoE is a talent engine for Finance through capability and network building.

Within the eCOE, the R&
column2: D Outcome Based Community (OBC) focuses on delivering a high-level of fifinancial expertise, innovative insights, and an entrepreneurial mindset to influence and support R&amp
column3:
D investments at Roche.

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented R&
column4: D Benchmarking Analyst to support our R&amp
column5: D organization. This role focuses on collecting, analyzing, and interpreting internal and external data to benchmark R&amp
column6: D performance, costs, timelines, and success rates in molecule development. You will play a critical role in shaping R&amp
column7:
D strategy through competitive intelligence, pipeline assessment, and knowledge management.

The Opportunity:

  • Conduct R&
column8:
D benchmarking studies focused on preclinical and clinical development phases across therapeutic areas and molecule types
  • Main point of contact for external benchmark analysis providing, collecting, validating and analyzing benchmark data points to/from our selected external provider
  • Analyze molecule development costs, timelines, success rates, using internal project data and external sources
  • Support cross-functional teams by providing actionable insights to improve pipeline productivity and decision-making
  • Develop and maintain internal databases and dashboards on R&
column9:
D metrics, competitive programs, and industry trends
  • Collaborate with portfolio management, therapeutic area leads, and external providers to contextualize benchmarking insights
  • Track industry best practices and innovations in drug discovery, translational research, and clinical development
  • Synthesize large datasets and scientific knowledge into concise reports and presentations for senior leadership

    • What you bring:

    • Bachelor or Master’s degree in Finance, Pharmacy, Medicine, or related field
    • 2–5 years of experience in pharmaceutical R&
column10:
D, competitive intelligence, or management consulting (with pharma focus)
  • Strong understanding of molecule development stages (discovery to early/late-phase clinical development)
  • Familiarity with R&
column11:
D KPIs: time-to-launch, timelines, cost of failure, cycle times, etc
  • Experience with huge databases/tools
  • Excellent data analysis and visualization skills (Excel, PP, SAC,...)
  • Strong communication skills with ability to translate complex data into strategic insights

    • You have the ability to turn data into insights, comfortable with zooming in and out on details and granularity depending on the situation. You are a collaborative team player with ability to deal with ambiguous situations and deliver in a networked setup. You are courageously authentic with ability to speak up and point out opportunities.

    The role is located in Basel.

    Who we are

    A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

    Let’s build a healthier future, together.

    Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Bist du ein erfahrener Data Engineer mit einer Leidenschaft für Daten und technische Innovation? Wir von Scigility unterstützen Unternehmen mit Strategie, Expertise und Umsetzung, eine datengetriebene Kultur zu etablieren. Dafür suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine:n Data Engineer, der moderne Data Solutions entwickelt und unsere Kunden in der digitalen Transformation begleitet. Bei Scigility setzen wir auf Zusammenarbeit und modernste Technologien. Wenn du bereit bist, dein Wissen einzubringen und innovative Datenprodukte zu gestalten, dann werde Teil unseres dynamischen Teams!

Möchtest du Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams sein, deine Ideen einbringen und Verantwortung übernehmen? Als Data Engineer entwickelst du skalierbare Datenpipelines, optimierst Datenarchitekturen und ermöglichst Kunden, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen.
Du bist für das Design, die Implementierung und Optimierung von Datenarchitekturen, Pipelines und Data Products zur Sicherstellung effizienter Analyse- und Transformationsprozesse zuständig.
Du wendest Ingestion Patterns und Best Practices in der Datenverarbeitung erfolgreich an.
Du verantwortest die technische Qualität, Implementierung und Optimierung von Testing-Strategien für Datenpipelines und -modelle.
Du bist zuständig für das Stakeholder-Management und die Kommunikation von Risiken, Herausforderungen und Lösungsansätzen.
Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Kunden hinsichtlich Anforderungsanalyse und technischer Umsetzung zusammen.
Du schulst und befähigst unsere Kunden-Teams zur effektiven Nutzung der entwickelten Lösungen.
Du stellst eine umfassende Dokumentation und den Wissenstransfer innerhalb des Teams sicher.
Du leistest einen wertvollen Beitrag zur Weiterentwicklung unseres internen Frameworks und der Verbesserung der Projektstandards und Best Practices.
Was dich zur idealen Besetzung macht:
Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Mindestens 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder Software Engineer mit Fokus auf Datenverarbeitung
Kenntnisse in Big Data- und verteilten Systemen wie Spark, Kafka, Flink, und Trino
Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Optimierung von Datenpipelines (Batch und Streaming) mit Technologien wie Airflow, Meltano oder NiFi
Erfahrung mit Cloud-Technologien, idealerweise in mehr als einer Plattform (Azure, AWS, GCP, Cloudera) und sowohl On-Prem- als auch Cloud-Umgebungen
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten, Problemlösungskompetenz und eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe
Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations-, Teamfähigkeiten und Stakeholder Management Skills
Bereitschaft, vor Ort beim Kunden zu arbeiten
Sehr gute Deutsch- (C2) und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Französisch von Vorteil
Erfahrung in der Beratung und im Umgang mit Kundenprojekten
Kenntnisse im Bereich Data Governance, Compliance und regulatorischen Anforderungen
Erfahrung mit Container- und Orchestrierungstechnologien wie OpenShift, Kubernetes oder Docker
Software-Engineering-Hintergrund, Erfahrung mit weiteren Sprachen wie Java, Scala sind ein Plus
🚀 Bereit für die nächste Herausforderung? Werde Teil von Scigility und gestalte die Zukunft der Datenarchitektur mit uns!

Data Engineer

Zürich/Fribourg


Bist du ein erfahrener Data Engineer mit einer Leidenschaft für Daten und technische Innovation? Wir von Scigility unterstützen Unternehmen mit Strategie, Expertise und Umsetzung, eine datengetriebene Kultur zu etablieren. Dafür suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine:n Data Engineer, der moderne Data Solutions entwickelt und unsere Kunden in der digitalen Transformation begleitet. Bei Scigility setzen wir auf Zusammenarbeit und modernste Technologien. Wenn du bereit bist, dein Wissen einzubringen und innovative Datenprodukte zu gestalten, dann werde Teil unseres dynamischen Teams!



So schaffst du Mehrwert

Möchtest du Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams sein, deine Ideen einbringen und Verantwortung übernehmen? Als Data Engineer entwickelst du skalierbare Datenpipelines, optimierst Datenarchitekturen und ermöglichst Kunden, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen.


Deine Hauptaufgaben:

  • Du bist für das Design, die Implementierung und Optimierung von Datenarchitekturen, Pipelines und Data Products zur Sicherstellung effizienter Analyse- und Transformationsprozesse zuständig.
  • Du wendest Ingestion Patterns und Best Practices in der Datenverarbeitung erfolgreich an.
  • Du verantwortest die technische Qualität, Implementierung und Optimierung von Testing-Strategien für Datenpipelines und -modelle.
  • Du bist zuständig für das Stakeholder-Management und die Kommunikation von Risiken, Herausforderungen und Lösungsansätzen.
  • Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Kunden hinsichtlich Anforderungsanalyse und technischer Umsetzung zusammen.
  • Du schulst und befähigst unsere Kunden-Teams zur effektiven Nutzung der entwickelten Lösungen.
  • Du stellst eine umfassende Dokumentation und den Wissenstransfer innerhalb des Teams sicher.
  • Du leistest einen wertvollen Beitrag zur Weiterentwicklung unseres internen Frameworks und der Verbesserung der Projektstandards und Best Practices.


Was dich zur idealen Besetzung macht:

  • Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
  • Mindestens 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder Software Engineer mit Fokus auf Datenverarbeitung
  • Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse in Python
  • Kenntnisse in Big Data- und verteilten Systemen wie Spark, Kafka, Flink, und Trino
  • Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Optimierung von Datenpipelines (Batch und Streaming) mit Technologien wie Airflow, Meltano oder NiFi
  • Erfahrung mit Cloud-Technologien, idealerweise in mehr als einer Plattform (Azure, AWS, GCP, Cloudera) und sowohl On-Prem- als auch Cloud-Umgebungen
  • Starke analytische Fähigkeiten, Problemlösungskompetenz und eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe
  • Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations-, Teamfähigkeiten und Stakeholder Management Skills
  • Bereitschaft, vor Ort beim Kunden zu arbeiten
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- (C2) und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Französisch von Vorteil



Optionale Superkräfte:

  • Erfahrung in der Beratung und im Umgang mit Kundenprojekten
  • Kenntnisse im Bereich Data Governance, Compliance und regulatorischen Anforderungen
  • Erfahrung mit Container- und Orchestrierungstechnologien wie OpenShift, Kubernetes oder Docker
  • Software-Engineering-Hintergrund, Erfahrung mit weiteren Sprachen wie Java, Scala sind ein Plus


🚀 Bereit für die nächste Herausforderung? Werde Teil von Scigility und gestalte die Zukunft der Datenarchitektur mit uns!

This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

ASTRELYA est un groupe de conseil et d’expertise IT fondé en 2017, présent en France (Paris et régions) et en Suisse (Genève). Aujourd’hui plus de 280 collaborateurs accompagnent nos clients dans l’accélération et la transformation de leurs organisations.
Dans le cadre de notre développement, nous recherchons un Ingénieur Data H/F.
Recueillir les besoins et les demandes des utilisateurs
Participer à la conception et la modélisation des données
Développer le Datahub et mettre en place les flux de données pour interagir avec les applications connexes
Définir et mettre en place des rapports à destination du métier
Intervenir, au besoin, sur la mise en place et la maintenance des pipelines CI/CD
Être garant de la qualité, la cohérence et la fiabilité des choix techniques
Bonnes connaissances d’outils de data visualisation tel que PowerBI
Bonnes connaissances des outils d’intégration continue (Git, Jenkins…)
Connaissance d'Azure Synapse et Azure Logic Apps est un plus
Connaissances des environnements Cloud (GCP, Azure ou AWS), un plus
Connaissances de T-SQL or PL/SQL, un plus
Titre universitaire, ingénieur EPF, HES/ETS en informatique, ou équivalent
Vous êtes organisé(e), curieux(se) et force de proposition
Vous êtes orienté(e) résultat avec une attention particulière pour la satisfaction client
Très bon(ne) communicant(e), vous faites preuve d’un excellent relationnel
Une gestion de carrière personnalisée et un management de proximité
Une politique active de formations / certifications (technique, métier, leadership)
Une offre variée de missions d’expertise
Un engagement RSE fort : Ecovadis Gold
Afterworks, conférences techniques et activités sportives réguliers
L’accès à une plateforme digitalisée proposant des avantages
Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.
Pour découvrir l’ensemble de nos offres : ASTRELYA - Expertise en Transformation Digitale & IT

Ingénieur Data 🎯


ASTRELYA est un groupe de conseil et d’expertise IT fondé en 2017, présent en France (Paris et régions) et en Suisse (Genève). Aujourd’hui plus de 280 collaborateurs accompagnent nos clients dans l’accélération et la transformation de leurs organisations.


Dans le cadre de notre développement, nous recherchons un Ingénieur Data H/F.


Vos Rôles &
column2:
Responsabilités :

  • Recueillir les besoins et les demandes des utilisateurs
  • Participer à la conception et la modélisation des données
  • Développer le Datahub et mettre en place les flux de données pour interagir avec les applications connexes
  • Définir et mettre en place des rapports à destination du métier
  • Participer aux phases de test
  • Intervenir, au besoin, sur la mise en place et la maintenance des pipelines CI/CD
  • Être garant de la qualité, la cohérence et la fiabilité des choix techniques


Compétences Recherchées:

  • Très bonnes connaissances de PySpark
  • Bonnes connaissances d’outils de data visualisation tel que PowerBI
  • Bonnes connaissances des outils d’intégration continue (Git, Jenkins…)
  • Connaissance d'Azure Synapse et Azure Logic Apps est un plus
  • Connaissances des environnements Cloud (GCP, Azure ou AWS), un plus
  • Connaissances de T-SQL or PL/SQL, un plus


Qualifications :

  • Titre universitaire, ingénieur EPF, HES/ETS en informatique, ou équivalent
  • Minimum 5 ans d’expérience
  • Français et Anglais courants


  • Vous êtes organisé(e), curieux(se) et force de proposition
  • Vous êtes orienté(e) résultat avec une attention particulière pour la satisfaction client
  • Très bon(ne) communicant(e), vous faites preuve d’un excellent relationnel


Pourquoi rejoindre ASTRELYA ?

  • Une gestion de carrière personnalisée et un management de proximité
  • Une politique active de formations / certifications (technique, métier, leadership)
  • Une offre variée de missions d’expertise
  • Un engagement RSE fort : Ecovadis Gold
  • Une campagne de cooptation attractive
  • Afterworks, conférences techniques et activités sportives réguliers
  • L’accès à une plateforme digitalisée proposant des avantages


Cette annonce vous correspond ? Postulez ! 🚀

Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.


Pour découvrir l’ensemble de nos offres : ASTRELYA - Expertise en Transformation Digitale &

Der ideale Kandidat hat eine in seiner Ausbildung Data Engineering und Data
Science Methoden kennengelernt sowie bereits Erfahrungen in einem professionellen Umfeld als Data Engineer
gesammelt. Dabei hat der Kandidat selbständig Datenpipelines erstellt und betreut (z.B. für Reporting, Business
Intelligence Anwendungen, etc.). Snowflake ist bekannt.
Erstellen und Pflege von Data Products am Produktionsstandort Kaiseraugst für diverse Data Science Projekte und digitale Anwendungen
Automatisierte Verarbeitung von Datensätzen gemäss Kundenwünschen im Produktionskontext
Studium im MINT Bereich mit IT Anteil
Mind. 2 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Engineering, Data Analytics
Erfahrung mit Gitlab sowie weiteren einschlägigen Tools
Selbständiges Problemlösen, flexible gegenüber wechselnden Aufgaben, aufgeschlossene Persönlichkeit
Erfahrung in Data Science, Statistik, GMP, CSV

Für unseren Pharma-Kunden in Basel suchen wir derzeit einen Data Engineer


Der oder die perfekte Kandidat:in:


Der ideale Kandidat hat eine in seiner Ausbildung Data Engineering und Data

Science Methoden kennengelernt sowie bereits Erfahrungen in einem professionellen Umfeld als Data Engineer

gesammelt. Dabei hat der Kandidat selbständig Datenpipelines erstellt und betreut (z.B. für Reporting, Business

Intelligence Anwendungen, etc.). Snowflake ist bekannt.


Aufgaben &
column2:
Verantwortlichkeiten:


Erstellen und Pflege von Data Products am Produktionsstandort Kaiseraugst für diverse Data Science Projekte und digitale Anwendungen

Automatisierte Verarbeitung von Datensätzen gemäss Kundenwünschen im Produktionskontext

Projektdokumentation

Testen (CSV Kontext)

Must Haves:


Studium im MINT Bereich mit IT Anteil

Mind. 2 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Engineering, Data Analytics

Erfahrung mit SQL, Datenpipelines

Erfahrung mit Gitlab sowie weiteren einschlägigen Tools

Fliessende Deutsch und Englisch Kenntnisse

Selbständiges Problemlösen, flexible gegenüber wechselnden Aufgaben, aufgeschlossene Persönlichkeit

Nice to haves:


Erfahrung in Data Science, Statistik, GMP, CSV

Erfahrung mit gängigen Programmiersprachen

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4264226689,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-researcher-intern-at-garda-capital-partners-4264226689?position=53&pageNum=0&refId=YSfb7G%2BLNBqaoeDTQIZT7g%3D%3D&trackingId=ylU549l%2BuNfirzd4DA5B2Q%3D%3D,Quantitative Researcher Intern,Garda Capital Partners,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","Garda Capital Partners (Garda) is a multi-billion dollar alternative investment firm with over 21 years of experience deploying relative value strategies across fixed income markets for institutional investors. Garda's primary offices are located in Wayzata, New York City, West Palm Beach, Geneva, Zug, Copenhagen, Singapore, and Scottsdale.

Garda is looking to hire a Quantitative Researcher Intern to join the Quantitative Investment Research team in Geneva or Zug, for 4-8 months starting in 2025. The candidate will support portfolio managers, help implement solutions for trading and risk systems, and in the course of the internship be exposed to the analytics used in trading while working closely with a mentor for guidance and feedback.
Assist in the development of data driven strategies to complement investment decisions.
Support the team's research process, including data collection and analysis, prototyping, back-testing, and performance monitoring.
Conduct an original research project over the duration of the internship.
Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in statistics, financial engineering, applied math, finance, computer science, or similar quantitative or technical discipline.
Knowledge and interest in financial markets.
Intellectual curiosity and motivation to innovate and improve.

Garda Capital Partners (Garda) is a multi-billion dollar alternative investment firm with over 21 years of experience deploying relative value strategies across fixed income markets for institutional investors. Garda's primary offices are located in Wayzata, New York City, West Palm Beach, Geneva, Zug, Copenhagen, Singapore, and Scottsdale.

Garda is looking to hire a Quantitative Researcher Intern to join the Quantitative Investment Research team in Geneva or Zug, for 4-8 months starting in 2025. The candidate will support portfolio managers, help implement solutions for trading and risk systems, and in the course of the internship be exposed to the analytics used in trading while working closely with a mentor for guidance and feedback.

Position Responsibilities

  • Assist in the development of data driven strategies to complement investment decisions.
  • Support the team's research process, including data collection and analysis, prototyping, back-testing, and performance monitoring.
  • Conduct an original research project over the duration of the internship.

Qualifications &
column2:
Desired Skills

  • Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in statistics, financial engineering, applied math, finance, computer science, or similar quantitative or technical discipline.
  • Exceptional quantitative &
column3: programming skills (Python &amp
column4:
SQL).
  • Knowledge and interest in financial markets.
  • Strong communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently.
  • Intellectual curiosity and motivation to innovate and improve.

    • Candidate Privacy Policy

4268584291,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-sword-group-4268584291?position=57&pageNum=0&refId=YSfb7G%2BLNBqaoeDTQIZT7g%3D%3D&trackingId=OTkTS7CyeX%2FUSScvu4bVaA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Sword Group,"Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland","Nous ouvrons un poste de Data Analyst pour renforcer l’équipe de notre client basé à Lausanne.
Concevoir et développer des visualisations de données adaptées aux besoins des services utilisateurs, en cohérence avec l’environnement technique défini.
Collaborer activement au sein de l’équipe Données et participer aux réunions et rituels Agile.
Travailler en coordination avec les projets, l’architecture d’entreprise et les équipes d’intégration et d’infrastructure afin d’assurer la cohérence des solutions et leur fiabilité opérationnelle.
Garantir une modélisation efficace et pertinente des données exploitées.
Assurer la qualité des données collectées et veiller à leur documentation rigoureuse.
Maintenir un dialogue constant avec les utilisateurs et utilisatrices afin d’assurer une expérience utilisateur optimale.
Être moteur dans les propositions d’amélioration continue des processus et des outils.
Promouvoir les bonnes pratiques de datavisualisation au sein des équipes et accompagner leur adoption.
Diplôme en informatique d'une haute école (HES, université, EPF) ou titre jugé équivalent.
Expérience professionnelle d’au moins 3 ans dans la mise en œuvre de projets de visualisation de données.
Maîtrise avérée du mode de travail Agile dans le cadre de projets IT.
Bonne connaissance des outils de datavisualisation tels que Tableau et des outils SIG (comme Geoserver).
Compétences techniques en GitLab, VSCode, Docker, Python, DBT et autres ETL.
Connaissance des sources de données variées : Parquet (S3), PostgreSQL, DuckDB, ArangoDB, REST (OpenAPI), GraphQL, XML, Arrow, GeoJson, etc.
Expérience avec des outils d’ordonnancement comme Prefect.
Notions d’ITIL et de la méthodologie HERMES appréciées, ainsi qu'une expérience antérieure dans le secteur public.
💼 Formation continue : Un budget formation qui croit tous les mois à utiliser dans un large catalogue de formation
🏝 25 jours de congés payés : Tous nos employés ont droit à 25 jours de congés payés par an
🎉 Evènements réguliers : Des événements mensuels pour se retrouver en petit ou grand comité
🌍 Environnements internationaux : Des missions dans des groupes d'envergure internationale
🛠 Innovation : Contribuez à des projets impactants et innovants dans de nombreux secteurs d'activité
🎁 Des petits plaisirs : Nos employés bénéficient d'un programme d'avantages et remises très intéressantes

Nous ouvrons un poste de Data Analyst pour renforcer l’équipe de notre client basé à Lausanne.


Responsabilités du poste

  • Concevoir et développer des visualisations de données adaptées aux besoins des services utilisateurs, en cohérence avec l’environnement technique défini.

  • Collaborer activement au sein de l’équipe Données et participer aux réunions et rituels Agile.

  • Travailler en coordination avec les projets, l’architecture d’entreprise et les équipes d’intégration et d’infrastructure afin d’assurer la cohérence des solutions et leur fiabilité opérationnelle.

  • Garantir une modélisation efficace et pertinente des données exploitées.

  • Assurer la qualité des données collectées et veiller à leur documentation rigoureuse.

  • Maintenir un dialogue constant avec les utilisateurs et utilisatrices afin d’assurer une expérience utilisateur optimale.

  • Être moteur dans les propositions d’amélioration continue des processus et des outils.

  • Promouvoir les bonnes pratiques de datavisualisation au sein des équipes et accompagner leur adoption.

Prérequis

  • Diplôme en informatique d'une haute école (HES, université, EPF) ou titre jugé équivalent.

  • Expérience professionnelle d’au moins 3 ans dans la mise en œuvre de projets de visualisation de données.

  • Maîtrise avérée du mode de travail Agile dans le cadre de projets IT.

  • Bonne connaissance des outils de datavisualisation tels que Tableau et des outils SIG (comme Geoserver).

  • Compétences techniques en GitLab, VSCode, Docker, Python, DBT et autres ETL.

  • Connaissance des sources de données variées : Parquet (S3), PostgreSQL, DuckDB, ArangoDB, REST (OpenAPI), GraphQL, XML, Arrow, GeoJson, etc.

  • Expérience avec des outils d’ordonnancement comme Prefect.

  • Notions d’ITIL et de la méthodologie HERMES appréciées, ainsi qu'une expérience antérieure dans le secteur public.

Rejoindre Sword, c’est…
💼 Formation continue : Un budget formation qui croit tous les mois à utiliser dans un large catalogue de formation
🏝 25 jours de congés payés : Tous nos employés ont droit à 25 jours de congés payés par an
🚑 Une couverture assurance-accident internationale
🎉 Evènements réguliers : Des événements mensuels pour se retrouver en petit ou grand comité
🌍 Environnements internationaux : Des missions dans des groupes d'envergure internationale
🛠 Innovation : Contribuez à des projets impactants et innovants dans de nombreux secteurs d'activité
🎁 Des petits plaisirs : Nos employés bénéficient d'un programme d'avantages et remises très intéressantes

4271491409,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/banking-specialist-corporate-actions-processing-at-avaloq-4271491409?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=OIhcc%2Bj1mjFyes%2BXCWA%2FWQ%3D%3D&trackingId=bnqfEvj%2BhsCS1JjvVN%2FRpw%3D%3D,Banking Specialist - Corporate Actions Processing,Avaloq,"Bioggio, Ticino, Switzerland","Company Description

Founded and headquartered in Switzerland, Avaloq is continuously expanding its global footprint with around 2,500 colleagues in 12 countries, and more than 160 clients in 35 countries. We are an industry-leading provider of wealth management technology and services for financial institutions around the world, including private banks and wealth managers, investment managers, as well as retail and neo banks. Our research led approach and continual innovation is powered by the passion and creativity of our colleagues.

We are always looking for talented people to join us on our mission to orchestrate the financial ecosystem and democratize access to wealth management. Avaloq offers the opportunity to work closely with some of the world’s leading financial institutions as we jointly develop and shape careers. Championing a collaborative, supportive and flexible work environment empowers our colleagues to reach their full potential.

Banking Operations is a strategic Avaloq service line providing Banking Operations outsourcing services to banks. We are organized as a global Business Area, running state-of-the art Backoffice services with industry leading automation, quality, and risk standards. We are experts in providing a true value add to our clients and thus, always look to add creative and client-oriented personalities with drive and passion to our team.

The Corporate Actions Processing Team manage events coming from the market affecting the characteristic, the nature, or the value of a security. These events can be mandatory, mandatory with options or voluntary. The activity includes instruction management, transaction management and inquiry management for such events.
Processing and booking of mandatory and voluntary corporate action events
Managing instructions to custodians (e.g., via MT565) or through external systems
Capability to autonomously get around in a highly challenging, fast-paced and complex environment
Good team player and positive attitude
It would be a real bonus if you have
Know-how in the Corporate Actions area (both voluntary and mandatory events)
Knowledge of Avaloq Core Banking System

We realize that managing work life balance is a challenge we all face in our daily lives and in order to support with this we are pleased to offer hybrid and flexible working for most of our Avaloqers to maintain work life balance and still continue our fantastic Avaloq culture in our global offices.

In Avaloq we are proud to embrace diversity and understand the success of our business is built on the power of different opinions, we are whole heartedly committed to fostering an equal opportunity environment and inclusive culture where you can be your true authentic self.

We hire, compensate and promote regardless of origin, age, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other fantastic traits that make us all unique, we have done our best to write this advert in an inclusive and neutral way.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations.

Company Description

Founded and headquartered in Switzerland, Avaloq is continuously expanding its global footprint with around 2,500 colleagues in 12 countries, and more than 160 clients in 35 countries. We are an industry-leading provider of wealth management technology and services for financial institutions around the world, including private banks and wealth managers, investment managers, as well as retail and neo banks. Our research led approach and continual innovation is powered by the passion and creativity of our colleagues.

We are always looking for talented people to join us on our mission to orchestrate the financial ecosystem and democratize access to wealth management. Avaloq offers the opportunity to work closely with some of the world’s leading financial institutions as we jointly develop and shape careers. Championing a collaborative, supportive and flexible work environment empowers our colleagues to reach their full potential.

Job Description

Banking Operations is a strategic Avaloq service line providing Banking Operations outsourcing services to banks. We are organized as a global Business Area, running state-of-the art Backoffice services with industry leading automation, quality, and risk standards. We are experts in providing a true value add to our clients and thus, always look to add creative and client-oriented personalities with drive and passion to our team.

The Corporate Actions Processing Team manage events coming from the market affecting the characteristic, the nature, or the value of a security. These events can be mandatory, mandatory with options or voluntary. The activity includes instruction management, transaction management and inquiry management for such events.

Your key tasks

  • Processing and booking of mandatory and voluntary corporate action events
  • Managing instructions to custodians (e.g., via MT565) or through external systems
  • Performing cash and stock reconciliations
  • Handling client and internal inquiries

Qualifications

  • Capability to autonomously get around in a highly challenging, fast-paced and complex environment
  • Excellent communication and organization skills
  • Good team player and positive attitude
  • Flexibility and willingness to learn
  • Fluency in English

It would be a real bonus if you have

  • Know-how in the Corporate Actions area (both voluntary and mandatory events)
  • Knowledge of Avaloq Core Banking System
  • Knowledge of additional languages

Additional Information

We realize that managing work life balance is a challenge we all face in our daily lives and in order to support with this we are pleased to offer hybrid and flexible working for most of our Avaloqers to maintain work life balance and still continue our fantastic Avaloq culture in our global offices.

In Avaloq we are proud to embrace diversity and understand the success of our business is built on the power of different opinions, we are whole heartedly committed to fostering an equal opportunity environment and inclusive culture where you can be your true authentic self.

We hire, compensate and promote regardless of origin, age, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other fantastic traits that make us all unique, we have done our best to write this advert in an inclusive and neutral way.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations.

4268621494,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-%E2%80%93-data-collection-assistant-40%25-f-m-at-idiap-research-institute-4268621494?position=3&pageNum=2&refId=OIhcc%2Bj1mjFyes%2BXCWA%2FWQ%3D%3D&trackingId=BtLeeja1sQ7vddV3nJvOZw%3D%3D,Internship – Data Collection Assistant (40%) F/M,Idiap Research Institute,"Martigny, Valais, Switzerland","Role Summary
Workload: 40% (equivalent to four half-days per week)

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented intern for support in data collection for two ongoing European research projects. The selected candidate will coordinate appointments with the volunteers, and provide help with data collection sessions.
Plan the data collection sessions with the volunteer
Contact volunteers by phone and send reminders before each session
Welcome volunteers, collect relevant metadata, and clearly explain the data collection procedures, including the consent form
Assist with operating the recording equipment
Provide helpful explanations for volunteers to facilitate the data collection process
Help with collecting facial data of volunteers inside vehicles and from long distances
Conduct sanity checks on collected data to ensure quality and consistency
Collaborate closely with project team members to ensure smooth execution of data collection
Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Fluent in both French and English (spoken and written)
Strong organizational abilities and attention to detail

Idiap is a research institute of national importance that engages in fundamental research, education and technology transfer in artificial intelligence, machine learning and signal processing. Idiap offers competitive salaries and conditions in a young, high-quality, dynamic, and multicultural environment. Idiap is located in the town of Martigny in Valais, a scenic region in the south of Switzerland, surrounded by the highest mountains of Europe, and offering exceptional quality of life, exciting recreational activities, including hiking, climbing and skiing, as well as varied cultural activities. English is the official working language.

At Idiap we place great emphasis on diversity and we know diversity fosters creativity and innovation. We are committed to equality of opportunity, to being fair and inclusive, and to being a place where we all belong. Employment at Idiap is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications. Idiap does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, marital status, pregnancy, or any other basis protected by law.

Role Summary

Contract Duration: 6 months

Workload: 40% (equivalent to four half-days per week)

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented intern for support in data collection for two ongoing European research projects. The selected candidate will coordinate appointments with the volunteers, and provide help with data collection sessions.

Responsibilities

  • Plan the data collection sessions with the volunteer
  • Contact volunteers by phone and send reminders before each session
  • Welcome volunteers, collect relevant metadata, and clearly explain the data collection procedures, including the consent form
  • Assist with operating the recording equipment
  • Provide helpful explanations for volunteers to facilitate the data collection process
  • Help with collecting facial data of volunteers inside vehicles and from long distances
  • Conduct sanity checks on collected data to ensure quality and consistency
  • Collaborate closely with project team members to ensure smooth execution of data collection

Role Profile

Qualifications

  • Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
  • Fluent in both French and English (spoken and written)
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Strong organizational abilities and attention to detail
  • Demonstrated capacity for teamwork

About Idiap

Idiap is a research institute of national importance that engages in fundamental research, education and technology transfer in artificial intelligence, machine learning and signal processing. Idiap offers competitive salaries and conditions in a young, high-quality, dynamic, and multicultural environment. Idiap is located in the town of Martigny in Valais, a scenic region in the south of Switzerland, surrounded by the highest mountains of Europe, and offering exceptional quality of life, exciting recreational activities, including hiking, climbing and skiing, as well as varied cultural activities. English is the official working language.

At Idiap we place great emphasis on diversity and we know diversity fosters creativity and innovation. We are committed to equality of opportunity, to being fair and inclusive, and to being a place where we all belong. Employment at Idiap is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications. Idiap does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, marital status, pregnancy, or any other basis protected by law.

4269389634,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-consultant-artificial-intelligence-data-data-management-data-platforms-focus-at-deloitte-4269389634?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=OIhcc%2Bj1mjFyes%2BXCWA%2FWQ%3D%3D&trackingId=Hxsy1S0wnRBzXF43dfEquQ%3D%3D,Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus),Deloitte,"Basel, Basel, Switzerland","Job Description
Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.
For this role, we are currently offering start dates from August 2025.
How You Can Make An Impact
Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.

Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.
Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.
Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.

column2: fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.

column1: First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .
We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.
If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch

We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria
column2: don’t hold yourself back – apply today.

4270762766,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/finance-insights-data-analysis-expert-at-roche-4270762766?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=OIhcc%2Bj1mjFyes%2BXCWA%2FWQ%3D%3D&trackingId=end7%2BD4FUaWDIYUaFqG5pQ%3D%3D,Finance Insights & Data Analysis Expert,Roche,"Basel, Basel, Switzerland","At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

At Roche, our Finance Centers of Excellence have led the way in breaking down silos, removing hierarchies, and working in new ways. We’ve learned from our successes and from the things that haven’t gone so well. We’re better equipped to look at interfaces and synergies, and to understand the risks of creating new silos. The eCoE is focusing on three areas delivering a high-level of financial expertise, innovative insights, and an entrepreneurial mindset that enables agility and flexibility for stakeholders. The eCoE is a talent engine for Finance through capability and network building.

Within the eCOE, the R&D Outcome Based Community (OBC) focuses on delivering a high-level of fifinancial expertise, innovative insights, and an entrepreneurial mindset to influence and support R&D investments at Roche.

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented R&D Benchmarking Analyst to support our R&D organization. This role focuses on collecting, analyzing, and interpreting internal and external data to benchmark R&D performance, costs, timelines, and success rates in molecule development. You will play a critical role in shaping R&D strategy through competitive intelligence, pipeline assessment, and knowledge management.
Conduct R&D benchmarking studies focused on preclinical and clinical development phases across therapeutic areas and molecule types
Main point of contact for external benchmark analysis providing, collecting, validating and analyzing benchmark data points to/from our selected external provider
Analyze molecule development costs, timelines, success rates, using internal project data and external sources
Support cross-functional teams by providing actionable insights to improve pipeline productivity and decision-making
Develop and maintain internal databases and dashboards on R&D metrics, competitive programs, and industry trends
Collaborate with portfolio management, therapeutic area leads, and external providers to contextualize benchmarking insights
Track industry best practices and innovations in drug discovery, translational research, and clinical development
Synthesize large datasets and scientific knowledge into concise reports and presentations for senior leadership
Bachelor or Master’s degree in Finance, Pharmacy, Medicine, or related field
2–5 years of experience in pharmaceutical R&D, competitive intelligence, or management consulting (with pharma focus)
Strong understanding of molecule development stages (discovery to early/late-phase clinical development)
Familiarity with R&D KPIs: time-to-launch, timelines, cost of failure, cycle times, etc
Excellent data analysis and visualization skills (Excel, PP, SAC,...)
Strong communication skills with ability to translate complex data into strategic insights

You have the ability to turn data into insights, comfortable with zooming in and out on details and granularity depending on the situation. You are a collaborative team player with ability to deal with ambiguous situations and deliver in a networked setup. You are courageously authentic with ability to speak up and point out opportunities.
The role is located in Basel.

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.
Let’s build a healthier future, together.
Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

4275329731,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/gestionnaire-de-donn%C3%A9es-at-api-sa-4275329731?position=1&pageNum=5&refId=ueB2leUhbqT9BjS1a7E6Zg%3D%3D&trackingId=z%2BDAJw4GqwM%2B4gx9ORipsA%3D%3D,Gestionnaire de données,API SA,"Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland","Pourquoi choisir API ?
API, avec plus de 30 ans d'expérience, est une entreprise familiale, reconnue pour sa réelle expertise IT
column2: transformation digitale, service de support, Cloud...

column1: Nous avons su nous nous entourer des meilleurs experts afin de répondre au mieux aux besoins spécifiques de nos clients.
En optant pour API, vous choisissez une entreprise à taille humaine bénéficiant d'un solide savoir-faire en IT.

Nous sommes fiers de notre culture d’entreprise unique car nous offrons des opportunités de développement professionnel, avec des programmes de formation continue, d'évolution de carrière ainsi qu’un suivi rigoureux.
Nous mettons l’humain au cœur de nos activités : après tout, nos ordinateurs peuvent résoudre des problèmes, mais ils ne savent toujours pas faire un bon café !
📢 Aujourd'hui nous recherchons un Gestionnaire de Données (f/h) pour rejoindre l'équipe de notre client à Lausanne.
Assurer la création et la mise à jour des données de référence de l’entreprise des différents domaines de données (client, contrat, sinistre, organisation, …)
Assurer les mapping des données entre les différents systèmes informatiques
Mettre en place et documenter les référentiels de données standardisés
Effectuer des contrôles réguliers de la qualité des données
Identifier et corriger les anomalies, doublons et incohérences
Formation supérieure (HES dans un domaine technique)
Bonne maîtrise des outils de bureautique Microsoft Office 365
Expérience avec les outils de collaboration : Teams, JIRA, Confluence
Expérience avec les outils de gestion de données de référence (MDM)
Parfaite maîtrise du français et au minimum anglais niveau B2
Familiarité avec l’utilisation des outils de Business Intelligence et de reporting
Expérience dans la gestion de données et le monitoring de la qualité constitue un atout
Aptitude au travail en mode agile
Les étapes du processus de recrutement chez API :

Engageons la conversation ! Pour commencer, nous souhaitons découvrir qui vous êtes : votre parcours, vos intérêts et vos aspirations. Cette première prise de contact nous permettra de mieux vous connaître.

Ensuite, approfondissons ! Vous aurez l’occasion de rencontrer nos Business Managers qui vous parleront de la vie de consultant chez API. Ce sera le moment idéal pour découvrir les projets qui retiennent votre attention en fonction de vos ambitions !
Concrétisons ! Une fois l’adéquation entre vos ambitions, vos compétences et le projet établie, l’aventure ensemble peut commencer !

Pourquoi choisir API ?


API, avec plus de 30 ans d'expérience, est une entreprise familiale, reconnue pour sa réelle expertise IT
column2:
transformation digitale, service de support, Cloud...

Nous avons su nous nous entourer des meilleurs experts afin de répondre au mieux aux besoins spécifiques de nos clients.


En optant pour API, vous choisissez une entreprise à taille humaine bénéficiant d'un solide savoir-faire en IT.

Nous sommes fiers de notre culture d’entreprise unique car nous offrons des opportunités de développement professionnel, avec des programmes de formation continue, d'évolution de carrière ainsi qu’un suivi rigoureux.


Nous mettons l’humain au cœur de nos activités : après tout, nos ordinateurs peuvent résoudre des problèmes, mais ils ne savent toujours pas faire un bon café !


📢 Aujourd'hui nous recherchons un Gestionnaire de Données (f/h) pour rejoindre l'équipe de notre client à Lausanne.


Vos responsabilités

  • Assurer la création et la mise à jour des données de référence de l’entreprise des différents domaines de données (client, contrat, sinistre, organisation, …)
  • Assurer les mapping des données entre les différents systèmes informatiques
  • Mettre en place et documenter les référentiels de données standardisés
  • Effectuer des contrôles réguliers de la qualité des données
  • Identifier et corriger les anomalies, doublons et incohérences


Profil recherché

  • Bonne maîtrise des outils de bureautique Microsoft Office 365
  • Expérience avec les outils de collaboration : Teams, JIRA, Confluence
  • Expérience avec les outils de gestion de données de référence (MDM)

  • Familiarité avec l’utilisation des outils de Business Intelligence et de reporting
  • Expérience dans la gestion de données et le monitoring de la qualité constitue un atout
  • Aptitude au travail en mode agile
  • Rigueur et attention aux détails
  • Capacité à travailler en autonomie


Les étapes du processus de recrutement chez API :


  • Engageons la conversation ! Pour commencer, nous souhaitons découvrir qui vous êtes : votre parcours, vos intérêts et vos aspirations. Cette première prise de contact nous permettra de mieux vous connaître.
  • Ensuite, approfondissons ! Vous aurez l’occasion de rencontrer nos Business Managers qui vous parleront de la vie de consultant chez API. Ce sera le moment idéal pour découvrir les projets qui retiennent votre attention en fonction de vos ambitions !
  • Concrétisons ! Une fois l’adéquation entre vos ambitions, vos compétences et le projet établie, l’aventure ensemble peut commencer !
