Located in the heart of Washington, we enjoy open skies, snow-capped mountains, and the lakes and rivers of the high desert. We are the proud home of orchards, farms, and small communities. Confluence Health actively supports the communities we serve and their quality of life through our community support program and through our individual efforts as involved community members.
Full Time Employees of Confluence Health receive a wide range of benefits in addition to compensation.
Flexible Spending Accounts & Health Saving Accounts
For more information on our Benefits & Perks, click here!
Must reside in the state of WA, ID, or OR.

Under supervision, assists the cancer program and cancer committee in meeting criteria as set forth under the American College of Surgeons Commission (ACoS) on Cancer for an approved cancer program. Identifies, abstracts, and maintains records of patients treated for reportable diagnoses at identified facilities to provide data for physicians, research studies, and other organizations utilizing a cancer registry data system. Provides quality controls during the data collection activity of abstraction. Analyzes data and disseminates information within established guidelines.
Position Reports To: Manager - Quality Reporting

Identifies, compiles and maintains records of applicable patients treated for cancer to provide data for physicians, administration, research studies, or other requested use utilizing cancer registry data system or other relevant resources. Reviews medical center and hospital records to identify and compile patient data for use in cancer management program and to comply with government regulations and ACoS guidelines.

Reviews, abstracts and codes data information, including patient demographics, history and extent of disease, diagnostic procedures, treatment, follow-up, physician, and related information from medical records and other required sources. Information is entered into the database according to strict protocol requirements, according to ACoS guidelines.

Reviews data for completeness and accuracy and provides lifetime follow up with data sources as necessary required by facility and ACoS guidelines, in order to maintain follow-up information, such as quality of life and length of survival of cancer patients. Makes corrections in database as identified through quality control process.
Utilizes case-finding sources, including, but not limited to: hospital disease index, Pathology department reports, Radiology department Reports, to identify reportable cases of cancer.
Researches and identifies cases for special projects and studies. Reviews incoming data documentation and performs re-abstracting and case finding for special projects as assigned.

Prepares statistical reports, narrative reports and graphic presentation of cancer registry data for use by hospital staff, researchers and other users of registry data. Responds accurately, professionally and in a timely manner to all requests for data, special studies and research projects.

Performs data analysis and prepares reports within protocol parameters of the study and other guidelines. Educates staff on study requirements, data collection methodology. Provides input into study planning and coordinates data collection activities with investigator requirements.

Provides feedback to medical staff and administration on quality issues. Educates medical staff and administration on ACoS requirements and aids in implementation in these requirements. Assists the Cancer Committee in developing criteria for quality improvement and patient care evaluations.

Assists Lead Oncology Data Specialist in Clinical Cancer Conference and Cancer Committee and helps to assure the meetings are conducted according to ACoS requirements. Responsible for specific duties for Clinical Cancer Conference and Cancer Committee as assigned.
Assure data meets reporting requirements for the ACoS, the National Cancer Data Base (NCDB) and the Washington State Cancer Registry (WSCR) with timely reporting to these entities.

Assists with the ACoS Cancer Program Survey with updates of required data and information on a timely basis and maintains the policies and procedure for the cancer registry and other pertinent cancer program functions.
Works with Lead Oncology Data Specialist in establishing and maintaining cancer registry policies, procedures, objectives and quality assurance.
Participates in educational activities required to maintain ODS credentials.
Demonstrate Standards of Behavior and adhere to the Code of Conduct in all aspects of job performance at all times.
3 years of experience that is directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified
column2: or 2 years medical related college or technical course and 1 year experience directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified.

4271808116,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-associate-at-jobright-ai-4271808116?position=6&pageNum=5&refId=jAvBwDgpbFwKulP8UwZj1w%3D%3D&trackingId=q6IQ2%2F88r6Gq22NYxNnK8Q%3D%3D,Data Engineer (Associate),Jobright.ai,San Francisco Bay Area,"Verified Job On Employer Career Site

Delphi is redefining how knowledge is shared, creating a dynamic medium for knowledge transfer. The Data Engineer will build the data platform from the ground up, providing insights on user engagement, growth, financial performance, and consumer platform behavior.
• How are users engaging with onboarding & creating their digital mind?
• What is the 'time to magic' and what are the true magic moments in the product?
• What behaviors correlate with long-term retention and user success?
• How do different user segments behave?
• What drives session success and how do we define success?
• What actions predict upgrades, churn, or virality?
• How does usage vary between Free Tier and paid users?
• What are the pricing dynamics for Free Tier and conversion pathways?
• What should users see when they land on the platform?
• What Delphi should be shown during a 'Quick Ask' or default prompt?
• What kind of conversational experiences lead to a life-long Delphi user?
• Run experiments consistently to learn about product behavior. Example: Duolingo learned that the most important metric to optimize for was whether people were coming back in 3 days.
• Strong programming skills in Python and SQL
• Experience designing and building data pipelines and ETL systems
• Familiarity with data warehousing (we're considering BigQuery)
• Comfort with cloud infrastructure (we use AWS)
• Proven ability to build scalable, production-ready data systems
• Experience creating clear, actionable reports and dashboards for internal decision-making
• Solid understanding of data modeling, schema design, and best practices around reliability and observability
• Experience with distributed data processing (e.g. Apache Spark)
• Familiarity with Kafka or event-driven architectures
• Exposure to basic data science or analytics workstreams
• Experience building recommendation systems or ranking algorithms
• Previous zero-to-one data infrastructure experience at a high-growth startup

Delphi is a digital cloning platform that can capture how you think, making your insights available to others in a personalized way. Founded in 2022, the company is headquartered in San Francisco, US, with a team of 11-50 employees. The company is currently Early Stage. Delphi has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Job Summary:

Delphi is redefining how knowledge is shared, creating a dynamic medium for knowledge transfer. The Data Engineer will build the data platform from the ground up, providing insights on user engagement, growth, financial performance, and consumer platform behavior.

• Build our Data Platform from 0

• How are users engaging with onboarding &
column2:
creating their digital mind?

The TD Bank Credit Cards & Unsecured Lending (CCUL) Credit Management department is responsible for managing the credit lifecycle of credit card and unsecured loan products offered to customers. The Quantitative Analytics Specialist team responsibilities will include developing and maintaining statistical and machine learning models to predict credit risk across the lifecycle (e.g., acquisition, existing account managements, collection).

The Quantitative Analytics Specialist provides the quantitative analysis and builds the advanced quantitative models to meet business requirements. In addition, the Quantitative Analyst provides highly specialized quantitative analytical and modeling support at the assigned line(s) of business and Lead the development and enhancement of advanced quantitative models to enable efficient pricing and risk management of business products. Provide analysis through in-depth understanding of the models, markets and business to help drive business results, strategy and decision making.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. The listed or specified responsibilities & duties are considered essential functions for ADA purposes.

TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches/stores. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues.

TD is deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.

Our Total Rewards package reflects the investments we make in our colleagues to help them and their families achieve their financial, physical and mental well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes base salary and variable compensation/incentive awards (e.g., eligibility for cash and/or equity incentive awards, generally through participation in an incentive plan) and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits, savings and retirement programs, paid time off (including Vacation PTO, Flex PTO, and Holiday PTO), banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition. Learn more

We’re delighted that you’re considering building a career with TD. Through regular development conversations, training programs, and a competitive benefits plan, we’re committed to providing the support our colleagues need to thrive both at work and at home.

If you’re interested in a specific career path or are looking to build certain skills, we want to help you succeed. You’ll have regular career, development, and performance conversations with your manager, as well as access to an online learning platform and a variety of mentoring programs to help you unlock future opportunities. Whether you have a passion for helping customers and want to expand your experience, or you want to coach and inspire your colleagues, there are many different career paths within our organization at TD – and we’re committed to helping you identify opportunities that support your goals.
We will provide training and onboarding sessions to ensure that you’ve got everything you need to succeed in your new role.
We’ll reach out to candidates of interest to schedule an interview. We do our best to communicate outcomes to all applicants by email or phone call.

TD Bank is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, status as a protected veteran or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local law.

If you are an applicant with a disability and need accommodations to complete the application process, please email TD Bank US Workplace Accommodations Program at USWAPTDO@td.com. Include your full name, best way to reach you and the accommodation needed to assist you with the applicant process.

    • Actively shares information and knowledge, and proactively learn from the expertise of others
    • Participate fully as a member of the team, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork and ensure timely communication of issues/ points of interest
    • Provide thought leadership and/ or industry knowledge for own area of expertise in own area and participate in knowledge transfer within the team and business unit
    • Keep current on emerging trends/ developments and grow knowledge of the business, related tools and techniques
    • Participate in personal performance management and development activities, including cross training within own team
    • Keep others informed and up-to-date about the status / progress of projects and / or all relevant or useful information related to day-to-day activities
    • Contribute to team development of skills and capabilities through mentorship of others, by sharing knowledge and experiences and leveraging best practices.
    • Lead, motivate and develop relationships with internal and external business partners / stakeholders to develop productive working relationships.
    • Contribute to a fair, positive and equitable environment that supports a diverse workforce
    • Act as a brand ambassador for your business area/function and the bank, both internally and/or externally

    Physical Requirements

    Never: 0%
column11: Occasional: 1-33%
column13:
Continuous: 67-100%

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. The listed or specified responsibilities &
column14:
duties are considered essential functions for ADA purposes.

Who We Are

TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches/stores. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues.

TD is deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.

Our Total Rewards Package

Our Total Rewards package reflects the investments we make in our colleagues to help them and their families achieve their financial, physical and mental well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes base salary and variable compensation/incentive awards (e.g., eligibility for cash and/or equity incentive awards, generally through participation in an incentive plan) and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits, savings and retirement programs, paid time off (including Vacation PTO, Flex PTO, and Holiday PTO), banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition. Learn more

Additional Information

We’re delighted that you’re considering building a career with TD. Through regular development conversations, training programs, and a competitive benefits plan, we’re committed to providing the support our colleagues need to thrive both at work and at home.

Colleague Development

If you’re interested in a specific career path or are looking to build certain skills, we want to help you succeed. You’ll have regular career, development, and performance conversations with your manager, as well as access to an online learning platform and a variety of mentoring programs to help you unlock future opportunities. Whether you have a passion for helping customers and want to expand your experience, or you want to coach and inspire your colleagues, there are many different career paths within our organization at TD – and we’re committed to helping you identify opportunities that support your goals.

Training &
column15:
Onboarding

We will provide training and onboarding sessions to ensure that you’ve got everything you need to succeed in your new role.

Interview Process

We’ll reach out to candidates of interest to schedule an interview. We do our best to communicate outcomes to all applicants by email or phone call.

Accommodation

TD Bank is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, status as a protected veteran or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local law.

If you are an applicant with a disability and need accommodations to complete the application process, please email TD Bank US Workplace Accommodations Program at USWAPTDO@td.com. Include your full name, best way to reach you and the accommodation needed to assist you with the applicant process.

column1: Please review the following job description:

Identifies business unit data critical business process and critical data elements in alignment with Enterprise Data Management and Governance established policies, standards, and procedures. Ensures data controls are implemented and maintained to effectively support the execution of business processes. Participates in domain working groups, best practices forums, and data management routines to stay informed of industry trends and support the accuracy and completeness of data through the supply chain.
Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.
Responsibilities include participating in definition and validation of a business critical process and the associated critical data elements (CDEs) that support them.
Onboard new CDEs that are specific to corresponding Business Unit or Corporate Group – collaborate with Technical Data Stewards.
Propose new CDEs and Data Domains to Data Domain Working Group for approval – collaborate with Data Domain Working Group.
Review assigned CDEs and their business metadata on an established frequency basis – collaborate with Metadata Center of Excellence (COE).
Discover and execute CDE change requests – collaborate with Metadata COE
column2: Technical Data Stewards.

column1: Submit CDE change requests for approval to Data Domain Working Group – collaborate with Data Domain Working Group, Metadata COE, and Technical Data Stewards.
Perform business process and traceability mapping – collaborate with Business Unit / Corporate Group representatives, Metadata COE and Technical Data Stewards.
Review trusted source assignments – collaborate with Technical Data Stewards.
Define data quality rules and standards for corresponding Business Unit or Corporate Group.

May partner with Technical Business Stewards to enroll and implement Data Quality rules for corresponding Business Unit or Corporate Group into appropriate systems– collaborate with Technical Business Stewards.
Monitor Data Quality activities, track data issues and risks, and develop associated mitigation strategies for corresponding Business Unit or Corporate Group.
Onboard new CDEs’ related business metadata – collaborate with Metadata COE.

Update central metadata repository with business metadata content (business terms, definitions, classifications, and business and Data Quality rules) – collaborate with Metadata COE and Technical Data Stewards.
Review CDEs’ metadata on an established frequency basis – collaborate with Metadata COE.
Discover and execute CDE metadata update requests – collaborate with Metadata COE.
Get CDE metadata change requests approved with Data Domain Working Group – collaborate with Data Domain Working Group.
Data Privacy, Security, Retention and Archiving:
Monitor data security for data elements for corresponding Business Unit or Corporate Group.
Report or escalate data privacy issues to Data Privacy Group – collaborate with Chief Privacy Officer and team.
Review data requirements to enable compliance with Privacy Policy and other similar corporate policies and documents – collaborate with Chief Privacy Officer and team.
Enable the application of corporate strategy, policy, and ethics for all consumers of data from given Business Unit or Corporate Group.
Monitor data for alignment with national and regional regulations as well as with corporate ethical standards.
Data Sharing, Access Control and Data Transfer:
Define Data Privacy rules and align them with the Enterprise Privacy Policy in collaborate with Chief Privacy Officer

Participate in defining archiving, retention, and data destruction requirements for CDEs for corresponding Business Unit or Corporate functions in collaboration with the CDAO and Chief Privacy Officer.
Review data requirements to enable compliance with Privacy Policy and other similar corporate policies and documents – collaborate with Chief Privacy Officer and team.
Enable the application of corporate strategy, policy, and ethics for all consumers of data from given Business Unit or Corporate Group.
Monitor data for alignment with national and regional regulations as well as with corporate ethical standards

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Equivalent combination of advanced education and related experience, which could include any combination of: 5 years of experience managing business processes or experience in technical-related decisions on the business side
Knowledge of current and emerging application software products and tools
Ability to manage a high volume of internal client relationships
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in business analytics, computer science, Information Technology, or a related field
Knowledge of Data and Analytics including emerging trends
Understanding of banking operations, risk management, and regulatory compliance
Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills
Familiarity with machine learning, data analytics, and artificial intelligence in financial institutions

General Description of Available Benefits for Eligible Employees of Truist Financial Corporation: All regular teammates (not temporary or contingent workers) working 20 hours or more per week are eligible for benefits, though eligibility for specific benefits may be determined by the division of Truist offering the position. Truist offers medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability, accidental death and dismemberment, tax-preferred savings accounts, and a 401k plan to teammates. Teammates also receive no less than 10 days of vacation (prorated based on date of hire and by full-time or part-time status) during their first year of employment, along with 10 sick days (also prorated), and paid holidays. For more details on Truist’s generous benefit plans, please visit our Benefits site. Depending on the position and division, this job may also be eligible for Truist’s defined benefit pension plan, restricted stock units, and/or a deferred compensation plan. As you advance through the hiring process, you will also learn more about the specific benefits available for any non-temporary position for which you apply, based on full-time or part-time status, position, and division of work.

Truist is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, color, religion, citizenship or national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or other classification protected by law. Truist is a Drug Free Workplace.

4269628814,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/founding-data-engineer-%E2%80%93-data-acquisition-infrastructure-at-pangia-4269628814?position=5&pageNum=7&refId=8pP3JiBc9aXW6CS3ZgbTdw%3D%3D&trackingId=H%2FfADU58c1jcnaegiWJang%3D%3D,Founding Data Engineer – Data Acquisition & Infrastructure,Pangia,"San Francisco, CA","NOTE: This is equity based only - monetary compensation will be considered once further funding is secured.

We're building the behavioral intelligence layer the internet is missing. Our API ingests raw digital traces—like chat, social, and open-source data—and turns them into high-context behavioral models: personality, motivation, decision style, intent. We power smarter predictions for education, hiring, addiction recovery, and consumer apps. If you believe understanding people at scale is the next frontier of AI, you're in the right place.

We’re looking for a scrappy, sharp, and self-directed Data Engineer to join the founding team. Your job is to find, source, and structure data that feeds our behavioral profiling models. You’ll build and maintain data pipelines from third-party APIs, public web sources, and internal ingestion tools. You’ll also play a key role in working with our profiling and modeling team to ensure the right data is feeding the right models.
• Build and maintain pipelines that collect and process structured + unstructured behavioral data
• Identify high-value third-party data sources (e.g. Bright Data, PDL, etc.) and set up integrations
• Build scrapers or interface with scraping vendors to gather public digital activity
• Write transformation logic to clean, filter, and standardize raw behavioral data
• Collaborate with our ML team to define the “must-have” signals for personality, intent, and motivation
• Own the data stack and design a scalable foundation for model-ready pipelines
• Drive experimentation on new data signals and enrichment methods
• Deep comfort navigating APIs, web data, and unconventional data formats
• Experience with tools like Python, SQL, Airflow, Supabase, and modern scraping libraries
• Passion for behavioral data, digital footprints, and real-world psychological modeling
• Comfortable operating independently in a fast-moving, ambiguous startup environment
• Based in SF (non-negotiable – we work shoulder to shoulder)
• Previous startup experience is a plus, but not required
• Early equity in a company with real technical IP and multi-industry demand
• Work on one of the most important infrastructure challenges of the AI age: understanding people
Want to talk? DM us with your resume & Twitter with a link to something you’ve built, scraped, or shipped.

NOTE: This is equity based only - monetary compensation will be considered once further funding is secured.


We're building the behavioral intelligence layer the internet is missing. Our API ingests raw digital traces—like chat, social, and open-source data—and turns them into high-context behavioral models: personality, motivation, decision style, intent. We power smarter predictions for education, hiring, addiction recovery, and consumer apps. If you believe understanding people at scale is the next frontier of AI, you're in the right place.


We’re looking for a scrappy, sharp, and self-directed Data Engineer to join the founding team. Your job is to find, source, and structure data that feeds our behavioral profiling models. You’ll build and maintain data pipelines from third-party APIs, public web sources, and internal ingestion tools. You’ll also play a key role in working with our profiling and modeling team to ensure the right data is feeding the right models.


What You’ll Do


• Build and maintain pipelines that collect and process structured + unstructured behavioral data

• Identify high-value third-party data sources (e.g. Bright Data, PDL, etc.) and set up integrations

• Build scrapers or interface with scraping vendors to gather public digital activity

• Write transformation logic to clean, filter, and standardize raw behavioral data

• Collaborate with our ML team to define the “must-have” signals for personality, intent, and motivation

• Own the data stack and design a scalable foundation for model-ready pipelines

• Drive experimentation on new data signals and enrichment methods


What We’re Looking For


• Deep comfort navigating APIs, web data, and unconventional data formats

• Experience with tools like Python, SQL, Airflow, Supabase, and modern scraping libraries

• Passion for behavioral data, digital footprints, and real-world psychological modeling

• Comfortable operating independently in a fast-moving, ambiguous startup environment

• Based in SF (non-negotiable – we work shoulder to shoulder)

• Previous startup experience is a plus, but not required


Why Join Us


• Early equity in a company with real technical IP and multi-industry demand

• Autonomy, ownership, and zero bureaucracy

• Work on one of the most important infrastructure challenges of the AI age: understanding people



Want to talk? DM us with your resume &

4261063704,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/health-unit-coord-i-at-cincinnati-children-s-4261063704?position=6&pageNum=7&refId=8pP3JiBc9aXW6CS3ZgbTdw%3D%3D&trackingId=ln6EW4obtwEcGbwjssxKSg%3D%3D,Health Unit Coord I,Cincinnati Children's,"Cincinnati, OH","Job Description

At Cincinnati Children’s, we come to work with one goal: to make children’s health better. We believe in a holistic team approach, both in caring for patients and their families, and in advancing science and discovery. We strive to do better and find energy and inspiration in our shared purpose. If you want to be the best you can be, you can do it at Cincinnati Children’s.
Recognized by U.S. News & World Report as a top 10 best children's hospitals in the nation for more than 15 years
Second Among All Children's Hospitals for National Institutes of Health (NIH) Funding
Recognized as one of America’s Best Large Employers (2025) , America’s Best Employers for New Grads (2024)
One of the nation's America’s Most Innovative Companies as noted by Fortune
Consistently certified as great place to work
A Leading Disability Employer as noted by the National Organization on Disability
Magnet® designated for the fourth consecutive time by the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC)

Clerical Duties - Operates and maintains unit information systems to include-medical record integrity, forms management, timely response to faxes, printed material, mail, and accuracy of patient data, timely completion of admissions, discharges, transfers and short stay documentation. Demonstrates fiscal responsibility and accountability with respect to patient charges/rental equipment, CCHMC charge capture procedures, and ensures that unit maintains a designated par level of clerical supplies.

Environmental Management - Ensures that within the division, all areas are organized and present a safe, accessible, effective and efficient environment for patients, families, visitors, and employees. Maintains awareness of patient location and monitors traffic flow at the front desk and on the unit. Assists with compliance of visitor policies and applying arm bands for parents/caregivers. Reports maintenance (wiping down monitors, troubleshooting printer issues, logging off information, etc.) and environmental service needs to appropriate division and follows-up to assure completion. Collaborates with clinical, admitting, information systems and environmental services staff to coordinate efficient patient flow.

Systems Management - Identifies system problems and utilizes strategies for resolutions. Responds to communication system/patient alarms and executes with a sense of urgency. Reviews and revises staffing information.

Communication - Demonstrates the Cincinnati Children's CARES behaviors in all interactions with patients, families, visitors and co-workers by actively participating as a front-line example of extraordinary customer service and satisfaction
column2: and interacts with parents/guardians to obtain non-clinical information as requested. Ensures and reviews timeliness, accuracy, availability and security of information (i.e. HIPAA, Informed Consent, Advanced Directive for patients 18 or older) as defined by CCHMC's mission, applicable laws, and regulations. Has in-depth knowledge of HIPAA standards and fosters application to clinical practice.

column1: To provide daily operational/administrative support for the unit and outpatient services. Functions as a resource for clinical personnel regarding unit and outpatient operational issues. Anticipate needs for department and provides coordination of information systems, environmental, admitting and clerical functions for patient areas of a medical center dedicated to the care of infants, children and adolescents.
Medical coverage starting day 1 of employment. View employee benefits here.
Expansive employee discount programs through our many community partners
Shift Differential, Weekend Differential, and Weekend Option Pay Programs
Referral bonus program for current staff!

Support through Employee Resource Groups such as African American Professionals Advisory Council, Asian Cultural and Professional Group, EQUAL - LGBTQA Resource Group, Juntos - Hispanic/Latin Resource Group, Veterans and Military Family Advocacy Network, and Young Professionals (YP) Resource Group
Physical and mental health wellness programs
Relocation assistance available for qualified positions
Benefits may vary based on FTE Status and Position Type
Annualized pay may vary based on FTE status $17.14 - $20.36
Comprehensive Job Description Provided Upon Request.

column2:
World Report as a top 10 best children's hospitals in the nation for more than 15 years
  • Second Among All Children's Hospitals for National Institutes of Health (NIH) Funding
  • Recognized as one of America’s Best Large Employers (2025) , America’s Best Employers for New Grads (2024)
  • One of the nation's America’s Most Innovative Companies as noted by Fortune
  • Consistently certified as great place to work
  • A Leading Disability Employer as noted by the National Organization on Disability
  • Magnet® designated for the fourth consecutive time by the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC)

    • Job Responsibilities

    • Clerical Duties - Operates and maintains unit information systems to include-medical record integrity, forms management, timely response to faxes, printed material, mail, and accuracy of patient data, timely completion of admissions, discharges, transfers and short stay documentation. Demonstrates fiscal responsibility and accountability with respect to patient charges/rental equipment, CCHMC charge capture procedures, and ensures that unit maintains a designated par level of clerical supplies.
    • Environmental Management - Ensures that within the division, all areas are organized and present a safe, accessible, effective and efficient environment for patients, families, visitors, and employees. Maintains awareness of patient location and monitors traffic flow at the front desk and on the unit. Assists with compliance of visitor policies and applying arm bands for parents/caregivers. Reports maintenance (wiping down monitors, troubleshooting printer issues, logging off information, etc.) and environmental service needs to appropriate division and follows-up to assure completion. Collaborates with clinical, admitting, information systems and environmental services staff to coordinate efficient patient flow.
    • Systems Management - Identifies system problems and utilizes strategies for resolutions. Responds to communication system/patient alarms and executes with a sense of urgency. Reviews and revises staffing information.
    • Communication - Demonstrates the Cincinnati Children's CARES behaviors in all interactions with patients, families, visitors and co-workers by actively participating as a front-line example of extraordinary customer service and satisfaction
column3:
and interacts with parents/guardians to obtain non-clinical information as requested. Ensures and reviews timeliness, accuracy, availability and security of information (i.e. HIPAA, Informed Consent, Advanced Directive for patients 18 or older) as defined by CCHMC's mission, applicable laws, and regulations. Has in-depth knowledge of HIPAA standards and fosters application to clinical practice.

To provide daily operational/administrative support for the unit and outpatient services. Functions as a resource for clinical personnel regarding unit and outpatient operational issues. Anticipate needs for department and provides coordination of information systems, environmental, admitting and clerical functions for patient areas of a medical center dedicated to the care of infants, children and adolescents.

Job Qualifications

  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • No directly related experience

Market Leading Benefits Including*:

  • Medical coverage starting day 1 of employment. View employee benefits here.
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Tuition reimbursement for continuing education
  • Expansive employee discount programs through our many community partners
  • Shift Differential, Weekend Differential, and Weekend Option Pay Programs
  • Referral bonus program for current staff!
  • Support through Employee Resource Groups such as African American Professionals Advisory Council, Asian Cultural and Professional Group, EQUAL - LGBTQA Resource Group, Juntos - Hispanic/Latin Resource Group, Veterans and Military Family Advocacy Network, and Young Professionals (YP) Resource Group
  • Physical and mental health wellness programs
  • Relocation assistance available for qualified positions
  • Benefits may vary based on FTE Status and Position Type

Primary Location

Burnet Campus

Schedule

Full time

Shift

Day (United States of America)

Department

A4N

Employee Status

Regular

FTE

0.9

Weekly Hours

36

  • Expected Starting Pay Range
  • Annualized pay may vary based on FTE status $17.14 - $20.36

Comprehensive Job Description Provided Upon Request.

Cincinnati Children’s is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating an environment of dignity and respect for all our employees, patients, and families. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, genetic information, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. 4261097178,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/insight-analyst-marketing-at-bally-s-interactive-4261097178?position=10&pageNum=7&refId=8pP3JiBc9aXW6CS3ZgbTdw%3D%3D&trackingId=RAI8czl0kE0cazSz2uu5HA%3D%3D,Insight Analyst - Marketing,Bally's Interactive,"Jersey City, NJ","Who we are

Bally's Corporation is a global casino-entertainment company with a growing omni-channel presence. It currently owns and manages 15 casinos across 10 states, a golf course in New York, a horse racetrack in Colorado, and has access to OSB licenses in 18 states. It also owns Bally's Interactive International, formerly Gamesys Group, a leading, global, online gaming operator, Bally Bet, a first-in-class sports betting platform, and Bally Casino, a growing iCasino platform.

With 10,600 employees, the Company's casino operations include approximately 15,300 slot machines, 580 table games and 3,800 hotel rooms. Upon completing the construction of a permanent casino facility in Chicago, Bally's will own and/or manage 15 casinos across 10 states. Bally’s also has rights to developable land in Las Vegas post the closure of the Tropicana. Its shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol ""BALY"".

The Insights team is an integral and fast expanding department within Bally's Interactive. As a Graduate Insight Analyst, you will continuously work with multiple teams, and across many areas, to optimise market share and create a thrilling experience for our players. With an abundance of data at our disposal our analysts strive to provide the business with actionable recommendations through a vast number of analytical tools.

We pride ourselves on giving our analysts the freedom to explore new software and analytical techniques to produce the best analysis possible. Our friendly and knowledgeable team is always at hand to provide guidance, brainstorm ideas and help teach new concepts.

This role sits within our Marketing vertical and is based in the Jersey City office. The role will focus on providing direct support to the NA Marketing Leadership Team, as well as Product, where you will provide analysis on how we can improve our acquisition, conversion, and retention funnels for our Sports & iGaming (slots, bingo, casino etc.) products.
At the heart of it this role is to help the business better understand the players’ wants and needs.
So, what will you be doing?
Working in collaboration with multiple areas of the business to identify opportunities for Bally's Interactive to grow
Understanding the business, particularly our marketing capabilities, to ensure analytical needs are met
Analyzing data from multiple sources to provide timely and actionable insight
Thinking creatively to improve business and product operations as well as members’ onsite experience
Improving current processes with new, innovative thinking to incorporate data into all decisions
Communicating findings positively and coherently to drive change
And what are we looking for?
Have Bachelor's degree in Mathematics and Statistics or equivalent (STEM/Economics, etc)
Have 1+ years of experience in an analyst position, demonstrating excellent analytical and quantitative skills
Display experience with SQL and Excel
Have understanding of additional languages like Python/R are beneficial, but not essential
Show self-motivation with the desire to find and solve real business problems
Display confidence in delivering your findings to multiple stakeholders across business departments
Showcase excellent analytical and numerical capabilities
Have understanding & passion for our business/industry to ensure analytical needs are met
Have ability to analyze data from multiple sources turning complex concepts into actionable recommendations
Demonstrate adaptability and flexibility as well as multitasking skills
Be able to play a part in a successful team ethic and show excellent communication skills
Be able to navigate through all complexities to deliver best in class experiences to our customers
Different benefits packages are tailored to fit each location, but here’s a taste of what may be on offer

At Bally’s Interactive, we believe in the power of collaboration and working together in a shared space, as well as the benefits of working from home. We champion hybrid working wherever we can, offering a flexible blend of working in the office 3 days a week and from home twice a week.
At Bally’s Interactive, we are driven by a set of core values that we like to call our DNA. We strive to embody our DNA and keep them at the heart of everything we do!

We are Always Ready to embrace change, adapt, and do what it takes to delight our customers. We believe that You Make the Difference, which is what gives our players the best experience and keeps them coming back. We are All One Team, looking out for each other, respecting diversity while connecting through a common purpose. Our teams are Learning Every Day by showing constant curiosity and the drive to learn from successes, mistakes, new experiences, and the people around us. At Bally’s we Love to Lead by thinking differently, seeking innovation, and always looking for ways to raise our game.
At Bally’s Interactive, we are committed to promoting equal opportunities in employment and working conditions.
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are important to us, and we encourage a culture where everyone can be themselves at work.
We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success, this is our superpower.

We do not discriminate against employees or job applicants on the basis of race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, age, sex or sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, political opinion or disability.

Location: Kirtland AFB, Albuquerque, New Mexico

As a JNWC Database Administrator in the Joint Navigation Warfare Center (JNWC) you will help empower the Department of Defense's navigation warfare (NAVWAR) mission ensuring positioning, navigation and timing superiority. You will serve a s a member of a team providing combatant commanders and joint force commanders with subject matter expertise on planning and conducting NAVWAR by providing knowledge of friendly and enemy NAVWAR order of battle and PNT-related successes and threats. You will be responsible for providing database support to all functions of JNWC.
This position is contingent upon award and may be used to fill multiple vacancies.**
You will develop protocols for data processing and handling in compliance with customer standards.
You will analyze database systems involved in the planning, designing, evaluating, and execution of JNWC functions.
You will monitor databases to ensure optimal storage and usability.
A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.

Relevant certification such as IBM Certified Database Administrator - DB2, Microsoft SQL Server database certification, Oracle Certified Professional, MySQL Database Administrator, or industry equivalent.
Knowledge of DoD security regulations, policy and procedures.
Relevant experience commensurate with the position level, with a minimum of three years.
Good communication skills, both verbal and written.
Ability to work independently with limited government oversight and function effectively as part of a team in a joint working environment. (desired)
Current Interim Secret with a pathway to SCI.

Founded in 2007, Canvas connects a passion for going beyond the expected with the knowledge and expertise to deliver what our clients need now and in the future. Canvas has been recognized as a Great Place to Work Certified ™, Fortune Best Small Workplace ™, Fortune Best Workplace for Millennials ™ (2022), Best Place for Working Parents (2022 & 2023), HIRE Vets Gold Medallion Awardee (2021 & 2022), Best Places to Work Awardee, 2019 Government Contracting - Technology Business of the Year, and Woman-Owned Small Business of the Year (2018) by the Huntsville/Madison Chamber of Commerce.
To reflect our company culture, Canvas offers an exciting array of benefits that makes up our employees' total rewards package. Those benefits may include:
Dependent Care and Medical Flexible Spending Accounts
401(k) retirement plan with company match and 100% immediate vesting
Tuition Reimbursement for ongoing training, continuing education, or advanced degree programs
Spot Awards for exemplary individual performance
Final compensation for this position is determined by a variety of factors, such as a candidate's relevant work experience, skills, certifications, and geographic location.
Canvas is an Equal Opportunity Employer
Canvas is an equal opportunity employer and a VEVRAA federal contractor who affords equal employment opportunity to protected veterans and people with disabilities.

Canvas has equal employment opportunities that are based upon a candidate's qualifications and capabilities to perform the essential functions of a particular job and are free from discrimination based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit our Careers page. U.S. citizenship is required for most positions.

Canvas is committed to expanding access to employment for people with disabilities and disabled veterans. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, and your disability prevents you from applying, please advise what reasonable accommodation Canvas can provide to assist you in applying for one of our open positions. You may contact us by sending an email to talent@canvas-inc.com.

Reasonable accommodations are considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation for applying for a specific posted position will be responded to. Requests will be kept confidential and shared strictly on a need-to-know basis. Please be aware, scammers may try to impersonate our company by reaching out regarding job opportunities. We will never ask you for bank account information, checks, or other sensitive information as part of our hiring process. If you're unsure, please email talent@canvas-inc.com with questions.
For further information on Canvas including more information on employee benefits and our company culture, visit our website.
If an offer of employment is extended, applicant must have the ability to pass a background check. Offer of Employment is contingent upon the results.

Job Title: Database Administrator

Location: Kirtland AFB, Albuquerque, New Mexico

As a JNWC Database Administrator in the Joint Navigation Warfare Center (JNWC) you will help empower the Department of Defense's navigation warfare (NAVWAR) mission ensuring positioning, navigation and timing superiority. You will serve a s a member of a team providing combatant commanders and joint force commanders with subject matter expertise on planning and conducting NAVWAR by providing knowledge of friendly and enemy NAVWAR order of battle and PNT-related successes and threats. You will be responsible for providing database support to all functions of JNWC.

  • This position is contingent upon award and may be used to fill multiple vacancies.**

Duties

  • You will develop protocols for data processing and handling in compliance with customer standards.
  • You will analyze database systems involved in the planning, designing, evaluating, and execution of JNWC functions.
  • You will monitor databases to ensure optimal storage and usability.

Requirements

  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • Relevant certification such as IBM Certified Database Administrator - DB2, Microsoft SQL Server database certification, Oracle Certified Professional, MySQL Database Administrator, or industry equivalent.
  • Experience with classified databases.
  • Knowledge of DoD security regulations, policy and procedures.
  • Relevant experience commensurate with the position level, with a minimum of three years.
  • Good communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Ability to work independently with limited government oversight and function effectively as part of a team in a joint working environment. (desired)

Security Clearance

  • Current Interim Secret with a pathway to SCI.

About Us

Founded in 2007, Canvas connects a passion for going beyond the expected with the knowledge and expertise to deliver what our clients need now and in the future. Canvas has been recognized as a Great Place to Work Certified ™, Fortune Best Small Workplace ™, Fortune Best Workplace for Millennials ™ (2022), Best Place for Working Parents (2022 &

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>
Athenix Solutions Group is looking to hire a Database Developer to support a large program in the Chantilly, VA area.

This opportunity will provide operations and maintenance (O&M) and database development for legacy databases for systems to include the enterprise API Gateway, EDW and new modern databases consistent with the Sponsor’s business data strategy. The Database Developer shall provide support for deployment packaging, system maintenance and troubleshooting to maintain sustainability and reliability of systems and applications. These mission critical systems must continue without interruption and meet approved timelines for new development activities.
Use existing enterprise services rather than building single-purpose solutions.
Ensure each new application or system enhancement meets agreed upon performance Service Level Agreements (SLAs) for system up-time, concurrent users, and system recovery.
Monitor each application to provide status awareness and include a resolution plan for the application in the event of its failure.
Recommend changes to current applications and databases based on requirements.
Recommend modernization options for data hosting, data transport, data cleansing, data exposure and data ingestion at an enterprise scale.

Make recommendations for modernization with a focus on performance, security, and cost, with the flexibility to store and manage large volumes of disparate, enterprise datasets while identifying the authoritative dataset and reducing dataset duplication.
Manage instances of cloud infrastructure services and multiple cloud servers.
Manage enhancements and improvements to current data systems technology and processes, including data access authorizations against enterprise-approved user attributes and solutions with oversight.
Create functional design specifications, architectures, and render support with other cloud project deliverables.
Continuously evaluate program progress and evaluate incoming information to ensure the program is progressing on schedule.
Coordinate stakeholder engagements, such as user requirements sessions and training.
Define, analyze, track, review and categorizes technical and functional requirements.
Support tasks requiring collecting, compiling, evaluating, and publishing information and statistical data included in documents, records, forms, reports, plans, policies and regulations.
Interface with stakeholders to ensure user stories are accurately and properly documented.
Provide frequent contact with customers, traceability within program documents, and the overall computing environment and architecture.

Provide data architecture, analyst, and integration support to identify the enterprise data needs and design master ‘blueprints’, to include alignment to customer’s systems, data investments, business strategy for Sponsor consideration, and data access governance as directed by multiple functional data stewards.
Provide operations and maintenance of databases in the cloud infrastructure.
Provide project management support to the Sponsor Software Development Lifecycle process.
Active Clearance: TS/SCI with Polygraph?is required.
Demonstrated experience utilizing Oracle and PostgreSQL databases.
Demonstrated experience with Tableau and COGNOS for reporting presentation.
Demonstrated experience developing and interfacing with Application Program Interfaces (APIs).
Demonstrated experience performing testing and quality assurance of developed solutions within the existing Oracle data tier.
Demonstrated experience developing, creating, and modifying data structure and data load routines for analytic use cases.
Demonstrated experience working with relational data tiers including cleansing, transforming, and processing of structured data.
Demonstrated experience developing and supporting applications using Java, JavaScript, and Python.
Demonstrated experience working with views, triggers and Oracle PL and SQL.
Demonstrated knowledge of Amazon Web Services environments, including RDS, S3, etc.
Demonstrated experience working within an Agile project management model.
Demonstrated experience as agile scrum master.
Demonstrated experience with Amazon Web Services/Cloud Data Migration Services.
Demonstrated experience with IMMUTA data policy.
Demonstrated experience collaborating with Sponsor staff, IT customers, and other technical and non-technical staff and contractors at all levels.
Demonstrated experience with a variety of data repository types (i.e., relational, NoSQL, distributed processing framework, etc.).
Demonstrated experience creating and interfacing with REST APIs.

Athenix Solutions Group is looking to hire a Database Developer to support a large program in the Chantilly, VA area.

This opportunity will provide operations and maintenance (O&

  • Manage enhancements and improvements to current data systems technology and processes, including data access authorizations against enterprise-approved user attributes and solutions with oversight.
  • Create functional design specifications, architectures, and render support with other cloud project deliverables.
  • Continuously evaluate program progress and evaluate incoming information to ensure the program is progressing on schedule.
  • Coordinate stakeholder engagements, such as user requirements sessions and training.
  • Define, analyze, track, review and categorizes technical and functional requirements.
  • Support tasks requiring collecting, compiling, evaluating, and publishing information and statistical data included in documents, records, forms, reports, plans, policies and regulations.
  • Interface with stakeholders to ensure user stories are accurately and properly documented.
  • Provide frequent contact with customers, traceability within program documents, and the overall computing environment and architecture.
  • Provide data architecture, analyst, and integration support to identify the enterprise data needs and design master ‘blueprints’, to include alignment to customer’s systems, data investments, business strategy for Sponsor consideration, and data access governance as directed by multiple functional data stewards.
  • Participate in daily scrum meetings.
  • Provide operations and maintenance of databases in the cloud infrastructure.
  • Provide project management support to the Sponsor Software Development Lifecycle process.

Requirements

  • Active Clearance: TS/SCI with Polygraph?is required.
  • Demonstrated experience utilizing Oracle and PostgreSQL databases.
  • Demonstrated experience with Tableau and COGNOS for reporting presentation.
  • Demonstrated experience developing and interfacing with Application Program Interfaces (APIs).
  • Demonstrated experience performing testing and quality assurance of developed solutions within the existing Oracle data tier.
  • Demonstrated experience developing, creating, and modifying data structure and data load routines for analytic use cases.
  • Demonstrated experience working with relational data tiers including cleansing, transforming, and processing of structured data.
  • Demonstrated experience developing and supporting applications using Java, JavaScript, and Python.
  • Demonstrated experience working with views, triggers and Oracle PL and SQL.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of Amazon Web Services environments, including RDS, S3, etc.
  • Demonstrated experience working within an Agile project management model.

Highly Desired

  • Demonstrated experience as agile scrum master.
  • Demonstrated experience with Amazon Web Services/Cloud Data Migration Services.
  • Demonstrated experience with JIRA.
  • Demonstrated experience with IMMUTA data policy.
  • Demonstrated experience collaborating with Sponsor staff, IT customers, and other technical and non-technical staff and contractors at all levels.
  • Demonstrated experience with a variety of data repository types (i.e., relational, NoSQL, distributed processing framework, etc.).
  • Demonstrated experience creating and interfacing with REST APIs.

4271800393,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/back-office-commercial-support-specialist-at-ncardia-4271800393?position=6&pageNum=10&refId=zp7%2B6wQztKHJTicNi8ERXA%3D%3D&trackingId=Ch0c9Q6qjCFkxOOmWQl6ow%3D%3D,Back Office Commercial Support Specialist,Ncardia,United States,"Position Summary

The Back Office Commercial Support Specialist will be a highly organized and commercially minded individual with experience supporting sales operations in the life sciences sector. They will drive key activities including proposal generation, CRM management, competitive intelligence, and lead generation to support Ncardia’s sales and business development efforts. This role is critical to ensuring smooth commercial execution and accelerating revenue growth. The ideal candidate will bring operational excellence, a solid understanding of the iPSC market, and strong collaboration skills to help enable success across the commercial team.
Prepare client-specific proposals for iPSC products, assays, and custom services.
Support pricing alignment and technical content integration in collaboration with the scientific and BD teams.
Maintain and regularly update standardized proposal templates and reference documents.
Manage CRM records for biotech, pharma, and academic clients working in neuroscience, cardiac safety, toxicology, and disease modeling using iPSC platforms.
Track opportunity progression and generate reports to support sales forecasting and territory performance reviews.
Ensure data quality and segmentation for targeted outreach.
Conduct deep-dive research into competitors in the iPSC and regenerative medicine space.
Track innovations, partnerships, pricing models, and market positioning to inform go-to-market strategies.
Prepare monthly competitor landscape briefs and ad hoc reports for leadership.
Lead Generation and Client List Creation:
Build qualified lead lists targeting pharma, biotech, CROs, and academic research groups focused on iPSC-based drug discovery and development.
Use industry databases, publications, and digital platforms (e.g., LinkedIn, PubMed, conference rosters) to identify new prospects.
Research and qualify leads and develop outreach strategies to engage prospective clients
Segment and maintain high-quality, actionable contact lists aligned with marketing and BD campaigns.
Support lead generation at conferences and trade shows
Degree in Life Sciences or a related field
Minimum of 2 years of experience in a commercial support role within biotech, pharma or life sciences
Knowledgeable of iPSC technologies and their applications in drug discovery and development is strongly preferred.
Strong understanding of drug development processes, and the needs of pharmaceutical, biotech and CRO clients.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly and persuasively
Experience with CRM tools (Salesforce, Hubspot) and document management platforms.
Excellent organization and time management skills.
Proactive, with demonstrated ability to achieve or exceed key performance indicators
Exposure to iPSC-derived models for neuroscience, cardiotoxicity, or disease modeling.
Familiarity with global biotech and pharma client landscapes.
Prior use of lead enrichment tools (e.g., LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Global Data, Zoom Info, BioPharm Insight).
Customer-focused with a consultative sales approach
Team player with the ability to collaborate across functions
Send your motivation letter with curriculum vitae to: careers@ncardia.com

Position Summary

The Back Office Commercial Support Specialist will be a highly organized and commercially minded individual with experience supporting sales operations in the life sciences sector. They will drive key activities including proposal generation, CRM management, competitive intelligence, and lead generation to support Ncardia’s sales and business development efforts. This role is critical to ensuring smooth commercial execution and accelerating revenue growth. The ideal candidate will bring operational excellence, a solid understanding of the iPSC market, and strong collaboration skills to help enable success across the commercial team.

Responsibilities And Duties

  • Proposal Generation:
    • Prepare client-specific proposals for iPSC products, assays, and custom services.
    • Support pricing alignment and technical content integration in collaboration with the scientific and BD teams.
    • Maintain and regularly update standardized proposal templates and reference documents.

  • CRM Management:
    • Manage CRM records for biotech, pharma, and academic clients working in neuroscience, cardiac safety, toxicology, and disease modeling using iPSC platforms.
    • Track opportunity progression and generate reports to support sales forecasting and territory performance reviews.
    • Ensure data quality and segmentation for targeted outreach.

  • Competitive Intelligence:
    • Conduct deep-dive research into competitors in the iPSC and regenerative medicine space.
    • Track innovations, partnerships, pricing models, and market positioning to inform go-to-market strategies.
    • Prepare monthly competitor landscape briefs and ad hoc reports for leadership.

  • Lead Generation and Client List Creation:
    • Build qualified lead lists targeting pharma, biotech, CROs, and academic research groups focused on iPSC-based drug discovery and development.
    • Use industry databases, publications, and digital platforms (e.g., LinkedIn, PubMed, conference rosters) to identify new prospects.
    • Research and qualify leads and develop outreach strategies to engage prospective clients
    • Segment and maintain high-quality, actionable contact lists aligned with marketing and BD campaigns.
    • Support lead generation at conferences and trade shows
Qualifications And Skills

  • Degree in Life Sciences or a related field
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience in a commercial support role within biotech, pharma or life sciences
  • Knowledgeable of iPSC technologies and their applications in drug discovery and development is strongly preferred.
  • Strong understanding of drug development processes, and the needs of pharmaceutical, biotech and CRO clients.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly and persuasively
  • Experience with CRM tools (Salesforce, Hubspot) and document management platforms.
  • Excellent organization and time management skills.
  • Proactive, with demonstrated ability to achieve or exceed key performance indicators

Preferred Attributes

  • Exposure to iPSC-derived models for neuroscience, cardiotoxicity, or disease modeling.
  • Familiarity with global biotech and pharma client landscapes.
  • Prior use of lead enrichment tools (e.g., LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Global Data, Zoom Info, BioPharm Insight).

Key Competencies

  • Proactive, results-driven, and self-motivated
  • Strong research and analytical skills
  • Customer-focused with a consultative sales approach
  • Team player with the ability to collaborate across functions

Interested?

Send your motivation letter with curriculum vitae to: careers@ncardia.com

4271803063,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/associate-engineer-data-platform-us-based-remote-at-lensa-4271803063?position=10&pageNum=10&refId=zp7%2B6wQztKHJTicNi8ERXA%3D%3D&trackingId=sJCERSkTWYIKhkZUTBDLsA%3D%3D,Associate Engineer Data Platform - US Based Remote,Lensa,"Kansas City, MO","Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Anywhere Real Estate. Clicking ""Apply Now"" or ""Read more"" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.
Anywhere is at the forefront of driving the digital transformation and building best-in-class products that help our agents and brokers sell more homes, make more money, and work more efficiently.

Data & Analytics (DNA) is Anywhere's data arm. We create innovative analytics, data science, and robust data foundation capabilities to generate data-driven insights that serve the heart of Anywhere Advisor and Anywhere Brand business. Together with our business counterparts in the real estate business, we work daily to deliver differentiating insights (AI & BI) for Strategy and AA & AB Operations.

We need a talented, creative, and motivated engineer who loves building data platform tools and thrives in a collaborative environment. You're the perfect fit if you have a related degree and a passion for programming and data! You'll enjoy developing tools like Data Ingestion Platforms to bring data from diverse sources into our Data Lake and Data Streaming Platform, as well as tools for monitoring and observability. You'll achieve great things with us at Anywhere with your commitment to quality, excellent data/cloud skills, and team spirit.
Build Scalable Solutions: Create high-performance, scalable data solutions for millions of agents, brokers, home buyers, and sellers.
Collaborate on Data Streaming: Work with fellow Data Engineers to develop our Next Generation Data Streaming Platform.

Develop Data Ingestion Platforms: Implement real-time data streaming from SQL Server, MySQL, and Oracle using CDC-based technologies, as well as from third-party APIs, internal micro-services, and files stored in S3/sftp servers.
Enhance Data Quality: Collaborate on developing Data Quality and Ops Platforms for real-time data anomaly detection and data profiling.
CI/CD in the Cloud: Develop CI/CD processes for continuous delivery in AWS Cloud.
Support and Troubleshoot: Perform production issues, troubleshooting, and resolution, focusing on observability to detect issues in advance.
Degree: Bachelor's in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical discipline, or an equivalent combination of training and experience.
Programming Experience: Ideally, you have one or more years of experience with programming languages such as Go, Java, Python, or NodeJS.
Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
Problem Solving Skills: Strong analytical & problem-solving skills to identify data issues and performance bottlenecks.

4275338901,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/program-coordinator-at-sifma-foundation-4275338901?position=1&pageNum=12&refId=ai8qb6CULizlYZCQKuzGWw%3D%3D&trackingId=xBDY2En80Gv7dAm33aCMtQ%3D%3D,Program Coordinator,SIFMA Foundation,United States,"Position Overview: Are you a dynamic, enthusiastic individual with a passion for education and finance? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy managing diverse projects? If so, we want you to join our team as a Program Consultant! In this role, you will lead and assist in expanding our impactful programs while directly contributing to our mission of financial education and leveling the playing field for all youth. You will play a key role in building and nurturing relationships with schools, non-profit organizations, and other stakeholders, driving engagement and participation in our programs.

The SIFMA Foundation is the leader in financial education, committed to preparing youth for a financially savvy future.Our flagship programs, including The Stock Market Game™, InvestWrite® national essay competition, the Capitol Hill Challenge™, and Invest It Forward®, have empowered over 23 million students since 1977. We are seeking a highly energetic and proactive Program Consultant to support our National Stock Market Game Director and team to amplify our reach and impact, especially among underserved youth.

Program Management: Spearhead the administration and enhancement of The Stock Market Game (SMG) and other key Foundation programs. This includes customer service, program updates, registration processes, and scheduling. Provide support to participants and partners across various locations, ensuring efficient program delivery.

Engagement & Outreach: Build and strengthen relationships with schools and non-profit organizations. Develop targeted outreach strategies to engage these groups and increase participation in our programs. Work closely with educational institutions and community organizations to address their needs and demonstrate the value of our financial education programs.

Marketing & Public Relations: Lead efforts to expand the visibility and reach of SMG, Capitol Hill Challenge (CHC), InvestWrite, SMG InvestQuest™ and Invest It Forward (IIF) programs. Design and execute compelling marketing campaigns, analyze their effectiveness, and refine strategies to meet program goals.

Representation & Training: Represent the SIFMA Foundation and SMG program at conferences and assist or lead teacher training workshops/webinars, providing valuable insights and resources on the use of our programs.

Database & Content Management: Oversee the management and maintenance of program databases and files. Develop email communications, presentation materials, reports, and press releases to support program initiatives and engagement.

General Support: Provide comprehensive support for various program-related activities, including preparing background documents, meeting agendas, and other necessary materials regarding program delivery.
Education: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university.

Experience: A strong understanding of the K-12 education system is crucial. Experience in teaching or educational administration is preferred. A passion for financial education and investing is essential.
Skills: Exceptional writing and communication skills, with a proven ability to engage diverse audiences. Proficiency in Excel and Microsoft Office is required
column2: familiarity with Canva, Constant Contact, and Mailchimp is a plus.

column1: Attributes: Highly organized, proactive, and resourceful, with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously. A team player who can work independently and demonstrates a strong commitment to program goals.
Other: Willingness to travel as needed to support program activities and events.
