4261139497,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/automotive-data-analyst-at-dekra-italy-4261139497?position=11&pageNum=0&refId=wUqHhQbl5CnBhHsA4mqQQw%3D%3D&trackingId=KX8wteiVIt6Qostoh8ekZg%3D%3D,Automotive Data Analyst,DEKRA Italy,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Nell’ambito dei progetti per la divisione Network Automotive, verranno affidate alla risorsa attività di back office a supporto del team di consulenti che, per conto della casa costruttrice committente, sostiene le aziende concessionarie allo scopo di aumentare la penetrazione e le performance commerciali sul territorio.
La risorsa riporterà al Project Manager del progetto e si occuperà delle seguenti attività primarie in modo autonomo e con un crescente grado di responsabilità:
Aggiornamento delle dashboard e di presentazioni per il Cliente committente
Acquisizione dei dati funzionali all’analisi e al monitoraggio dei KPI’s, al fine di confrontare l’andamento delle performance
Raccolta dei feedback provenienti dal territorio, propedeutici al miglioramento della gestione delle attività di progetto e facilitare il raggiungimento dei target
Pianificazione delle visite Consulenti/Coach DEKRA presso le concessionarie
Partecipazione a meeting di follow-up con il Cliente committente ed il relativo HQ

La risorsa, da inserire in un contesto denso di obiettivi ambiziosi, con reali possibilità di crescita all’interno e sviluppo trasversale, coopererà costruttivamente al raggiungimento del miglior risultato del progetto attivandosi proattivamente anche per la diffusione ed il rispetto dei valori aziendali.
Laurea in discipline tecniche o economiche
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese (livello minimo: B2)
Capacità di analisi ed interpretazione dati
1 o 2 anni di esperienza nel ruolo in contesti strutturati ed in ambito Consulenza
Conoscenza avanzata del Pacchetto Office, in particolare Excel e Power Point
Buona conoscenza di Power BI, Power automate e Power Query
Esperienza pregressa nel settore della mobilità presso Dealer, Case costruttrici o Società di servizi
Incentivo economico al raggiungimento degli obiettivi
Possibilità di fruire di 2 giornate di smart working a settimana
KIT ICT: PC, smartphone ed internet key.
Nel rispetto della Legge n. 68/1999, DEKRA accoglie in via prioritaria le candidature delle categorie protette (Art. 1 e Art. 18).

Nell’ambito dei progetti per la divisione Network Automotive, verranno affidate alla risorsa attività di back office a supporto del team di consulenti che, per conto della casa costruttrice committente, sostiene le aziende concessionarie allo scopo di aumentare la penetrazione e le performance commerciali sul territorio.


La risorsa riporterà al Project Manager del progetto e si occuperà delle seguenti attività primarie in modo autonomo e con un crescente grado di responsabilità:


  • Produzione della reportistica interna
  • Aggiornamento delle dashboard e di presentazioni per il Cliente committente
  • Acquisizione dei dati funzionali all’analisi e al monitoraggio dei KPI’s, al fine di confrontare l’andamento delle performance
  • Raccolta dei feedback provenienti dal territorio, propedeutici al miglioramento della gestione delle attività di progetto e facilitare il raggiungimento dei target
  • Pianificazione delle visite Consulenti/Coach DEKRA presso le concessionarie
  • Partecipazione a meeting di follow-up con il Cliente committente ed il relativo HQ


La risorsa, da inserire in un contesto denso di obiettivi ambiziosi, con reali possibilità di crescita all’interno e sviluppo trasversale, coopererà costruttivamente al raggiungimento del miglior risultato del progetto attivandosi proattivamente anche per la diffusione ed il rispetto dei valori aziendali.


REQUISITI MINIMI

  • Laurea in discipline tecniche o economiche
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese (livello minimo: B2)
  • Capacità di analisi ed interpretazione dati
  • 1 o 2 anni di esperienza nel ruolo in contesti strutturati ed in ambito Consulenza
  • Conoscenza avanzata del Pacchetto Office, in particolare Excel e Power Point
  • Master DAX and M languages
  • Buona conoscenza di Power BI, Power automate e Power Query
  • Precisione, affidabilità e capacità organizzative
  • Orientamento ai risultati


REQUISITI PREFERENZIALI

  • Esperienza pregressa nel settore della mobilità presso Dealer, Case costruttrici o Società di servizi
  • Passione per il settore Automotive
  • Disponibilità ad effettuare trasferte


COMPENSO, BENEFIT E KIT ICT

  • Compenso commisurato alla seniority
  • Incentivo economico al raggiungimento degli obiettivi
  • Ticket restaurant
  • Convenzioni aziendali
  • Assicurazione sanitaria integrativa
  • Possibilità di fruire di 2 giornate di smart working a settimana
  • KIT ICT: PC, smartphone ed internet key.


Nel rispetto della Legge n. 68/1999, DEKRA accoglie in via prioritaria le candidature delle categorie protette (Art. 1 e Art. 18).

4234279975,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/aml-data-analyst-intern-at-worldline-4234279975?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=wUqHhQbl5CnBhHsA4mqQQw%3D%3D&trackingId=NSv1bmToqy2ZGxlZJdOCqA%3D%3D,AML Data Analyst Intern,Worldline,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Job Description

We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. The solutions our people build today power the growth of millions of businesses tomorrow. From your local coffee shop to unicorns and international banks. From San Francisco to Auckland. We are in every corner of the world, in every part of commerce. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.

Join a dynamic team dedicated to support the growth in full compliance with Worldline’s merchant risk policies safeguarding our financial forefront, where every day offers the chance to make an impact in the fight against money laundering and terrorism financing. We are seeking a AML Data Analyst Intern to join our team, reporting to the Head of First Line of Defense Risk and Compliance at Worldline Merchant Services Italia. Your role will play a crucial role in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support business decision-making, to streamline operations and ensure compliance with the company's standards.

Reporting KYC: Gather data needed for AML KYC purposes from different business sources and prepare monthly reports detailing KYC information, ensuring weekly updates to reflect current review status in monthly committees

Reporting Internal Committee: Compile data related to KYC, Credit, and Fraud activities into an annual report file including statistics and updates from involved departments (Compliance, Operations, AML) on periodic basis
Reporting Business Information KPIs: Analyze Business Information KPIs in onboarding and ongoing merchant activities
column2: Identify consumption trends or changes, highlighting concerns or improvement opportunities in relation to contractual consumption caps

column1: Preparation of Functional Analysis Files for IT Implementations: Support internal Project Managers in the collaboration with Compliance, Operations, Information Technology to collect and document business requirements for different IT Implementation.
We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:
Master's degree in Economics, Management, or Law
Familiarity with data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R)
Strong critical thinking, analytical, and organizational skills
Basic knowledge of KYC and AML processes as a plus
Good level of English in speaking and writing.
At Worldline you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide.
Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career.
Enjoy wide range of training through our eLearning platforms (LinkedIn Learning, Percipio, Speex, Cross Knowledge).

We are on an exciting journey towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers, people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. With an empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career - wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of 18,000 innovators and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

This is Worldline

We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. The solutions our people build today power the growth of millions of businesses tomorrow. From your local coffee shop to unicorns and international banks. From San Francisco to Auckland.     We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:

Benefits

At Worldline you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:

  • Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide.
  • Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career.
  • Enjoy remote work (50%).
  • Enjoy wide range of training through our eLearning platforms (LinkedIn Learning, Percipio, Speex, Cross Knowledge).

Shape the evolution

We are on an exciting journey towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers, people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. With an empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career - wherever you decide to go. 4226889954,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/power-bi-data-analyst-rif-2025-151-at-aizoon-technology-consulting-4226889954?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=wUqHhQbl5CnBhHsA4mqQQw%3D%3D&trackingId=5yUIDsK8tDnFtJpF3x0yGw%3D%3D,Power BI Data Analyst (Rif. 2025-151),aizoOn Technology Consulting,"Rome, Latium, Italy","aizoOn, società di consulenza tecnologica di innovazione, indipendente, che opera a livello globale ricerca un / a Power BI Data Analyst.

All’interno dell’area ICT della Divisione Transportation di aizoOn, si ricerca un/una professionista con competenze consolidate in Power BI, analisi dati e data engineering, da inserire su un progetto strategico presso un cliente multinazionale leader nel settore ferroviario.
Il/la candidato/a selezionato/a sarà coinvolto/a in un’iniziativa di ingegnerizzazione di una soluzione Power BI, con responsabilità dirette nella:
Progettazione e realizzazione di dashboard interattive e scalabili, in grado di rappresentare informazioni complesse in modo chiaro e funzionale
Analisi e gestione di grandi volumi di dati, con l’obiettivo di estrarre insight utili al supporto decisionale
Definizione e implementazione di processi ETL robusti e ottimizzati
Produzione di report personalizzati e KPI a supporto delle diverse funzioni aziendali
Laurea in discipline tecnico-scientifiche (es. Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica)
Esperienza pregressa di almeno 2-3 anni in ambito data analysis o business intelligence
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese, scritta e parlata
Ottima padronanza di Microsoft Power BI, sia lato modellazione dati sia visualizzazione
Competenze in DAX per la creazione di misure, colonne calcolate e logiche avanzate
Possibilità di lavorare in modalità Ibrida presso cliente a Roma.
The job search refers to candidates of both genders

Attività previste

  • Analisi e gestione di grandi volumi di dati, con l’obiettivo di estrarre insight utili al supporto decisionale

4264214059,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-specialist-at-iberdrola-4264214059?position=16&pageNum=0&refId=wUqHhQbl5CnBhHsA4mqQQw%3D%3D&trackingId=dLImtkGoOv%2BCR1RguqYKxQ%3D%3D,DATA ANALYST SPECIALIST,Iberdrola,"Rome, Latium, Italy","The Planning & Investment unit in Iberdrola Italia is critical to the strategic success of the organization. This unit is responsible for project portfolio management, strategic planning. It works closely with both business units and the global team to ensure that initiatives are aligned with long-term corporate goals. Additionally, the unit analyzes market trends, studying competitors and trends of interest. The unit is looking for a talented Data Analyst to join the team to support these crucial activities by analyzing data and providing strategic insights.

The Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, normalizing, analyzing and interpreting data to support strategic planning and business decisions. In particular, the Data Analyst collects relevant strategic data from different business sources, including internal reports and input from business leaders.

A key part of their job is to ensure that data is accurate and consistent, eliminating errors and duplicates through data normalization processes. The Data Analyst is also involved in the design of strategic dashboards and reports, creating interactive visualizations that connect different data sources to provide a complete and up-to-date view of business performance. They implement systems for automating reports, reducing manual work and improving efficiency. Using statistical models and machine learning algorithms, the Data Analyst performs predictive analysis to forecast future trends and support strategic planning. They also analyze data to identify new opportunities for growth and improvement, as well as potential risks. Furthermore, the Data Analyst plays a fundamental role in market research, gathering information on market trends and competitors, and uses this information to identify opportunities for growth and improvement, thus maintaining a competitive advantage in the industry. Finally, the Data Analyst continuously monitors key performance metrics (KPIs) through dashboards, quickly identifying any problems or opportunitie
He/She provides decision support to managers and business leaders through data analysis and the presentation of strategic insights, thus contributing to the achievement of business objectives.
Master's degree in statistics, engineering, or business administration

Data Analysis Experience: The candidate should have hands-on experience in data analysis, preferably in a business context. This includes the ability to work with large data sets, use analytics tools such as SQL, Python, R, and visualization software such as Power BI.
Analytics Project Management: Experience in planning and monitoring data analytics projects and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and work under pressure.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Experience in working with multiple business functions to ensure that data analytics plans are well-integrated and support business objectives.

Market Research and Competitor Analysis: Experience in gathering and analyzing information on market trends and competitors. This includes analyzing market conditions and studying competitor strategies.

Dashboard and Report Design: Experience in creating interactive dashboards and strategic reports, connecting multiple data sources to provide a comprehensive and up-to-date view of business performance. This includes implementing interactive features such as drill-down, filters and dynamic selections.

Reporting Process Automation: Experience in implementing systems to automatically generate periodic reports, reducing manual work and improving efficiency. This demonstrates the ability to improve business processes through automation.

Continuous KPI Monitoring: Experience in continuously monitoring key performance metrics (KPIs) through dashboards, quickly identifying any issues or opportunities. This includes the ability to provide decision support to managers and business leaders through data analysis and the presentation of strategic insights.

(Plus) Predictive Analytics and Modeling: Experience using statistical models and machine learning algorithms to forecast future trends and support strategic planning. This includes the ability to develop and implement predictive models to solve complex business problems.
Statistics and Mathematics: A solid understanding of statistical and mathematical techniques is essential to analyze and interpret data.
Research Methodologies: Knowledge of market research methodologies and competitor analysis to identify trends and opportunities.
Business Intelligence: Understanding of business dynamics and economic analysis techniques to support strategic decisions.
SQL: Ability to use SQL to query databases, extract data, and optimize queries
Data Visualization: Ability to create effective visualizations using tools such as Power BI, and Python libraries
Excel: Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel for rapid analysis and data management
(Plus) Programming: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and R, which are essential for data manipulation and statistical analysis
(Plus) Machine Learning: Knowledge of machine learning algorithms for predictive analytics and data modeling
SQL: Used for database management and querying
Power BI: Data visualization tools to create interactive dashboards and reports
(Plus) Python: Fundamental for data manipulation, statistical analysis, and visualization
(Plus) R: Useful for statistical analysis and data visualization

Critical Analysis Skills: Being able to critically evaluate data, identify patterns and trends, and draw meaningful conclusions. This skill is essential to correctly interpret data and make informed decisions.
Problem Solving: Having a proactive approach to problem solving, finding innovative and practical solutions to challenges that arise during data analysis.

Effective Communication: Being able to clearly and concisely communicate the results of the analysis to various stakeholders, including managers and business leaders, using language that even those without technical skills can understand.

Collaboration and Teamwork: Working well in teams, collaborating with colleagues from different business functions to ensure that data analysis projects are well-integrated and support business objectives.
Time Management: Being able to effectively manage one's time, balancing multiple projects and meeting deadlines. This skill is crucial to maintaining efficiency and productivity.

Adaptability and Flexibility: Be ready to adapt to changes and new challenges, while maintaining a positive and proactive attitude. The world of data is constantly evolving, so the ability to adapt quickly is essential.
Attention to Detail: Have a keen eye for detail, ensuring that data is accurate and analysis is precise. This skill helps avoid mistakes that could compromise business decision

Strategic Thinking: Being able to see the big picture and understand how data analytics fit into the overall business strategy. This helps ensure that the Data Analyst's work is aligned with business goals.

Intellectual Curiosity: Having a strong curiosity and desire to continually learn new techniques, tools, and methodologies. This attitude helps keep skills up to date and constantly improve one's abilities.

Our culture is strongly committed to creating an inclusive and collaborative environment, so we respect people and their differences. All qualified applicants will be considered for this selection process regardless of age, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender or gender identity.
Tenga en cuenta que cualquier solicitante que no sea ciudadano del país de la vacante estará sujeto al cumplimiento de los requisitos de inmigración aplicables para trabajar legalmente en ese país.

column2:
Investment unit in Iberdrola Italia is critical to the strategic success of the organization. This unit is responsible for project portfolio management, strategic planning. It works closely with both business units and the global team to ensure that initiatives are aligned with long-term corporate goals. Additionally, the unit analyzes market trends, studying competitors and trends of interest. The unit is looking for a talented Data Analyst to join the team to support these crucial activities by analyzing data and providing strategic insights.

Role Description

The Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, normalizing, analyzing and interpreting data to support strategic planning and business decisions. In particular, the Data Analyst collects relevant strategic data from different business sources, including internal reports and input from business leaders.

A key part of their job is to ensure that data is accurate and consistent, eliminating errors and duplicates through data normalization processes. The Data Analyst is also involved in the design of strategic dashboards and reports, creating interactive visualizations that connect different data sources to provide a complete and up-to-date view of business performance. They implement systems for automating reports, reducing manual work and improving efficiency. Using statistical models and machine learning algorithms, the Data Analyst performs predictive analysis to forecast future trends and support strategic planning. They also analyze data to identify new opportunities for growth and improvement, as well as potential risks. Furthermore, the Data Analyst plays a fundamental role in market research, gathering information on market trends and competitors, and uses this information to identify opportunities for growth and improvement, thus maintaining a competitive advantage in the industry. Finally, the Data Analyst continuously monitors key performance metrics (KPIs) through dashboards, quickly identifying any problems or opportunitie

He/She provides decision support to managers and business leaders through data analysis and the presentation of strategic insights, thus contributing to the achievement of business objectives.

Requirements

Education

Master's degree in statistics, engineering, or business administration

Professional Experience

  • Data Analysis Experience: The candidate should have hands-on experience in data analysis, preferably in a business context. This includes the ability to work with large data sets, use analytics tools such as SQL, Python, R, and visualization software such as Power BI.
  • Analytics Project Management: Experience in planning and monitoring data analytics projects and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and work under pressure.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Experience in working with multiple business functions to ensure that data analytics plans are well-integrated and support business objectives.
  • Market Research and Competitor Analysis: Experience in gathering and analyzing information on market trends and competitors. This includes analyzing market conditions and studying competitor strategies.
  • Dashboard and Report Design: Experience in creating interactive dashboards and strategic reports, connecting multiple data sources to provide a comprehensive and up-to-date view of business performance. This includes implementing interactive features such as drill-down, filters and dynamic selections.
  • Reporting Process Automation: Experience in implementing systems to automatically generate periodic reports, reducing manual work and improving efficiency. This demonstrates the ability to improve business processes through automation.
  • Continuous KPI Monitoring: Experience in continuously monitoring key performance metrics (KPIs) through dashboards, quickly identifying any issues or opportunities. This includes the ability to provide decision support to managers and business leaders through data analysis and the presentation of strategic insights.
  • (Plus) Predictive Analytics and Modeling: Experience using statistical models and machine learning algorithms to forecast future trends and support strategic planning. This includes the ability to develop and implement predictive models to solve complex business problems.

Specific Knowledge

  • Statistics and Mathematics: A solid understanding of statistical and mathematical techniques is essential to analyze and interpret data.
  • Research Methodologies: Knowledge of market research methodologies and competitor analysis to identify trends and opportunities.
  • Business Intelligence: Understanding of business dynamics and economic analysis techniques to support strategic decisions.

Technical Skills

  • SQL: Ability to use SQL to query databases, extract data, and optimize queries
  • Data Visualization: Ability to create effective visualizations using tools such as Power BI, and Python libraries
  • Excel: Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel for rapid analysis and data management
  • (Plus) Programming: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and R, which are essential for data manipulation and statistical analysis
  • (Plus) Machine Learning: Knowledge of machine learning algorithms for predictive analytics and data modeling

Software Requirements

  • SQL: Used for database management and querying
  • Power BI: Data visualization tools to create interactive dashboards and reports
  • (Plus) Python: Fundamental for data manipulation, statistical analysis, and visualization
  • (Plus) R: Useful for statistical analysis and data visualization

Soft Skills

  • Critical Analysis Skills: Being able to critically evaluate data, identify patterns and trends, and draw meaningful conclusions. This skill is essential to correctly interpret data and make informed decisions.
  • Problem Solving: Having a proactive approach to problem solving, finding innovative and practical solutions to challenges that arise during data analysis.
  • Effective Communication: Being able to clearly and concisely communicate the results of the analysis to various stakeholders, including managers and business leaders, using language that even those without technical skills can understand.
  • Collaboration and Teamwork: Working well in teams, collaborating with colleagues from different business functions to ensure that data analysis projects are well-integrated and support business objectives.
  • Time Management: Being able to effectively manage one's time, balancing multiple projects and meeting deadlines. This skill is crucial to maintaining efficiency and productivity.
  • Adaptability and Flexibility: Be ready to adapt to changes and new challenges, while maintaining a positive and proactive attitude. The world of data is constantly evolving, so the ability to adapt quickly is essential.
  • Attention to Detail: Have a keen eye for detail, ensuring that data is accurate and analysis is precise. This skill helps avoid mistakes that could compromise business decision
  • Strategic Thinking: Being able to see the big picture and understand how data analytics fit into the overall business strategy. This helps ensure that the Data Analyst's work is aligned with business goals.
  • Intellectual Curiosity: Having a strong curiosity and desire to continually learn new techniques, tools, and methodologies. This attitude helps keep skills up to date and constantly improve one's abilities.

Languages

Italian and Spanish and/or Englis

Our culture is strongly committed to creating an inclusive and collaborative environment, so we respect people and their differences. All qualified applicants will be considered for this selection process regardless of age, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender or gender identity.

Información Movilidad

Tenga en cuenta que cualquier solicitante que no sea ciudadano del país de la vacante estará sujeto al cumplimiento de los requisitos de inmigración aplicables para trabajar legalmente en ese país.

4263093691,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/qc-data-reviewer-at-pqe-group-4263093691?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=wUqHhQbl5CnBhHsA4mqQQw%3D%3D&trackingId=cqQEA4b2hl1xdUqv%2FGKcDQ%3D%3D,QC Data Reviewer,PQE Group,Greater Rome Metropolitan Area,"Sei pronto per entrare a far parte di una società di consulenza leader mondiale nell'industria farmaceutica e dei Medical Device? PQE Group è affermata in questo settore dal 1998, garantendo una presenza internazionale grazie alle 45 filiali e i 2000 dipendenti in Europa, Asia e nelle Americhe.
Lavorare in una realtà di consulenza come PQE Group ti darà:
La possibilità di lavorare su progetti per le più importanti aziende farmaceutiche nazionali e internazionali acquisendo competenze trasversali e una visione ampia del settore
Il vantaggio di accrescere rapidamente la propria esperienza professionale grazie al supporto costante di un team multiculturale di professionisti provenienti da diverse discipline
L'occasione di sviluppare le tue capacità di adattabilità e project management per adattarti rapidamente ai cambiamenti della consulenza, consentendoti di affrontare sfide sempre diverse
L'opportunità di viaggiare a livello nazionale e internazionale

Il nostro team di Laboratory Excellence è sempre in una fase di grande crescita grazie ad un mercato in continua evoluzione che sempre più richiede la qualità dei nostri servizi. Per questo motivo abbiamo la possibilità di coinvolgere altre figure di Quality Control Analyst all'interno della nostra sede di Roma.
Svolgere attività di revisione critica dei dati analitici generati dal laboratorio, valutandone la correttezza, la completezza e la coerenza con le procedure vigenti.
Collaborare attivamente con il team per identificare eventuali anomalie o deviazioni e supportare le attività di troubleshooting e miglioramento continuo.
Operare in team ma con una forte autonomia gestionale e senso di responsabilità, contribuendo al mantenimento degli standard di qualità del laboratorio.
Garantire l’inserimento accurato dei dati analitici e la gestione dei campioni tramite software dedicati (SAP, LIMS).
Utilizzare Empower 3 (FR2/FR5) per la gestione dei metodi strumentali e la revisione dei dati.
Lavorare in conformità con le normative GMP e i requisiti di Data Integrity, assicurando la piena tracciabilità e affidabilità dei dati prodotti.
Laurea in discipline scientifiche (CTF, Chimica, Farmacia, Scienze Biologiche o equivalenti).
Esperienza di 2-3 anni in laboratorio QC chimico o biochimico, preferibilmente in contesto GMP.
Solida competenza nell’uso di strumentazione analitica cromatografica (HPLC/UPLC/GC) e spettrofotometrica (UV/IR).
Familiarità con software di gestione dati strumentali (Empower 3) e sistemi LIMS.
Spiccata attenzione al dettaglio e forte orientamento alla revisione accurata di dati analitici.
Conoscenza approfondita dei Data Integrity Standards.
Disponibilità a lavorare su turni, se richiesto.
Travel bonus per le missioni presso i clienti

Dopo aver ricevuto la tua candidatura, se verrà individuata una corrispondenza, il reparto Risorse Umane ti contatterà per un colloquio HR iniziale. Se il colloquio sarà positivo, verrà organizzato un colloquio tecnico con il responsabile delle assunzioni. In caso di esito positivo del colloquio con il responsabile, il recruiter ti contatterà per discutere i passi successivi o la nostra proposta. In alternativa, in caso di esito negativo, ti contatteremo per interrompere il processo di selezione.

Come membro del team PQE, farai parte di un'azienda stimolante e multiculturale che valorizza la collaborazione e l'innovazione. PQE Group ti offre l'opportunità di lavorare su progetti internazionali, migliorare le tue competenze e interagire con colleghi da tutto il mondo. Se cerchi una carriera appagante ed entusiasmante, PQE Group è il posto perfetto per te. Candidati ora e fai il primo passo verso un futuro straordinario con noi.

Sei pronto per entrare a far parte di una società di consulenza leader mondiale nell'industria farmaceutica e dei Medical Device? Il nostro team di Laboratory Excellence è sempre in una fase di grande crescita grazie ad un mercato in continua evoluzione che sempre più richiede la qualità dei nostri servizi. Per questo motivo abbiamo la possibilità di coinvolgere altre figure di Quality Control Analyst all'interno della nostra sede di Roma.



Le principali attività saranno:


  • Svolgere attività di revisione critica dei dati analitici generati dal laboratorio, valutandone la correttezza, la completezza e la coerenza con le procedure vigenti.
  • Collaborare attivamente con il team per identificare eventuali anomalie o deviazioni e supportare le attività di troubleshooting e miglioramento continuo.

  • Lavorare in conformità con le normative GMP e i requisiti di Data Integrity, assicurando la piena tracciabilità e affidabilità dei dati prodotti.




A proposito di te:

  • Familiarità con software di gestione dati strumentali (Empower 3) e sistemi LIMS.
  • Spiccata attenzione al dettaglio e forte orientamento alla revisione accurata di dati analitici.
  • Conoscenza approfondita dei Data Integrity Standards.
  • Disponibilità a lavorare su turni, se richiesto.



La nostra offerta:


  • Contratto a tempo indeterminato
  • Retribuzione commisurata all'esperienza
  • Travel bonus per le missioni presso i clienti

Disponibilità per trasferte: 70%

4269916948,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/freelance-ai-agent-assistant-at-mindrift-4269916948?position=24&pageNum=0&refId=wUqHhQbl5CnBhHsA4mqQQw%3D%3D&trackingId=Q7%2FawCjwsvaeTqBZcvvG9A%3D%3D,Freelance AI Agent Assistant,Mindrift,"Rome, Latium, Italy","At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

If you're a professional who works with AI Data Annotation and friendly user of LLMs, Mindrift offers a unique opportunity to apply your editing, annotating, fact-checking and creative skills to an AI training project.
This is a freelance role for a project, and your typical tasks may include:
Conduct high-quality web searches to verify facts, gather supporting data, and cross-check AI responses.
Perform fact-checking and intent verification to ensure AI responses align with the user's goals.
Carefully review and flag any inaccuracies, inconsistencies, or irrelevant answers.
Provide structured feedback on AI-generated content to help improve model performance.
Work effectively with large language models (LLMs), understanding their capabilities and limitations, and applying best practices when interacting with them
Prompt generation with a purpose to receive the best quality result of LLMs

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.
You are currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's degree or higher
You have professional and/or educational experience in data annotation, demonstrate a deeper-than-user-level interest in AI, and possess intellectual breadth and curiosity
You are skilled in web searching, fact-checking, intent-checking, able to work with LLMs and have great attention to detail
Your level of English is upper-intermediate (B2) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge
Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?
Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

If you're a professional who works with AI Data Annotation and friendly user of LLMs, Mindrift offers a unique opportunity to apply your editing, annotating, fact-checking and creative skills to an AI training project.

This is a freelance role for a project, and your typical tasks may include:

  • Conduct high-quality web searches to verify facts, gather supporting data, and cross-check AI responses.
  • Perform fact-checking and intent verification to ensure AI responses align with the user's goals.
  • Carefully review and flag any inaccuracies, inconsistencies, or irrelevant answers.
  • Provide structured feedback on AI-generated content to help improve model performance.
  • Work effectively with large language models (LLMs), understanding their capabilities and limitations, and applying best practices when interacting with them
  • Prompt generation with a purpose to receive the best quality result of LLMs

How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements

  • You are currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's degree or higher
  • You have professional and/or educational experience in data annotation, demonstrate a deeper-than-user-level interest in AI, and possess intellectual breadth and curiosity
  • You are skilled in web searching, fact-checking, intent-checking, able to work with LLMs and have great attention to detail
  • Your level of English is upper-intermediate (B2) or above
  • You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
  • Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge

Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

  • Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
  • Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
  • Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

The position is based in our HQ in Rome and part of the Global team.

The Data Scientist's mission is to empower Fendi with data-driven insights that fuel strategic decision-making, enhance customer understanding, and drive business growth. By leveraging analytical expertise and a deep understanding of the business, the Data Scientist's will identify opportunities for optimization, improve operational efficiency, and contribute to Fendi's continued success in the luxury fashion market.

As part of the LVMH Group, this role also involves collaborating and interfacing with other entities within the group, providing a broader perspective and exposure to a diverse range of business challenges and opportunities.
Proficiency in machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms with a strong understanding of their practical applications.
Design, develop, and deploy AI/ML models to address complex business challenges, optimize operational efficiency, and deliver actionable strategic insights.

Expertise in analyzing large, diverse datasets using advanced statistical and AI techniques to identify key trends, patterns, and correlations, transforming these insights into clear, data-driven recommendations for business stakeholders.
Proven experience working with customer and sales data, particularly within a retail/consumer environment, to drive targeted business outcomes.
Expertise in data collection, cleansing, and comprehensive analysis of large datasets from various sources, including customer, sales, and operational data repositories.
Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to address specific business inquiries and support informed decision-making processes across the organization.
Measure the impact and effectiveness of strategic initiatives and marketing campaigns using appropriate metrics and rigorous statistical methodologies.
Measure the results of initiatives and campaigns using appropriate metrics and statistical methods.
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into clear, well-defined data analysis projects.
Communicate complex findings, insights, and strategic recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner.
Actively participate in cross-functional projects, providing data-driven insights and support for key business initiatives.
Manage relationships with data vendors, ensuring service level agreements (SLAs) are met and data quality is maintained.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in a data scientist role.
Proficiency in Python and R programming languages.
Experience with data visualization tools, mainly Power BI.
Strong SQL skills and experience with relational databases.
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Knowledge of statistical modelling techniques. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team and perform under pressure in a fast-paced.
Evidence of successful delivery of data driven analysis and recommendations to drive forward business performance.
Critical thinking and attention to detail, extremely organized and high attention to luxury and detail
Demonstrated interest in keeping up with emerging technologies and the data trend.
Fluency in English and Italian are a mus
LVMH is committed to non-discrimination and respect of each person’s singularities. We recognize and recruit all types of talent

Position

Data Scientist

Job Responsibilities

The position is based in our HQ in Rome and part of the Global team.

The Data Scientist's mission is to empower Fendi with data-driven insights that fuel strategic decision-making, enhance customer understanding, and drive business growth. By leveraging analytical expertise and a deep understanding of the business, the Data Scientist's will identify opportunities for optimization, improve operational efficiency, and contribute to Fendi's continued success in the luxury fashion market.

As part of the LVMH Group, this role also involves collaborating and interfacing with other entities within the group, providing a broader perspective and exposure to a diverse range of business challenges and opportunities.

Main Responsibilities

  • Proficiency in machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms with a strong understanding of their practical applications.
  • Design, develop, and deploy AI/ML models to address complex business challenges, optimize operational efficiency, and deliver actionable strategic insights.
  • Expertise in analyzing large, diverse datasets using advanced statistical and AI techniques to identify key trends, patterns, and correlations, transforming these insights into clear, data-driven recommendations for business stakeholders.
  • Proven experience working with customer and sales data, particularly within a retail/consumer environment, to drive targeted business outcomes.
  • Expertise in data collection, cleansing, and comprehensive analysis of large datasets from various sources, including customer, sales, and operational data repositories.
  • Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to address specific business inquiries and support informed decision-making processes across the organization.
  • Measure the impact and effectiveness of strategic initiatives and marketing campaigns using appropriate metrics and rigorous statistical methodologies.
  • Measure the results of initiatives and campaigns using appropriate metrics and statistical methods.
  • Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into clear, well-defined data analysis projects.
  • Communicate complex findings, insights, and strategic recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner.
  • Actively participate in cross-functional projects, providing data-driven insights and support for key business initiatives.
  • Manage relationships with data vendors, ensuring service level agreements (SLAs) are met and data quality is maintained.

Profile

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
  • 3-5 years of experience in a data scientist role.
  • Proficiency in Python and R programming languages.
  • Experience with data visualization tools, mainly Power BI.
  • Preferably experience with Dataiku.
  • Strong SQL skills and experience with relational databases.
  • Familiarity with cloud computing platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
  • Knowledge of statistical modelling techniques. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team and perform under pressure in a fast-paced.
  • Evidence of successful delivery of data driven analysis and recommendations to drive forward business performance.
  • Critical thinking and attention to detail, extremely organized and high attention to luxury and detail
  • Demonstrated interest in keeping up with emerging technologies and the data trend.
  • Fluency in English and Italian are a mus

Additional Information

LVMH is committed to non-discrimination and respect of each person’s singularities. We recognize and recruit all types of talent

4253446322,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-engineer-fabric-stage-at-kepleria-4253446322?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=wUqHhQbl5CnBhHsA4mqQQw%3D%3D&trackingId=Cl0qiVIIqFX%2FdLQnVKhtvQ%3D%3D,Junior Data Engineer (Fabric) - Stage,KepleriA,"Frascati, Latium, Italy","KepleriA sta cercando giovani neodiplomati/neolaureati/laureandi da inserire in stage per formare le nuove generazioni di Data Engineer presso la nostra sede di Roma e Milano.
Sei la persona giusta? Leggi l’annuncio e aiutaci a conoscerti inviandoci il tuo curriculum
Il contesto di cui farai parte

Kepleria società del Gruppo Altea Federation focalizzata sull'innovazione e la trasformazione digitale, si configura come uno dei principali player italiani in questo settore, con un’esperienza consolidata e pluriennale in progetti di Data Management, Business Intelligence e Planning.

Attraverso strumenti avanzati di elaborazione dei dati, accompagna i propri clienti nel viaggio per diventare “data driven company”. Tramite soluzioni Analytics, expertise di industry e processo, utilizza le tecnologie più solide e innovative per estrarre valore dai dati e metterli a disposizione a tutti i livelli dell’organizzazione, al fine di liberare nuove potenzialità e orientare le decisioni in un’ottica ispirata alla massima efficacia ed efficienza, oltre che al cost-saving.
Ogni progetto di trasformazione digitale intrapreso utilizza modelli di business agili, sostenibili e adattivi.

Siamo una FREE PLACE COMPANY, quindi operiamo da dove è più opportuno lavorare (casa, ufficio, cliente), in funzione degli obiettivi da perseguire, condividendoli con i propri riferimenti di progetto o di unità organizzativa.
3 cose che devi sapere in 3 hashtag
Hai già una Laurea o ti stai per Laureare in Informatica/ingegneria Informatica/Statistica? Sei un neodiplomato volenteroso e brillante?
Se sei un tipo grintoso e ami lavorare in team, allora il mondo della Consulenza fa per te.
La risorsa in stage sarà affiancata da un senior data engineer per essere formato su Fabric, piattaforma di analisi, integrazione e gestione dati, basata sul Cloud

Sarai inizialmente inserito nell'attività di affiancamento nonchè di formazione sulle soluzioni offerte dalla piattaforma, imparando a progettare soluzioni di dati di valore nel rispetto della fattibilità tecnico-economica.
Il percorso sarà di tipo tecnico e verrai inserito in un team che ha obiettivi di innovazione tecnologica e di sviluppo di nuove soluzioni per il mercato e la delivery.

Il prodotto su cui lavorerai è parte di un ecosistema di soluzioni Microsoft in continua evoluzione e quindi un atteggiamento critico e di apertura verso il cambiamento rappresentano dei fattori importanti.
Sei La Persona Che Fa Per Noi Se
sei un Neolaureato/Laureando in Informatica oppure in Matematica, Statistica, percorsi analoghi/neodiplomato
hai familiarità con il pacchetto Office e utilizzi molto bene Excel (livello avanzato)
conosci o hai dato esami inerenti al mondo degli ERP
hai avuto una precedente esperienza, anche breve, in azienda o società di consulenza
sei disponibile a trasferte presso il cliente, quando necessario
possiedi una buona conoscenza della lingua inglese
hai passione per la tecnologia e l’innovazione
Il WorkLifeBalance è un continuo impegno per ogni uno di noi
column2: KepleriA promuove una politica del lavoro “sostenibile” ponendo attenzione sia all’ecologia sia alla dimensione sociale. Lo smartworking concorre al raggiungimento di questo intento, dando la possibilità ad ognuno di noi di gestire al meglio la necessità di lavoro individuale.

column1: Avrai l’opportunità di accedere tramite la piattaforma interna di eLearning a piani formativi personalizzati e dedicati allo sviluppo delle competenze (hard & soft) per aiutarti ed accompagnarti nel tuo percorso di crescita professionale.
E ancora molto altro … ready to join us?
Altea Federation è una realtà aziendale Covey compliant.

Secondo Stephen Covey, uno dei più importanti studiosi a livello mondiale delle tematiche dell’efficacia e della crescita personale, sono 7 le abitudini (#7 Habits) che distinguono le persone altamente efficaci. In altre parole, assertività, empatia, team working, capacità di costruire relazioni. Gestirai situazioni complesse e ti interfaccerai con molteplici attori.
Le tue abilità relazionali faranno fortemente la differenza nel raggiungimento degli obiettivi di progetto.
Entra nella nostra squadra e scrivi la tua storia in Altea Federation!
AlteaFederation sostiene ed incoraggia le differenze, a vantaggio della nostra comunità di A-People e di tutte le Company della Federation.
Siamo orgogliosamente per la non discriminazione e per le pari opportunità e crediamo nel rispetto di tutte le leggi applicabili in materia.
Se hai una disabilità o una necessità speciale, non esitare a candidarti: per noi ogni differenza è una ricchezza!

4264603921,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-artificial-intelligence-data-at-deloitte-4264603921?position=30&pageNum=0&refId=wUqHhQbl5CnBhHsA4mqQQw%3D%3D&trackingId=rH0wBHN%2FsCPJZi6tkbeZsw%3D%3D,Junior - Artificial Intelligence & Data,Deloitte,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Junior – Artificial Intelligence and Data – Roma
Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team di Artificial Intelligence and Data di Deloitte Consulting nella sede di Roma, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Nel Team di Artificial Intelligence & Data avrai l’occasione di aiutare, in ambito Analytics, le aziende a valorizzare i dati provenienti da fonti eterogenee trasformandoli in informazioni accurate e immediatamente utilizzabili, elementi indispensabili per quelle aziende che vogliono fare decision-making fact-driven. La Offering Artificial Intelligence & Data è pertanto l’opzione best in class nell’individuazione, progettazione e implementazione di soluzioni di Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Data Visualization, Big Data Management, con un approccio agnostico dal punto di vista tecnologico.
La risorsa Junior sarà inserita in un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:
Interpretare proattivamente i bisogni del cliente, individuando metodologie e approcci coerenti
Sviluppare iniziative e soluzioni in modo indipendente, raccogliendo ed analizzando dati a supporto dell’elaborazione di soluzioni per i clienti
Elaborare teaser e presentazioni per supportare il top management
Individuare potenziali rischi e criticità e condividerli tempestivamente con il resto del team
Collaborare efficacemente in team eterogenei ed internazionali
Brillante percorso accademico con laurea specialistica in materie STEM
Familiarità con la modellazione e linguaggio di interrogazione dei data base
column2: conoscenza di uno o più linguaggi di accesso al dato e programmazione (Python, R, Java, SQL)
column3: ottima conoscenza degli applicativi MS Word, MS Excel e MS Power Point
column4: nozioni accademiche di modelli statistici per l’analisi dei dati

column1: Forte propensione/interesse per le nuove tecnologie e per l’informatica

Elevata attitudine a lavorare sia autonomamente che in team, capacità analitiche e di problem solving, gestione dello stress, flessibilità, precisione e uno spiccato orientamento al raggiungimento dei risultati

column2: disponibilità a lavorare in trasferta, anche all’estero

column1: To Make An Impact That Matters
Il network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in più di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone.

In Italia, Deloitte è presente in 24 città con circa 13.400 persone che assistono i clienti offrendo servizi di Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformation, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory e Tax & Legal.

In qualità di network globale ci impegniamo per affrontare le principali sfide sociali, economiche e ambientali della società di oggi. WordImpact è il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l’ambiente e le comunità in cui operiamo.

Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che – in collaborazione con istituzioni, realtà del terzo settore, università e altri soggetti – hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

Junior – Artificial Intelligence and Data – Roma

Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team di Artificial Intelligence and Data di Deloitte Consulting nella sede di Roma, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Your Role

  • Interpretare proattivamente i bisogni del cliente, individuando metodologie e approcci coerenti
  • Sviluppare iniziative e soluzioni in modo indipendente, raccogliendo ed analizzando dati a supporto dell’elaborazione di soluzioni per i clienti

  • Individuare potenziali rischi e criticità e condividerli tempestivamente con il resto del team

Winning Requirements

  • Brillante percorso accademico con laurea specialistica in materie STEM
  • Familiarità con la modellazione e linguaggio di interrogazione dei data base

4074546905,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analytics-engineer-at-immobiliare-it-4074546905?position=34&pageNum=0&refId=wUqHhQbl5CnBhHsA4mqQQw%3D%3D&trackingId=5iCdNfRT%2BmtHaBoFJAXyIQ%3D%3D,Junior Data Analytics Engineer,Immobiliare.it,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Immobiliare.it S.p.A. is an Italian group composed of companies specializing in Digital Tech services for the sale and rental of real estate, aimed at individuals, real estate professionals, banking institutions and financial sector operators.

Founded in 2005, Immobiliare.it, the No. 1 real estate portal in Italy, has expanded its offering with specialized portals such as Trovacasa.it, MioAffitto and LuxuryEstate.com, dedicated to luxury properties.

Immobiliare.it Insights, the company's proptech division, offers digital advisory, insights and data diligence services to banks, investors and appraisers. A leading player in Italy in the mortgage sector, the group includes Immobiliare.it Mutui, specializing in remote credit brokerage, Euroansa with a network of over 800 credit brokers throughout the country and Genio Diligence, a company focused on credit risk and fraud prevention for brokers and financial institutions. The group is also present in foreign markets in Spain (Pisos.com, Indomio.es and Enalquiler.com), Greece (Spitogatos.gr, Indomio.gr), Slovenia (Nekretnine.net) and Croatia (Crozilla.com and Indomio.hr).
We are looking for a Junior Data Analytics Engineer to join our Marketing team.
marketing analytics: measurement of marketing campaigns with a focus on causality, optimization and data-driven decision-making
data management and architecture: data warehousing and big data analytics using cloud technologies (GCP, AWS) and open-source tools (Airflow, dataform, dbt)
data pipelines: design and manage reliable marketing data pipelines to provide new insights and detect threats and opportunities

data products: build end-to-end marketing data products combining internal data with several external sources like market and industry trends (e.g. market data, Google searches, online research) and competitive intelligence tools (e.g. Similarweb, data.ai, Semrush).
new graduate in Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Physics
analytical mindset with a problem solving approach
curious and passionate about marketing and tech platforms
fluent in English and working knowledge of Italian.
Our team is responsible for all marketing activities of our Group: Immobiliare.it (Italy), Indomio.es (Spain), Immotop.lu (Luxembourg), Crozilla.com (Croatia) and LuxuryEstate (Global)

performance marketing: we design, create and manage campaigns with different business objectives (e.g. user acquisition and engagement, lead generation and brand awareness). We are one of the top advertisers in our markets, we collaborate with the best partners and our strong relationship with them allow us to develop ad-hoc projects and to access new features, products and technologies before they’re widely released

analytics: Our products generate hundreds of millions of events every day, by analysing these interactions we can learn about our customers and their experience, optimise marketing investments, uncover new opportunities, and support data-driven decision-making.

market and competitor insights: we study the real estate market and our industry to uncover emerging trends, discover business opportunities and forecast demand as accurately as possible to stay ahead of the curve
projects: we drive growth, operational and technological improvements working cross-team and cross-competence (Tech, Product, Sales, PR & Content teams).
a young and dynamic work environment
an opportunity in a fast-growing company
paid internship contract or fixed contract
free coffee and fresh fruit every day
break room with a foosball table
office located in the centre of Rome (Termini).
This announcement is addressed to people of any sex, pursuant to laws 903/77 and 125/91, and to people of all ages and all nationalities, pursuant to legislative decrees 215/03 and 216/03.

Immobiliare.it S.p.A. is an Italian group composed of companies specializing in Digital Tech services for the sale and rental of real estate, aimed at individuals, real estate professionals, banking institutions and financial sector operators.


Founded in 2005, Immobiliare.it, the No. 1 real estate portal in Italy, has expanded its offering with specialized portals such as Trovacasa.it, MioAffitto and LuxuryEstate.com, dedicated to luxury properties.

A leading player in Italy in the mortgage sector, the group includes Immobiliare.it Mutui, specializing in remote credit brokerage, Euroansa with a network of over 800 credit brokers throughout the country and Genio Diligence, a company focused on credit risk and fraud prevention for brokers and financial institutions. The group is also present in foreign markets in Spain (Pisos.com, Indomio.es and Enalquiler.com), Greece (Spitogatos.gr, Indomio.gr), Slovenia (Nekretnine.net) and Croatia (Crozilla.com and Indomio.hr).

4265145300,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analyst-analista-funzionale-roma-at-double-consulting-4265145300?position=35&pageNum=0&refId=wUqHhQbl5CnBhHsA4mqQQw%3D%3D&trackingId=WS%2BkT7zLxOiglWWKqLuBIA%3D%3D,Analyst (Analista Funzionale) - Roma,Double Consulting,Greater Rome Metropolitan Area,"Double Consulting nasce nel giugno 2005 dall’iniziativa di professionisti provenienti da aziende multinazionali, leader nel mondo della consulenza. DBC lavora a fianco dei suoi clienti aiutandoli a gestire il cambiamento e l’innovazione per sostenere il loro vantaggio competitivo attraverso un approccio end-to-end dal disegno alla messa a terra della soluzione.
Double è focalizzata sul mercato dei Financial Services ma l’azienda opera anche nel settore Energy & Utilities e nell'Automotive.

Da Aprile 2022 Double Consulting fa parte del Gruppo Lynx, system integrator italiano specializzato nella progettazione e realizzazione di soluzioni informatiche a supporto di grandi realtà, partecipato dal Fondo Strategico Italiano che conta numerosi sedi in Italia, Spagna e Latin America.
Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa brillante da inserire nella Business Unit ""Consulting"" nel ruolo di:
La risorsa selezionata verrà inserita all'interno di un progetto per noto Cliente specializzato nel mondo delle certificazioni su Roma.
Raccolta e definizione dei requisiti di business
Analisi di eventuali anomalie di funzionamento dei sistemi informativi
Supporto ai team di sviluppo nelle fasi di sviluppo e validazione del software
Esperienza minima necessari di almeno 6 mesi/ un anno in Società di Consulenza
Conoscenza avanzata dei principali applicativi Microsoft (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access)
Esperienza pregressa preferibilmente nell’ambito di progetti che prevedano l’interfaccia con il team di sviluppo
Laurea in discipline economiche o gestionali, eventuali Master o Corsi di specializzazione e/o certificazioni inerenti saranno considerate un plus
Standing complessivo di buon livello, proattività, capacità di problem solving, orientamento al team working
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese che verrà valutata in fase di colloquio
Roma con possibilità di Smart Working

L'annuncio è rivolto a tutti i candidati, nel rispetto del principio di uguaglianza e di non discriminazione senza distinzione di genere, razza, origine etnica, religione o orientamento sessuale. (art. 3 Cost.

Double Consulting si impegna a promuovere la parità di genere e ad abbracciare la diversità e l'inclusione. Crediamo fermamente che un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e diversificato sia fondamentale per l'innovazione e il successo della nostra organizzazione.

A decorrere dal 25 maggio 2018 è operativo il Regolamento UE 2016/679 in materia di protezione dei dati personali (“GDPR”) che si aggiunge al precedente D.lgs. 196/2003 sulla tutela delle persone e di altri soggetti rispetto al trattamento dei dati personali.

3761164298,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analytics-business-analyst-at-dxc-technology-3761164298?position=39&pageNum=0&refId=wUqHhQbl5CnBhHsA4mqQQw%3D%3D&trackingId=diEEHjFBhmyRtE1TOFY3uQ%3D%3D,Analytics Business Analyst,DXC Technology,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Job Description
DXC Technology is looking for Analytics Business Analyst to join Analytics DXC Offering.

DXC Analytics is focused on providing customers innovative solutions and high added value, in the following areas: Analytics Solutions and Services, Big Data Platforms, Information Governance, Business Intelligence & Data Management, Artificial Intelligence and IoT Analytics.
Interact with clients in order to identify customer needs and translate them into requirements
Collaborate with technical team, project manager and contribute to delivery activities during design, develop and maintenance of the solutions
Design modern and scalable data architecture, to implement Business Intelligence reporting and technical/functional specifications
Prioritizes the workload ensuring on time and on budget deliverables
Consolidated - at least 5 years - professional experience on BI/DWH projects
Strong Experience on Data Modeling and on Advanced SQL
Attitude to modelling and understanding of the data and the client’s business
Nice to have: Bachelor’s degree in one of the following areas: Computer Science, Computer engineering, Mathematical Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Knowledge of Public Sector.

Being part of an highly-qualified team of 200 professionals with solid experience on Analytics Solutions and Services, Big Data Platforms, Information Governance, Business Intelligence & Data Management, Artificial Intelligence and IoT Analytics

From the first day, you will face with a reality that operates in more than 70 countries and formed through on the job training, technical training and soft skills, working inside a meritocratic reward system.

Thanks for taking the time to review our job, if you think it is a match to your experience and interests please apply today with CV in English - we are eager to learn more about you! If you know a friend who may be a fit for the job please refer them.
Location: Rome (RM) with remote work possibility

At DXC Technology, we believe strong connections and community are key to our success. Our work model prioritizes in-person collaboration while offering flexibility to support wellbeing, productivity, individual work styles, and life circumstances. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive.

Recruitment fraud is a scheme in which fictitious job opportunities are offered to job seekers typically through online services, such as false websites, or through unsolicited emails claiming to be from the company. These emails may request recipients to provide personal information or to make payments as part of their illegitimate recruiting process. DXC does not make offers of employment via social media networks and DXC never asks for any money or payments from applicants at any point in the recruitment process, nor ask a job seeker to purchase IT or other equipment on our behalf. More information on employment scams is available here.

4254104326,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-scientist-for-global-p-c-pricing-team-at-allianz-4254104326?position=40&pageNum=0&refId=wUqHhQbl5CnBhHsA4mqQQw%3D%3D&trackingId=udwYz%2FaLbArxSJGFdjB4mg%3D%3D,JUNIOR DATA SCIENTIST for Global P&C Pricing Team,Allianz,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Global P&C is an Allianz SE department established in 2011 as continuation of the Center of Competence project started in 2005. Its mission is supporting all Allianz P&C Entities to be outstanding in technical excellence by leveraging Allianz Capabilities.

Global P&C Pricing team is responsible for identifying, supporting implementation and ensuring standards, best practices and guidelines for data management, tariff development, portfolio analysis and monitoring. Specifically, the team oversees:

Joint projects with the Allianz local entities around the world: we collaborate with local entities on pricing projects concerning mainly technical pricing, behavioural models, price optimization, scenario analysis, development of pricing and portfolio management tools.
Research and development on Data & Analytics and tools to enhance the level of sophistication always considering the business relevance and impact
Knowledge sharing and training of best practices: we design and facilitate P&C Pricing Academy courses to the wide community of pricing analyst of Allianz Group.

Review activities: periodically we review the full pricing process of each local entity to ensure the standardization and harmonization of pricing processes and the implementation of best practices across the group.
Support the data ingestion, transformation, cleaning and exploration procedures
Structuring data science solutions to achieve a given set of business objectives
Build and prototype analysis and Machine Learning models and support their implementation and deployment in the systems of the company
Model customer’s behavior based on market and competitor’s analysis
Implement and enhance dashboards and business intelligence tools to support risk analysis and portfolio management
Doing Research and Development to find new technical solutions
Summarize, design and communicate effectively the results to both internal and external stakeholders
Act as teacher for internal Pricing Academy courses
PhD or Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or Engineering)
Fluent in Italian and English, written and spoken
Valued international experience in both academic and professional settings
Experience with Pandas or SQL for data manipulation and analysis
Familiarity with machine learning techniques like gradient boosting machines and linear models
Experience with PySpark for large-scale data processing would be an advantage
Passionate and skilled in data analysis and statistical modelling to support strategic decisions
Demonstrated ability to work effectively as part of a diverse, multicultural and multidisciplinary team

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.

At Allianz, we stand for unity: we believe that a united world is a more prosperous world, and we are dedicated to consistently advocating for equal opportunities for all. And the foundation for this is our inclusive workplace, where people and performance both matter, and nurtures a culture grounded in integrity, fairness, inclusion and trust.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, social class, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.
Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.
Both genders may apply in accordance with the L. 903/77 (s.m.i).

4274859239,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-roma-at-iconsulting-4274859239?position=41&pageNum=0&refId=wUqHhQbl5CnBhHsA4mqQQw%3D%3D&trackingId=3jIWCYhCd4g1unRFzp%2F9pw%3D%3D,Data Engineer_Roma,ICONSULTING,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Siamo una Data Driven Transformation & Consulting Company specializzata nel gestire e trasformare il più importante asset del mercato odierno: I Dati.

Grazie ad oltre 20 anni di esperienza e 500 dipendenti divisi in 4 sedi (Bologna HQ, Milano, Roma e Napoli) supportiamo l’evoluzione di grandi gruppi italiani operanti in tutti i principali settori, dal bancario al manifatturiero, passando per il Fashion, il Retail, l’Energy e le Telco senza dimenticare le grandi pubbliche amministrazioni centrali.

Il nostro portfolio progetti spazia da servizi di Advisory quali la realizzazione di Data Strategy fino ad attività di implementazione con il design e la realizzazione di soluzioni di Business Analytics, Big Data Platform & Artificial Intelligence.

Siamo un’azienda dinamica, con un Dna che si è plasmato in questi anni grazie al fatto di aver coltivato oltre l’80% delle nostre risorse dall’università, e in continua trasformazione così come il mercato in cui operiamo e del quale siamo fra i player più riconosciuti e grandi del panorama italiano.
Iconsulting è alla ricerca di talentuosi neolaureati da inserire nei team di progetto con il ruolo di Data Engineer.

Entrando a far parte della nostra squadra, avrai l'opportunità di lavorare a stretto contatto con un team di esperti su progetti innovativi e tecnicamente avanzati nell'ambito dati, con l’obiettivo di aiutare i clienti a sviluppare le loro strategie IT.

Al tuo ingresso in Azienda riceverai una formazione strutturata e sarai supportato da un tutor dedicato che ti guiderà nell'apprendimento delle principali tecnologie di mercato e ti aiuterà a sviluppare le competenze necessarie.
Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria Informatica o Informatica
Esperienza pratica con database relazionali e competenza nell'utilizzo di SQL
Una buona conoscenza dei linguaggi Python e Java
Conoscenza preferenziale in ambito Data integration e Database (Relazionali es. MySql)
Interesse per le tecnologie NoSQL e Big Data
Preferibile familiarità con strumenti di Data Visualization come Tableau, Power BI o Qlik
Curiosità, voglia di imparare, proattività e interesse per i principali trend tecnologici del momento
Ai candidati selezionati verrà offerto un percorso di sviluppo di carriera e crescita strutturato per obiettivi, con processi formativi sia in ambito tech sia in ambito soft skills.

Nel pacchetto retributivo sono compresi assicurazione medica integrativa, buoni pasto, welfare e convenzioni dipendenti usufruibili su tutto il territorio nazionale, dotazioni integrative per lo smart working.
Sede di lavoro: Roma o Napoli. E' previsto lo smart working.

    Cosa offriamo ai candidati?

    Ai candidati selezionati verrà offerto un percorso di sviluppo di carriera e crescita strutturato per obiettivi, con processi formativi sia in ambito tech sia in ambito soft skills.

    Nel pacchetto retributivo sono compresi assicurazione medica integrativa, buoni pasto, welfare e convenzioni dipendenti usufruibili su tutto il territorio nazionale, dotazioni integrative per lo smart working.

    Sede di lavoro: Roma o Napoli. E' previsto lo smart working.
